The actors are all bad. He is the worst of all.The bed scenes are too long, boring and there are too many.It has the typical sequence change television plans. What a pity.The photograph of serious bad American.What direction. Put the camera on the general plane and let things go. Some insert and medium plane and arranged.But there you have it, still in rooms and making money.

reviews.review_title: Personally, I do not like it
reviews.content: Of course, I am convinced that if this film had been made, Malick, Lynch, or some other director, of these so-called authors, this film would have been a film that the great critics would have elevated. I do not have any doubt.The movie is of a calculating mind, it is not a commercial film. That is precisely why it either elevates you or sinks you. In this case he had the bad luck that it sank him.Actually I do not know if it's a scary movie or a drama or a madness. I do not know what the director would want. It gives me more that it is a drama, but the fact is that when the moment arrives at the door, it is not scary and it seems strange to me that everything suddenly becomes so crazy.The actors are like everyone in their world, they are not on par, some crazy others, but of course that can not be.The photograph, I was seeing it and I was imagining the colorist with the program saturating with white. For my taste it has happened, but I've seen that in so many films that are not named as the worst in history.The address, I do not like it, but it does not seem like the worst I've seen. The plans are simple and do not narrate, but that is usual. Sometimes it makes angular planes and in the same tele objective sequence. The film does not have a logic, but I've seen it many times.I think it's not the worst movie in history by far.

Okay, let me ask you a question. Have you ever watched a film that is clearly awful, yet still enjoyed it? Well, that is my view on The Room. It has everything that a bad film is built up of; terrible acting, awful plot, insanely poor CGI. Yet, despite all this the movie does one thing that very few films I have ever saw can do. It makes me laugh for at least 90 of the 99 minutes. It is just one of those films that you can watch and watch and watch and it never gets old! Tommy Wiseau (the writer, director, producer, tea lady, raver and cheesy quaver)claims that the film was meant to be exactly how it is..... Aye, right Tommy! The film is funny because clearly it was meant to be serious, and it turned out to be a joke. After starring in this film, i'm surprised that any of the actors managed to get another job. To put it simply, watch this film, reflect on it and then pass on the good word... oh and don't forget to look out for the spoons and the cancer.

reviews.review_title: The Worst Movie I have EVER SEEN!
reviews.content: Spoiler Alert - Tommy Wiseau can't write, can't act, and can't direct. The best actor in this movie was the Thug with the gun! HE was right on. Tommy's fake laughs in the movie were annoying. The acting was horrid, the story line LAME, and entirely too many inconsistencies, and too many continuity issues! Don't waste your time! The movie would have been much more enjoyable had more attention to line delivery. It was like the actors were reading the lines from cue cards. It was very odd to see the characters smile, when they should have had looks of concern. I realize these are merely my opinions, but when you watch this movie with a few friends, and they have the same opinion, it must mean that this movie really bites...

reviews.review_title: YOU ARE TEARING ME APART, LISA!
reviews.content: I am sooooo glad that I watched "The Disaster Artist" first! That movie made me realize what a horrible gem that this one is! Yes the acting is horrible, but it's the script and editing that really strangle this one! I had no idea where the characters were, where they were going, or where they had come from! Just a crazy mess of a film! And Tommy's creep three laugh chuckle (ha, ha, ha...)! Geez! He's like a cross of Hannibal Lecter's face, Vincent Vega's hair and clothing, and Frankenstein's monster's movements! Then add the Tommy accent! Bingo - Johnny! Ahh... what a disaster!Johnny walks to the apartment rooftopJohnny: I did not hit her, it's not true! It's bullshit! I did not hit her! throws water bottleJohnny: I did *not*. Oh hi, Mark. Mark: Oh, hey Johnny, what's up?

reviews.review_title: Screw Citizen Kane this is the greatest film in cinematic history
reviews.content: You all know about this movie, is there's much to be said about it that's others have not already stated. Tommy Wiseau is an international treasure who must be protected at all costs . It does suck though that he knows people believe this film is so bad it's good that now his recent projects like The Neighbours have been intentionally bad and therefore losing its comedic effect. Like I said before though there isn't to much to be said that the lovely people of the internet have not already said about this masterpiece. If you haven't seen it yet please do. Everyone needs to experience this masterpiece at least once in their lives.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I have ever seen!
reviews.content: This is the worst movie I have ever seen in my life!The acting is terrible, the plot is terrible, random characters popping in and out, sound quality is terrible, music and score are equally terrible, the editing is terrible, the sex scenes are terrible...Here's the plot: A guy is living with his fiancé. She starts having an affair and falls in love with his fiancés best friend. Eventually everyone finds out and bad things happen, fights ensue, etc.This movie doesn't have a single redeeming frame. I'm trying to save you your valuable time. Nothing is worth watching here, the dialogue is awful, the lighting, the wardrobes, etc.How does this "movie" have fans? (they might be the director/actors friends and family trying to boost up his work with good reviews).Stay away from this so called movie. It's a mentally challenged attempt at being a movie. Idon't think I've ever seen a TV show that is worse than this.

Yes, of course I've seen this film before. This review is kind of just for the books, because I've decided to write my cult film essay on it, so I had to rewatch it.And you probably already know what I'm going to say, including, but not limited to:The acting is pants throughout, from everyone, nearly all the time, but especially the auteur himself, Tommy Wiseau.You could cut out something like two thirds of what passes for this film's "narrative" to no effect, because it is casually dropping new plot points and characters that go nowhere and are never heard from again right up until the final scene.It's so poorly directed that I wouldn't be surprised at all if 95% of Tommy's directing was him saying "okay, now big emotions! Very good, hahahaha", followed shortly by "Action!", and there are absolutely zero interesting shots, unless you count the times that the camera was out of focus.The soundtrack is godawful, sounding straight out of a 1980s straight to video porn, or maybe a 2000s straight to television romcom. Either or.The dialogue is...perfect.The sets are janky, never feel like what they're supposed to be, and feel like they'd fall apart if someone sneezed near them.The characters all act like what a seven year old who somehow knows exactly what things like sex, cancer, and psychiatry are thinks grown up life is like.And the pacing is as slow as a wheelchair on a gravel beach, mostly because of the aforementioned narrative being mostly comprised of characters being introduced and then forgotten about for long enough before the ending to make this feature length.And I absolutely adore it. Seriously, this is one of those films you have to see to believe. If you haven't, don't look up anything else about it. Just go watch it now, because I promise at the very least it will make you feel...something.For me, it soothed the fears I sometimes have of wondering whether I'm too nice/harsh on other films, because when I think about it, a lot of films, even if I think they're bad, do get a lot of things right, or at least competent. I don't tend to mention things like sets or pacing, but that's because a huge amount of films get those things right, so much so that sometimes I feel like I take it for granted. It takes a film this stupendously inept to remind me that if a film does get those things right, that's at least worthy of a little bit of praise.And on the other side of the coin, sometimes when I worry I'm being too nice for a film for having, say, characters that are at least consistent, even if I don't like them, I can think back on a film like The Room to remind myself that, no, that is in fact worth a little bit of credit.And sometimes when I worry that I should be getting on with other work because deadlines are on their way, I can think back on everything I've written here so far and stop dragging this review out.

This movie is underrated. It is so horribly directed and edited that actually becomes amazingly fun. I had a wonderful time watching it and laughed harder than most of comedies released lately. Totally worth watching it.

This film is lauded as a masterpiece in so bad its good, in fact its just plain bad. Poor writing, poor acting and just a generally poor story. I'll admit I laughed at a few scenes and just shook my head. Its worth watching just to see how bad it is.

reviews.review_title: So Bad it's Good doesn't carry The Room
reviews.content: The Room is well, it's unique. That's for sure. The first third has a very comedic, so bad it's good going for it. After that though there is rarely any scenes in The Room that are even slightly enjoyable. I do think some of it is funny, and I think the story itself wasn't that great to begin with. Overall, The Room is a good watch for those wanting to see cliche bad movies. Or, alternatively, those drunk.

reviews.review_title: A bonafide comedy classic... in a ironic way!
reviews.content: Tommy Wiseau had an interesting idea. A movie about a man who lives in what he think is a happy marriage, but is unaware of what his wife does behind his back and he slowly goes crazy... That could have been a alright melancholic movie. But what we got is something entirely different. And man am I glad over it. This movie is tip-top HILARIOUS! I didn't give it more than 8 because it still has a couple of slow moments, but I still had a smile on my cheek or laughed throughout the majority of the thing. This man had no idea what he was doing. Terrible dialogue, poorly written characters and even small details which just puzzle you. Not to mention the music used for the sex scenes is so godawful you can just shake your head. The lines are weird, they are delivered in a weird way and none of them adds for a dramatic composition. Even though Pulp Fiction is a masterpiece and this is unintentionally hilarious trash, both of those movies has a gastronormous quotability. This is a total landmark in cinema history and there has not been ONE movie more so-bad-it's-good than this one, because this one succeeded on that level in every way. It will be remembered and looked back at for ages. Wiseau... You are a genius. The people love you. *I* love you.

In case you didn't,this movie will explain how to execute a perfect-EXCITING EDGE OF YOUR SEAT ALL THRILLS NO FRILLS MEANINGFUL and INTELLIGENT life.....with lines like:"Hi Doggy." and "You are so sexy Lisa." (Oh Hai...HAhahaha..)And what would life as a man be without playing football in tuxedos...so relevant to my life :D.Tommy Wiseau shows his true talent here.After all,it's not A ROOM,it's THE ROOM...Do you know about life?Welp,watch it unfold here,professionally and with lovable characters such as Lisa,Johnny,DENNY Of course,oh and that old lady too,this is sure to keep you coming back for references on how to execute a well thought out conversation with everyday peeps just like you meet in Rooms each day...YOU WILL NEVER WALK INTO ANY ROOM WITHOUT A DEEPER PHILOSOPHICAL QUESTIONING AFTER WATCHING THIS."hi doggy..." "oh hi johnny,i didn't know it was you,here you go"-"Thanks,bye"..."it was a long day-very stressful"...OH AND A GREAT soundtrack....Thanks TW ;D

reviews.review_title: A Masterpiece made of Broken Pieces.
reviews.content: What makes The Room a complete and out-and-out classic, is that this movie cannot be replicated. The Room is a near perfect combination of a variety of badly executed elements coming together and forming a type of masterpiece, albeit accidentally, but still making this movie a spectacular gem nonetheless.The Room oddly and unintentionally maintains a sweet spot of terribleness with such consistency, poise, and authenticity, from the acting, the script, the directing, the wardrobe, the setting, and even the music, that it makes what is truly a dreadful and stupid movie, dreadful and stupid still, yet also remarkable and stupendous.The entire cast, with Tommy Wiseau being an absolute standout amongst a cast of standouts on their own, is a definite joy to watch, from beginning to end. The music, though bad, was more technically bad than actually bad, and the story is an age-old, that in any other movie would have felt cliché, but in this movie, it felt perfect.Undoubtedly, The Room is a badly made movie, with some scenes and shots that are repeated, sequence of events that are muddled at points, atrocious acting, abandoned sub-plots, and character developments that don't make much sense, but, even with all of its many and complete shortcomings and failures, The Room is fun, funny, and enjoyable throughout, and worth taking seriously to a fair degree, with Tommy Wiseau's very apparent fervor for his pet project, at the heart of this movie, grounding it in memory as a kind of broken masterpiece.8.7/10.P. S. Tom Ford, Dolce, Armani, Gucci, or any other top fashion designer and fashion house, have nothing on Johnny's suit and shoes. Nothing!

Cant believe this film had a budget of $6 000 000, the only thing that the money must have been on was re animating some dead people to play the parts.The lead roles Lisa and Johnny make Pinocchio look like Al Pachino.Only at Xmas do you see nonsense like this and it is generally by infants. Please watch this film as it is a total train crash, there is no plot, the script is dire, bizarre set locations (living room or the roof), music is a mixed bag and the icing on the cake Tommy Wiseau. I heard Tommy was Arnold Schwarzeneggers understudy but was fired for being wooden.Great line "Did you know that chocolate was the symbol of love".

People mocking this film should be ashamed. Surprised not to see this at the Oscars, Tommy Wiseau has created a somewhat unnoticed masterpiece. I've read other reviews from people that obviously don't appreciate the artistic integrity Tommy is using in his work. Lest not forget that he not just wrote this rhythm of poetic perfection, but he acted the main part emphatically too. I feel his hurt, he is acting the words he wrote, which in turn he felt. which i think is amazing. I believe he based the story on his previous experiences and it truly shows in his writing and his acting.This is a must watch film for anyone that likes similar films Forrest gump and starship troopers.

This is perhaps the worst movie ever made.I was told"watch it;it's so bad it's good".Yes,it had a few such moments early on;but after a while I was stunned by it's stupidity.It is shocking that anyone would put real money into a joke production like this.The script is pre-school level;the dialogue is atrocious and the acting is wooden.Worst of all is the 'writer/director/lead actor's' interview comments on the special features.He is truly very deluded;'a legend in his own mind'.You must see this movie;but don't be surprised if it gives you a headache or makes you sick to your stomach.You'll laugh,you'll cry.you'll wish you could have those 90 minutes back.

reviews.review_title: Once in a lifetime experience - A try at a metaphorical expression of "The room"s transcendental properties
reviews.content: I really, honestly, from the bottom of my heart feel, that this movie should get a ten star rating. Not on the grounds you would usually praise an, what is called "artistically achieved movie", that probably is the result of a controlled work-process and stems from underlying ideas about life, or some reshaped and refined account of certain deep experiences. The Room isn't even, as I was originally tempted to say, fascinating in the sense a natural disaster stuns you and leaves you awe-struck. More closely it resembles something that gets to you by its mere intricate, deeply nested strangeness- like a grotesque commercial that tries to appeal to people by showing something, that is deeply inept to evoke any consumer-reflex, but instead stuns, offends, alienates and consequently exposes the chasm of absurdity that is at its heart. To relate this in a more tangible way, I'll digress a little further by giving an example:I once -I can't remember where- saw some large, battered plastic sculpture, that was supposed to advertise some sausage-stand. It displayed an over-sized, anthropomorphic sausage (wrapped in hot-dog bread, I think) that poured ketchup upon itself and made a monstrously distorted face, that should suggest, I guess, it's enormous craving to devour its own (delicious?) substance (I don't know in which terms a sausage thinks about its own tasty appeals to itself).The point of this is, that such a thing of course does not generate in you impulsive sausage-cravings. Because it doesn't transfer anything about why a sausage maybe tasty- it instead contorts the whole mental picture of a sausage and produces out of it, in this case, an unspeakable being of nightmarish aspect(slight hyperbole there).Exactly the same thing happens in the Room. And though this may sound like a an implausibly bold or ironic statement, it's exactly how I perceive this deranged vision of human conduct, Tommy Wiseau gifted us with. The topics of this film –love, passion, envy, insanity etc.- are as familiar to us, as a sausage(I think this metaphor deserves to be stretched as much as possible). But they get reshaped in this film, so that eventually nothing is in its right place and the persons, whose turmoil is supposed to be displayed, are only resembling human beings in the way a sock-pocket, being waved in your face by a madman, who is shouting: "Ai don care annymoar!", does. The initial reaction, to such an affront to humanities grace, is naturally to be disgusted and put off by its grotesque bad- and ineptness. Just unconsciously feel that everything about this is wrong, and consequently damn it. But you need to open up- need to indulge in the infinite detail of stupidity, the unthinkably dense and compressed amounts of absurdity, every fraction of a scene contains. The film really does display a certain self-similarity in this respect: You think a conversation between some characters is embarrassingly moronic, then you zoom in, discover and savor how incoherently the dialogue propagates, zoom in further, see how unworldly, how alien the language of the single remarks is, zoom in to the see the clownish, completely unreasonable facial expressions that tile this flow of human caricature that sprang forth from the seizures that must be Tommy Wiseau's thoughts. So finally you commit yourself to the strange symphony this mythical figure, drenched in mystery, pieced together in its childish mind, allowing you to see the world through the eyes and brains of some sort of holy idiot.

reviews.review_title: One of my favorite movies ever!
reviews.content: This movie...what can one say about such a piece of work? It goes dreadfully wrong in so many ways, but somehow it is only more entertaining because of it. The dialogue was clearly written by someone lacking fluency in the English language, there are subplots introduced then discarded, the acting is often wooden and uninspired...but it much, much greater than the sum of its parts.Tommy Wiseau is why. He wrote, directed, produced, and starred in this unique film, and he carries it. Despite very little acting talent, and fleeting grasp on English, he has an inexplicable screen presence. He is one of those actors you can't take your eyes off of. I can't tell you the number of times I've watched this movie...and I love it every time.My rating of 2 is a measure of the objective quality of the movie, but I assure you, if I were told I would only be allowed to see 5 movies before I died, this would be one of them (also, a middling movie gets no attention...one of the lowest rated films ever will get noticed). Thank you, Tommy Wiseau, for bringing this movie into the world.

reviews.review_title: A Crime Against Art, Cinema, and Viewers
reviews.content: The Room is in no way a normal movie, and so I will not be attempting to give it a normal review. Instead, allow me to present, unedited, a series of social media statuses I posted while watching it in theaters.10 minutes in and I may be off girls forever. The very concept of romance may be ruinedI think this movie was written by an alien whose entire knowledge of humanity comes from watching late night broadcasts on Lifetime....With dialog by a Mexican soap opera writer via bablefish.Has anyone in this movie seen a child before?Tommy Wiseau is clearly not human. Something this deep in the uncanny Valley must be a robot covered in human skin. And not the fresh kind.This may be the first time an announcement that someone has cancer has produced a chorus of bad laughs.This movie handles serious issues like lines on a checklist. The more the better, no matter how awkwardly you cram them in.I think everyone in this movie is functionally retarded.Oh my goodness they're playing "catch."I think the editor just had a seizure.Who brings a football to a wedding party?Every conversation feels like it's cobbled together from random snippets of sound tests.There is no reason for any of the scenes in this movie to be in this movie.I take it back. Everyone in this movie is retarded and on laughing gas.I have seen better fights in preschool.And now the sound just disappeared. The main character is lying on the floor dead and the preview to another movie is playing on the speakers.Finally, I wish to say that forcing audiences to look at Tommy Wiseau's bare ass should be considered a crime against humanity.

Well... The first 27 minutes are pretty much a soft core porno with a brilliant musical score...There are 3 love scenes in 26 minutes of the opening them... Once you get past the unnecessarily long and, well, simply unnecessary love scenes, the movie unfolds. By the end of the movie, even after the hour of terrible acting and funny dialogue, you feel so emotionally involved that you could punch the person sitting next to you. Somehow the director of this film pulls off an emotional involvement with his audience that even most of the greatest writers and/or directors never could.Any way like I said, this movie is about as good as how well written this review is... NOT. But, if you can make it through the first 30 minutes with out leaving or shutting it off, you won't regret it. You'll have a few genuine laughs at some of the awkwardly hilarious scenes, the ridiculously seesawing character development, the situations the characters are put in, and the crazy dialogue, you'll get truly angry at some of the more evil characters and hell, you may even have yourself a cry.Excellent flick, brilliant score. 10/10 lol

reviews.review_title: Time to settle down, kids...or no cookies and Kool-Aid
reviews.content: Okay, first off --I love bad films. LOVE EM. I search them out. I watch them over and over. I roll in them like dogs in manure. So I anxiously sought out "THE ROOM" (remember, not "A ROOM" as Wiseau points out on the DVD) with my tail wagging... but really kids...this is just average, so-so entertainment. Standard low-end student film-making. Yes, I laughed at Mr. Wiseau's phonetic, euro-porn line readings. Yes, I snickered at the endless hammering of character's emotional viewpoints. (I get it, Lisa doesn't love Johnny) Yes, I rolled my eyes at the random "dramatic" plot points that come and go without much thought. But really, folks there is a lot worse out there for your viewing enjoyment. This film is just embarrassing... and not in a fun way. It's just not that lovable. For all of you out there claiming it needs to be seen in L.A. with a live audience to fully "get it" I say "Bulls***!" I saw Rocky Horror, Showgirls, Pink Flamingo's, etc. with a live audience and solo and loved them equally both ways. I'm happy some of you are enjoying this film but when all is said and done the emperor has no clothes. Ho hum. Snooze...

This is a movie that can only get either one star or ten.This pretty much sums it up.It's so horrible that you have to wonder how this train wreck could have been made by accident. Enter conspiracy theories about Tommy Wiseau secretly being a genius who intended every plot hole (Plot? What Plot?), every moment of mindblowing cringiness - all with the thought of creating The World's Least Relatable Movie in mind.I thought about this.But then there's this scene where he crushes every damn thing in the apartment, moving around like he's sleepwalking, "Why, Lisa, whyyy", and he starts sniffing her stupid second-hand dress, orgasming on the floor, and I remember Lisa's worm-like eyebrows and I'm like, no way man, that's too intense to be an act.And I can't even mark this as a spoiler, because that'd imply there's some "suspence to rob the viewer of". THERE IS NONE. God only knows what this movie is even about.

This movie only gets better every time you see it like "The Big Labowski" people constantly say. What is refreshing to me is that it's not another high budget Hollywood movie with all the same clichés. It doesn't have Tom Cruise or Brad Pitt in it fighting off nazi's or saving the world. No it's just a massive plot hole as Greg Sestero (Mark) said in the book. I'd rather sit through this than a lot of crap in theaters right now. I have seen this movie in it's entirety 3-4 times which is more than the guardians of the galaxy or super hero fad movies you only see because your friends will talk about it. Like many of you I saw nostalgia critics review on it and was so amazed I showed everyone and liked it so much I actually went to a "The Room" screening in my city and had a blast. I met Tommy Wiseau and Greg Sestero. Youtube a 'Q&A" they did to experience some of the insanity.If you're expecting a movie meant to be good like 95% of what else is out there this isn't for you. Good acting? keep looking and a story this isn't for you. This is a movie you watch because it's so bad it's good. Every person I talk to and tell them about this movie as I have a big signed poster in my room thinks that I'm describing an adult movie about it. So much strange stuff happens in this movie you become drawn, infatuated trying to understand Tommy's mindset and why he decided to do certain scenes. All I can say without ruining anything is read Greg's book it explains some of it and you'll have a lot of good laughs.

reviews.review_title: The acting is so bad it's good
reviews.content: I've never seen a movie so bad it's good. The acting especially the main character is so bad but so rewarding at the same time. It's as entertaining as a serious magician trying to impress you with tricks that don't work the way it was meant to work and still delivering a show. So the movie is about a drama between a man and a woman. There is pretty much no plot but it involves cheating and a lot of sexual scenes. Also there is a lot of confusion and hilarity involved between other characters. This is the kind of movie you must watch as if you are reading a book "between the lines". It won't make sense but you'll be surprise to find out your own meaning to it. Certainly a cult classic.

reviews.review_title: on his own twisted angle its a great movie
reviews.content: This movie is very likable, because we never know what will happen next. I think it became a cult film, because it surprises the viewer on any minute. Plus, this movie despite being terribly made, has a vision behind it. And that changes everything: this was not made to be a direct-video crap, or a Hollywood blockbuster going terribly wrong: but a guy that wanted to make the best movie in history of film, and tried so so hard that failed miserably.It has too many memorable scenes, awesome awkward sex scenes, great lines that fans throw the whole time, the worst sound effects i heard on a movie, a camera that can't focus on the characters while they're talking, or the obvious plot lines that lead nowhere, or at least end by themselves.It surprises us every minute, because we don't have any clue how he will solve "situation x". in a good film we can guess (or be surprised), and in a bad film we already know what will happen- and that's why is bad.On this field "the room" works exactly like an excellent film. even more: because a lot of solutions that wiseau brought, came so out of nowhere, that never in a million years we could guess them. he has a very rooted deep twisted logic into what we think a movie should be...and that weird vision is exactly why this movie is so magical.and why it worked. because it did. No film in the world has a cult following for all these years without working. should deserve a better grade here, definitely.

This movie was terrible. Yet I loved it.Tommy seems to have a skewed version of how women are in the real world. The sex scenes were not worth the BS that the rest of the movie puts the viewer though.If someone wants to see this movie because they heard it was terrible, yet great, go for it. The line reading, and acting, would have been done better by a high school theatre group.In the end he kills himself over these self-absorbed jerks. I would never have watched this movie if not for his cult fame.All this being said, I have seen the movie many times. It is worth re-watching for the laugh-value of the quality. I suggest some drinks and snacks and friends for this movie. Your friends may not like it, but if you turn it into a big joke it becomes bearable, barely.

On the surface of it, The Room is yet another really bad movie about failed romance. There are plenty of them out there, I'm sure. However, what makes The Room so alluring is its creator and star, Tommy Wiseau. I am obviously not alone in this fascination, as the film has enjoyed a cult status for many years and has recently seem a mocku-docu-drama-whatever insight released with James Franco at the helm. As ridiculous as that film is, it does help shed a light on the backstory of Wiseau himself.As perplexing and morbidly fascinating that Mr. Wiseau is, I cannot shake the feeling that this guy just got lucky. Where he (and his money) came from is still a head-scratching mystery, but casting him or The Room in any sort of light that paints it as purposefully bad, ironic or even artistic is just plain wrong (I saw the awkward character interactions of The Room compared to the works of David Lynch and whilst I drew my own similarities with the surreal or awkward moments, the directors are quite obviously leagues apart). If there was no such thing as meme culture, there would be no career for Tommy Wiseau, and he would most likely just be another dreamer who had a stab at Hollywood and then fell into obscurity.I mean no disrespect to the man, as The Room is incredibly entertaining despite its deathly pace and repetition. I could just happily go through my entire remaining existence in this world without ever seeing this film again.

"THE ROOM" (2003, Wiseau) is no masterpiece. It's not genius. It's not a happy accident. It is an atrociously acted, badly written film that cost the mysterious Wiseau a fortune of his own money.You're better off watching the half an hour edit on YouTube as the full film gets boring fast.

This film has to be the greatest, worst movie ever made! Yet, this has to be my favourite film of all time, the one dimensional storyline, characters and plot development allow this film to be the most unique production ever released. The nonsensical establishing shots, camera angles, unconvincing green screens and sub-plots that seem to never scratch below surface level are a masterpiece, and I'd recommend this film to absolutely everyone. It is a fantastic work of comedy, that is both dark, cringe-worthy and bizarre...all the ingredients to make it a hit in the cult classics hall of fame. The storyline is simplistic, a love triangle between a loving fiancée, his unfaithful wife, and his best friend. But the paper thin plot has complete irrelevance in this film, it has no bearing on the fact that this is a marvel for all the wrong reasons. A review cannot explain, or do justice to just how incredible this movie actually is. Just get a copy of this film at all costs...you will not regret it.

reviews.review_title: A masterpiece of a bad film
reviews.content: This movie is trying to win a Oscar so bad but the poorly written, bad acting, and kinda slow paced kept this movie down. It's so bad that it's good type of film in my opinion just like what happen to me with Halloween Resurrection (2002) like I like that film as a bad movie and I also like this film as a bad movie too. I feel bad about just watching it on YouTube instead of buying it, maybe someday I will buy the movie. This is worth a watch with a friend to watch bad movies with.

I get the cult status of this film and i suppose it's kinda enjoyable in a it's so bad it's good kinda way but my ex who studied film at uni really liked this movie and made me watch it so i'm rating it 1 star just for him 😘

Review:
'The Room' is a romantic-drama film directed by Tommy Wiseau.
When people think of a movie that is so bad, but still feels the need to tell other to watch it, it's this movie. If you can enjoy a film that's so bad it's good, then give this movie a watch; you won't regret it. I actually had to take breaks between the scenes because I was laughing so hard at how awful it was.
The film centers on a melodramatic love triangle between amiable banker Johnny (Tommy Wiseau), his deceptive fiancée Lisa (Juliette Danielle) and his conflicted best friend Mark (Greg Sestero).
Nobody in this movie is known today for other projects aside from this. Not one person in this movie was good, but Tommy Wiseau is on a whole other level of bad. Not only does his dialogue not make sense in the scenes he is in, but his facial expression and tone don't make what he is saying.
What make the Room superior to all of the 'so bad it's good' films is the fact that it's a riot. You see unlike other films that have 1-2 unintentionally funny scenes and the rest is a bore the Room is a non-stop extravaganza. Literally every scene has something wrong.
Overall, the fact that "The Room" has gathered such a cult following is no surprise. There is something both pathetic and a little unsettling about how Tommy Wiseau regards the cynical interests his movie has attracted for a genuine recognition of his talent.
.5/5
Perfect Comedy that makes you question life and rots your brain...but it os hilariously bad. So bad that it is good.

Nothing quite like how bad this movie is. It's a legend that it was ever made, and humanity is all the better for it. Tommy Wiseau's performance alone is a spectacle that needs to be viewed time and time again, quoted over and over until it just exists in the public culture for the rest of time. I'm not sure what could have possibly been going through the man's head, but at the movie's heart, it takes itself seriously. That's what makes it more impressive than any parody movie or tv show. It doesn't mean to be so bad that it's memorable, it just *is* that way. And somehow, someway, it made it into theaters for everyone to enjoy.

What I can't get over is the sheer budget of this film. To be honest, I wouldn't care to watch or review if it were low budget, but actual money was put into making this very questionable movie!The Room on the surface appears to be a comedy until you realize it's not. The acting is atrocious and the storyline and film style is tangential and unfocused. I can see why a film was made by James Franco and co essentially mocking the process this film went through to be made. I don't think Tommy Wiseau to this day realizes this! I suggest watching James Franco's portrayal and then watching The Room so you can appreciate this sheer travesty this film was.

In all honesty, this movie is really, really terrible. But if you like watching bad movies and love seeing "dubbed" lines, look no further because this is the movie for you. Its terrible but it is so much fun to watch, especially with friends.Ijust wish Tommy Wiseau made more of these terrible but ultimately entertaining films more often; i would be there opening night. I would be lying if I said that this isn't one of my favourite movies of all-time. And if you don't like my review, as Mark would say "Just keep your stupid comments in your pocket!" Everyone that I have shown this movie to have loved it for its blend of fun, cheesiness, and lack of proper acting. Definitely worth your time. So if you ever have nothing to do on a weekend, watch "The Room" and it will be worth your time.

reviews.review_title: This movie is tearing me apart!
reviews.content: I gave this film a pretty generous rating. The only reason I gave it something above a 1 is because I couldn't stop laughing the whole entire time. A messily scripted and poorly acted display of irritating accents and painfully awkward sex scenes, The Room is pretty much only good for a laugh. I mean that in the nicest way possible. No. Not really. After watching this film, I am left unsatisfied with the pretty much nonexistent plot and disturbing amount of goofs involved in it. Specifically, the flower shop scene. It is as if the actors only had 45 seconds to film the scene, and they had never looked at their lines and just read over them a couple of times before rushing on set. There are so many things wrong with this movie, including but not limited too the amount of times that Johnny says "Hi" to any given person, particularly Mark, and the awkward laugh that Johnny seems to force from his throat at the strangest times, including just before one of those terrible sex scenes. Despite my bad review, I would not say that my time spent watching The Room was wasted. I recommend this film in the highest regard. It's so bad that it's good! It is fantastic for having a night getting drunk with your friends, or to get one of your emotional friends to smile after a breakup. Enjoy this terribly wonderful film.

reviews.review_title: THE ROOM: A must see movie, in a group or by yourself
reviews.content: After many at home viewings of THE ROOM and one particularly awesome theater experience - and by awesome I mean experiencing a movie with audience participation in a way I had never before encountered: audience participation that genuinely enhanced the experience of watching an already immensely entertaining work (and that's a rare kind of awesome). I can only conclude that THE ROOM is my personal favorite film to be experienced in a group setting, my favorite film to introduce to people, and probably just my favorite film to sit down and watch all on my lonesome.First, what it's all about... It's a story about a man named JOHNNY who is a good person living in a world of devious people. His good intentions and simple, sweat dreams of a happy life begin to fall apart as those around him abuse his good nature; his loyalty, his giving, charitable spirit, and most painful of all his manipulation at the hands of his love Lisa. His betrayal through the sudden onset unfaithfulness of his beautiful bride to be is the driving force of the room: A good person surrounded by such undeserved pressures results in a film that is ultimately a view into the emotional and physical destruction of the character JOHNNY - an everyman, of sorts - as his friends, his lover, his job, and finally his grip on reality betray him.It's a dark film, but with many light moments as interesting, quirky characters drift into THE ROOM and JOHNNY's life, bringing with them unique personal situations, problems, and other glimpses into young, modern urban life in America. These flashes of brightness and Americana drama serve as a backdrop to the exacerbating suffering of our Hero.THE ROOM is a story of betrayal and loss, weaved in to a world of colorful, compelling characters. It is the saddest drama; it is the blackest comedy; it is the saddest love story. It's a lot of things, all of which you should see. Once you are 5 minutes into the film, you cannot turn away. It's a museum quality example of independent film in the United States.And yes, I should mention something of the acting, writing, sets and such. The performances and staging are poor compared to studio films. But the experience is incomparable in any context. Go buy this movie at AMAZON, setup a THE ROOM party night and experience the work for yourself.

reviews.review_title: Where "Plan 9 From Outer Space" meets THE ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW
reviews.content: Yes, it's an unintended Ed Wood/Richard O'Brien mash-up summary line, which seems like both a slam against the talented writer Mr. O'Brien and the talentless writer/director Mr. Wood.I can honestly say I'd never heard of THE ROOM until that Entertainment Weekly article of a few years ago describing its new life as an audience participation midnight movie classic like ROCKY HORROR. But unlike ROCKY HORROR (which despite bombing in its initial release, has some high quality in both acting and songs/dancing and remains relevant to this day), THE ROOM is a certifiable piece of crap from the opening scene to the bitter end. And also unlike ROCKY HORROR, I really doubt the main actors of THE ROOM will still have any sort of show-biz careers in the near future, let alone 35 years later.But I had to see it, if for nothing else see just what was behind the creepy Tommy Wiseau "mug shot" used in on the cover, which of course was prominently displayed on an L.A. billboard for several years. I did make it through to end, but it sure helped to be reading snarky reviews of it on IMDb while the train wreck was playing. And the fact Wiseau seems to have worse skin than Andy Warhol did, and felt compelled to give us a "full-backal" view of said skin, made it all the more hilarious. And for the unintentional comedy, I'm "awarding" it an extra star in my rating.I guess my only recommendation is, if you must see THE ROOM, check it out at a midnight "participation screening". Watch it at home, and you'll feel like you're trapped in a specific room, and that room is known universally as hell.

What can I say? I laughed. I cried. It became a part of me. I almost wish I had never seen it, so I could watch it again for the first time. If anyone thinks this bastard is not a genius (Tommy!) they are mistaken. I would probably watch anything this man put on film, or video tape, or doodled on a napkin. Don't deny us, you asshole! Make another movie!!! I beg you! :::sob::: I've seen better movies...I've MADE better movies...but there is nothing in the known universe that can make me laugh, cry, beg for mercy, or try to poke my own eyes out with a stick like THE ROOM. If you need a reason to live, just watch this thing a few times and your own life will seem quite normal by comparison. If you think you are ugly, just watch Tommy's creepy-eyed smile and lizardy skin. If you think you have no acting talent, just watch this amazing cast stink up the screen. It is an esteem builder. I loved it more than I love all the MST3K movies combined.

Pros:
Funniest movie I've seen in a while
Every actor tries their best
Immersive drama, consistent universeCons:

This film was so awful it was almost good. Besides the use of both HD and SD cameras to shoot this feature length film, the director casts himself as the lead actor and displays no acting chops. With lines like "Your tearing me apart" and his constant introduction of every character and of himself in every scene you can tell that this was a first time screen writer.The only credit I will give this film is the fact that it was made, and it has somehow become a cult Phenomenon so Congrats to the director but please do not make a 2nd one of these films.If you are into really bad films and are looking to complete your trek into the cult world of film makers then this is a must see, otherwise steer clear.

reviews.review_title: I did not hit her, it's not true! It's bullshit! I did not hit her! I did naath! Oh hi, Mark!
reviews.content: Cult-film to laugh out loud ! After The Disaster Artist came out, The Room got even more popular and more films from (the genius) Tommy Wiseau like Best F(r)iends. The Room is unlike any other movie which makes it so unique. All the best directors in the world couldn't have pulled this off even if they tried. It all came naturally for Tommy Wiseau. He's more humane than most of people you'll meet in your life. You need to see this movie in a theatre with lots of people, you're going to have a blast ! Thank you Tommy and Greg Sestero !!

Film fans, I saw this film last Friday in L.A. with a bunch of my girlfriends. It was a sold out audience and we were blown away at the audience's response. I have never in my 31 years of watching movies seen this kind of attention. There was noise from start to finish. You had fans dressing up as the stars of "The Room" with wigs, beards, etc. It's funny that the line "You're tearing me apart!" got such an applause considering it's a classic line from the James Dean film "Rebel Without a Cause" from 1955. Being from Indiana, I am a huge James Dean fan and the delivery of that line by Johnny (Tommy Wiseau) was a disgrace. However, the other actor in the film who played Mark (Greg Sestero) was the most impressive part of this cult phenomenon. Greg Sestero had that brooding, sensitive and subtle performance that us "James Dean" fans enjoy. He was real, cool, and wasn't trying to "act" like every other actor in the movie. I was amazed at his prescence on film and how beautiful he was on screen. The rest of the cast was fun I guess, especially Denny. Lisa was miscast and tried way too hard to be the "it girl" and the soundtrack was so out of place that I have no comment. This film is fun and crazy. I recommend seeing it any way possible. "THE BEST WORST MOVIE EVER

'The Room' is in a class of its' own. It's the only movie from the 21st Century to live up to every fragment of its hype. Brilliant! Tommy Wiseau is a visionary.The dialogue makes no sense, but it's hysterical. "I did not hit her, it's bull-sh** I did not! Oh hi Mark. You are tearing me apart Lisa. I didn't know it was you. Hi doggy. Keep your stupid comments in your pocket. Anyway how's your sex life? From the hilarious quotes, to the misguided script, the football and the chickens. It's bad. VERY bad, but there is something endearing about this movie. Trust me, you have got to check this out. It's a must-see. It's one of the greatest epic masterpieces in the history of cinema. 10/10

It's not often I review a title without a star rating, but The Room gets this special treatment, because by all rights, this is a terrible film.That being said, it is one of those films that is unintentionally hilarious simply down to its ineptitude. The one-man powerhouse behind this production, Tommy Wiseau, is an enigma of an individual. The details of his background and how he got into making this film are a complete mystery, some of which is uncovered in Greg Sestero's memoir, The Disaster Artist, now adapted into a feature film.The Room is filled with red herrings, aborted plot lines and is one of those films that has to be seen to be believed. Wiseau plays Johnny, a well-meaning "American" banker. He loves his "future wife", Lisa who is revealed to be a manipulative golddigger who starts an affair with Johnny's "best friend" Mark. From there, it's just a flurry of unexplored plot threads that are forgotten just as quickly as they're brought up. (breast cancer, drug money, family problems, etc.) The tonal inconsistencies are ongoing and it only adds to this trainwreck of a movie.All of that aside, the whole thing is incredibly intriguing and only makes you want to know more about the bizarre individual that is Wiseau. Having read The Disaster Artist, the production of this film is the definition of "dysfunctional." However, there's a strange passion that shines through that really shows Wiseau's commitment to the project.A cult classic, heavily quotable and has garnered huge popularity over the years, The Room continues to be one of the "best worst movies ever made." I'm getting tired of having to correct people when they assume I'm talking about the Oscar-nominated "Room", though.
It might be an atrocity, but it's one of the most significant and entertaining films of the 2000s. I recommend it to anyone seeking expressions of truly unique filmmaking.

I gave "The Room" a 9 out of 10 due to the fact that I only give 10's to movies that truly deserve it. Obviously this movie could not realistically be given 10, so I stuck it with a 9.I have noticed many other reviewers will point out each and every flaw within the plot of the movie, because believe me, there are many. Of course this is what makes the movie fantastic, but my favorite thing about The Room is seeing Tommy's sheer enjoyment while making it. Tommy was truly passionate while making this project, and cared about every scene that was shot, even if he did it in all the wrong ways. Many directors today could care less about the impact their films have, and are only looking for a quick buck. Tommy on the other hand was looking to deliver a dramatic masterpiece to his audience. He instead created something much different, but it still has become insanely popular. Tommy wound up famous, and although his film is technically terrible, I have to applaud him for his effort and determination while making this film.If you have not witnessed The Room, I would recommend checking it out as soon as possible. It's definitely a life altering experience and Tommy will be on your mind for some time after your viewing. In the words of Mr. Wiseau himself.. "I'm fed up with this woarld".

The Room is Tommy Wiseau's Oscar-worthy thrilling masterpiece.
Watching the film made me feel like I'm being transported into Wiseau's world, the colors, the story, the art direction THE WRITING! It's all so meticulously crafted and well thought out! Brilliant acting! The costume design is out of this world phenomenon !!!!!!!!!!!! 
My only gripe with the film is that it is too short! Why not make it a four hour film so we could all enjoy the fantasy for even longer? Come on Tommy! Do better! 
Can't wait to see Best F(r)iends!

It is April fool's day and Adult Swim is showing "The Room" again. It debuted there a few years ago. They said they were going to show something else, I recorded it and the next day watched it and it wasn't what they claimed. Instead they played "The Room" as a joke. That is when I first saw it. They have showed it every year since then.It is quite literally the worst movie ever made. It was written/directed/produced and stars Tommy Wiseau. The worst movie maker and actor ever to exist."Plan Nine From Outer Space" was often considered to be the worst movie ever made until this came along. "Plan" had the last performance of Bela Lugosi, playing a vampire. He died before the movie was finished and he was replaced by an actor that just lurked around with his cape covering his face. Their spaceship set was a desk with a curtain behind it. I think "The Room" easily and honestly wins the title. (By the way Ed Wood made "Plan" and some of the other worst movies ever made. Tim Burton made a movie about him called, of course, "Ed Wood" which is great, watch that if you haven't.)You must see this movie. If you don't, your life will not be complete and you will die with a hole in your soul.I have seen a lot of movies. Most of them I forget about unless they are something very special, like "A Clockwork Orange" or "Star Wars" or "Saving Private Ryan". I will never forget those movies and what they did to me. They changed my life. This movie did the same thing. It is unforgettable. It is a masterpiece of awfulness. I will remember it until I die. There is just something special about it that lifts if from just plain bad, to something that is unbelievable. It is hypnotic. Every moment from beginning to end is like a test to see if you can withstand another second of it. If you can, you will reach a higher plane, a sort of nirvana. If you can do it you will become a different person with a greater understanding of yourself and the world around you. It is that bad. See it as soon as possible.

reviews.review_title: Cult classic that delivers as one of the best worst movies
reviews.content: I heard of The Room many years ago, but have never gotten around to watching it until now. This movie is not only bad in terms of acting and storyline, but there are regular inconsistencies and technical problems that range from blurry picture to a terrible green screen. It seems that the cast has risen out of obscurity due to the cult following, and they are milking their 15 seconds of fame. I don't blame them. If I were to list the problems with the movie, I'm sure I would go over the maximum review length. Needless to say, this is a head-scratchingly bad movie that is thoroughly enjoyable as you wonder who would put this much effort into something this bad. If you've already watched the movie, cheep-cheep- cheep. If you haven't, watch it and you will laugh.

This movie is on of the most beatiful thing to ever grace my vision. I find myself drawn to the complex, not at all inconsistent, characters, and the emotional and intriguing plot. 
Sod the haters, this is a masterpiece akin to the Godfather trilogy.

reviews.review_title: How Did This Movie Get Made?
reviews.content: Picture this scenario: A man of mixed European background who has made a living in the U.S churning out the kind of soft-core porn movies they show on Cinemax every night decides to invest his life savings into a film that will prove his genius to Hollywood. In a burst of alcohol-fueled energy he bats out a script called "The Room" in one night. Then, casting the script with mostly porn movie actors and himself, he produces, directs, shoots, edits and releases his 'masterpiece' without ever deviating from that first draft. That's what this thing looks like---the product of a decidedly minor talent with a full blown ego who either fired every person who tried to point out the "garbage in, garbage out" rule to him from day one, or who just hired a bunch of people who didn't care and were just happy to get a paycheck.And don't buy into the "so bad it's good' excuse with this one. It's so bad, it's literally impossible to remain focused on it. It's why remote controls were invented.To sum up this steaming pile if cinematic achievement; It's 99 minutes of your life you will never get back.

It makes you think. The directing is extraordinary. And the ending to this film is surprising and scary. I give this 10 out of 10. Highly recommended.

reviews.review_title: oh hi mark....you know what they say, love is blind
reviews.content: What can be said about the Room that hasn't been said before, this movie is simply one of the most enjoyable cinematic experiences i've had. I bought the Room off of amazon after viewing clips on youtube. The best $10 I have ever spent, it changed my life and the lives of my friend. Since then I have hosted over 8 Room screenings at my house. My friends and I can't stop quoting it and singing the songs. We have learned so many lessons, such as how to play football in small spaces, the powers of persuasion and seduction, the art of interior decorating, and finally how to catch your cheating lover. In all honesty, this isn't the prime example of exemplary acting, writing, cinematography, directing, musical composition, or editing, but as long as you have a good group of friends, a couple of skotchkas and a great sense of humor, you will have fun watching the movie. If not, you are a chicken...cheep cheep cheep cheep cheep!

The Room is the movie based on the book and theater piece by Tommy Wiseau, American immigrant and retail park manager, who wants to immortalize his romantic life, sexual hatreds and obsessions into a dark, twisted drama of betrayal. Its also a film that's so badly acted and produced that its generally hilarious.There's nothing really "cool" about the Room, as some cult movies actually are, its just a story of an honest, though somewhat creepy looking finance worker, who's almost-plump suburban girlfriend Lisa has plans to run off with the guy upstairs. The rest of the cast is: Lisa's mother, a vengeful sexual predator with breast cancer and Denny, a wholesome American sitcom teen that wants to watch Johnny (Wiseau's on screen character) and Lisa having sex. Denny's also got some underhanded goings-on with a local thug involving narcotics, something that unravels dramatically on their buildings rooftop where much of the films conflict scenes get especially fiery.Two points: this movie is filled with SEX, also its FUNNY AS SH*T, because the cast can't act and the plot points are all confused or very badly telegraphed.Its also worth 'splaining that Denny is sort of a surrogate "little brother" to Johnny, as he has no family of his own. Each scene sets Johnny up as selfless, idealistic, and an nurturing, except for one major event where he tries to fry Lisa for framing him for domestic abuse.The movie cost a freakin' bundle: writer/producer/director/star Wiseau commissioned a steamy R&B track for the movie, and his crew an assorted costs crept into the millions, plus billboard advertising to promote his project. Clearly, they didn't have the basic technical know-how for getting the best from their equipment; the most telling sign being the visible interlacing throughout the film.I won't spoil the ending, but I can add that personally, when I first found this film, I laughed uncontrollably for about a week and a half. Maybe a year or so later I returned to the movie, and it appeared to be littered with filler scenes, except for a few great one-liners. In a sense the film satirizes the fascination with love, betrayal and the sacred rite of bland, secure suburban fulfillment that's at the heart of a lot of TV drama and soap story lines. Its a funny movie, but mostly by accident apparently.A computer game and paperback novel detailing the films troubled production is available also.

For the information of all the people who have written negative reviews for "The Room" on IMDb, I'm one of the cult followers. If you didn't have fun watching "The Room" multiple times with other enthusiastic fans, then that is your loss. There are so many enjoyable moments in this movie that a few flaws are inconsequential. The fact is, Tommy Wiseau's intention was to provoke the audience, and he has succeeded beyond anyone's expectations. In fact, on one who was involved in the production of this movie expected the audiences to react as they have except the director Tommy Wiseau. There are so many little interesting tidbits in each scene and so many emotional moments and ironies that "The Room" is entertaining from start to finish. If you have any doubts about this, get a DVD of the Audience Reactions..The fans are having great time with their impression of there favorite lines, such as "You are tearing me a part, Lisa!", "If a lot of people love each other, the world would be a better place to live.", "Hi, doggie!", "Chocolate is a symbol of love." Also some fans are dressing like characters in the movie and tossing a football to each other during the movie. Now, I call that fun!Many people have commented that the beautiful San Francisco scenery makes them want to go there. As for me, it reminds me of the time I have been there. It's perfect setting for the plot of "The Room," because the characters are sophisticated and affluent.I would like to recommend if the whole thing didn't grab you the first time, see it again, and again, and again, and again, and again and you will never be tired of seeing it!!!!!
Amazing, hilarious, wonderful. My kids recommended this knowing my love for Troll 2 and Showgirls. Watched it alone and later with the Rifftrax accompaniment. Highly entertaining.

Claudette: I got the results of the test back - I definitely have breast cancer.Lisa: Do you want me to order a pizza? Johnny: Whatever, I don't care. Lisa: I already ordered a pizza. I was not the least bit entertained. I wasted an hour of my life I will never get back from watching it.

I rate it 2 stars because "The Room" is definitely the worst movie of all time but meantime it is the best bad movie ever.

reviews.review_title: I didn't hit her! I did not! Oh, hi review.
reviews.content: I've seen the rifftrax version of The Room a few times, saw interviews with some of the people involved, watched YouTube reviewers take their stabs at it, ready the Disaster Artist and saw the adaptation of it as well. I'm honestly entertained by all of it. The book being at the top of the list, not sure how much of it is accurate, but it does give you a different outlook on Tommy Wiseau who in The Room gives one of the best, worse performances of all-time.

Honestly, this movie is one of the worst films ever made if not the worst but at the same time, you are going to love it. The involuntarily hilarious acting of Tommy Wiseau plus the poorly written script is going to make you laugh all the time.
As a movie, The Room is worthless but this is not a casual film, this is a masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: A Joyful Experience, with the Right People to Watch it With
reviews.content: The Room is one of the most joyful experiences you can have as a filmgoer. My university hosted a screening of this to mark the beginning of Finals Week for the Fall 2018 semester, and wow, was this one of the best "theater" experiences I have ever had in my life. It was loud, full of screams, gags at all off the sex scenes, and tons of amazing laughter. I was literally crying in some parts at how funny both the film and the audience was.I would highly recommend watching The Room by yourself or with a couple of friends for the first time, and then watch the film with a large audience. The audience's participation with this film made this one of the most enjoyable experiences I have ever had. It was so incredibly fun.As for The Room, it is an incredibly funny film that tries to depict a love triangle, but fails in every single way. The film tries to be emotional, but you can't help but laugh at everything. The lines of dialogue are overtly against females, as Tommy Wiseau delegates women as mere sex objects who want to just use men for their own personal gain. Regardless, the script doesn't make him sound like a douchebag because you can hardly decipher what he is saying anyways. There is an overabundance of sex scenes, with the same scene being used again and again. There are random subplots involving a college student named Denny, who wants to have a threesome with his father figure, Johnny, and mother figure, Lisa. There are photos of spoons in the background. There is a love of football found throughout the film, etc.All in all, The Room is just a lot of random. And about 90 percent of it, is just absolutely hilarious. There is a small 10 percent of the film in the middle that was kind of boring, but the rest is amazing.Please watch this film. And as some of you may know, my ratings for my films are like sixty percent based off of enjoyment, and forty percent of quality. I sincerely enjoyed this film to the max, so hence the three stars, or six out of ten.Given the incredibly insane backstory, I need to hope onto The Disaster Artist train as soon as possible.

It is hard to rate films like this one.
This is the best-worst good-bad movie, if i rate it for the quality it is a 1/10 but then i can not give it that rate beacause watching it is so much fun!
On the other hand, if i rate it a 10/10 i feel bad for giveing such a terrible product a high rating so i must settle somewhere in the middle.

Tommy Wiseau's 'The Room' is an amazing piece of art. It is full of an emotional story that will keep you crying, a special message that I believe everyone needs to hear and of course Tommy Wiseau's beautiful face. Tommy's acting is just brilliant, better than anyone I've ever seen. This movie will make you a different person, a better person. If you do not watch this film, you will die. This film is a MUST WATCH. Tommy Wiseau's 'The Room' is a masterpiece. 10/10 MUST WATCH again.

It's truly a masterpiece like non other! It's unique, bold and inspiring! We are not going to see a movie as good as The Room for many decades. The actors play their part to perfection, they capture the emotion and weight so amazingly that I can't even tell that they're acting. How could we not forget Tommy Wiseau, the visionary behind this film! Not only is he the director of this film but he's acting too! When I saw him act, the only thing I saw was Johnny, he literally became the character!

While watching this film, i wanted to laugh at it. i went in knowing the film is stupid in a funny way. While there is its funny moments, it falls flat. The film makes you wonder "why" things are happening. Characters walk in people's houses without permission, people don't use the phone, make dumb decisions, and the fact that the scene transition is repetitive. You'll see characters talking in one scene, then there is a random sex scene afterwards. The sex scenes really bring this movie down, they're uncomfortable to watch and you are really tempted to skip them. There are way too many sex scenes than there should be. The movie has it's funny moments, but you can watch those scenes on YouTube. Overall, my experience was awkward, confusing, and sometimes funny. I give this one a 4/10.

This film this piece of godly work is a true gift from the gods. they came to our Tommy Wiseau. Gave him the power to create this great artifact this film its said if you watch it at 3 AM on Wednesday you will be forever blessed with fortune so great you will rival every country in wealth my friend did it he built his own space station now lives somewhere in a different galaxy with 300 models

reviews.review_title: One of the most entertaining movies I have ever seen
reviews.content: This is aptly called the Citizen Kane of bad movies, so it is one you cannot afford to miss. It has been said that even in the event of the best movie makers in the world coming together to try to make the worst movie of all time, they could still not make this - so, this is an exquisite work of art. To give examples, the acting is horrible, the lightning and the stage look like you are watching a soap opera, the story line is inconsistent, and so on. This movie cost almost a million dollar to make and the director still believes it is a great flick up to this day. The cult following is grateful to him, calling themselves Roomies. I believe it still shows in theaters in the US on a regular basis where these followers flock together, imitating their favorite characters, so eventually the movie will make a profit. I am glad it was made, since such good entertainment is extremely rare, albeit entertainment on the other end of the Gauss curve so to speak.
Just... Wow... BrilliantIt can't get any better than this, so strap in and get ready for excellence in its finest form.

reviews.review_title: Nobody was in the Room where it happened
reviews.content:
Oh my gosh what a terrible movie. But of course I say terrible as in how bad from any of the aspects of filmmaking. But you can have a really good time watching this still. It is so bad that it's just flat out hilarious. There are some scenes that looked like an accident happened on set and they just kept it in. There are some hilarious lines because it's all just nonsense.
It's amazing that this movie got made at all. Of course it's a 1/10 if we grade it seriously. But gosh darn it it's like a 9/10 for the pure entertainment I get from how badly made this movie was. I guess Tommy really made solidified a new way of filmmaking: make it so bad that that is how people will love it and be entertained.
I'd you don't know, Tommy meant for this movie to be serious. And look what we got. You're tearing me apart Tommy!
It really might be the worst movie ever made, but I love watching it.

reviews.review_title: Better to waste time shooting rubber bands at goats
reviews.content: How this film ever saw the light of day is utterly beyond me. Anyone that goes to see this more than once lives on the short bus. Obviously the people that gave this movie a 10 are the cast and crew. Don't be fooled by the this gimmick. Notice instead all the 1's it got. Those ratings are far closer to the truth. In fact, they are the truth! Any movie with such an extreme disparity is usually explained as shameless propaganda by the makers of the movie trying to recoup their investment. Advise for them: You'd get more out that bridge I can sell ya. Please save yourselves and take the next vacation cruise to Iraq before sitting through this waste of precious celluloid.

reviews.review_title: The world wouldn't be a better place to live in without this movie!
reviews.content:
This is actually an unreviewable movie; critics shouldn't be allowed to review and rate it; it's pointless and embarrassing for anyone who tries to explain why this movie is so bad. It may be something beyond our ken!
First, you need to see it to believe it; then, a re-watch is obligatory; it's crazy, I know, but it's even more enjoyable the second time.
Tommy Wiseau is an uncanny character; his incomprehensibly bad acting (that's actually the movie's strong point), his one of a kind accent, his awkward reactions, movements, facial expressions, everything about him is just too damn weird; I'm not even sure he's a human being, although we must all love him as a friend... as a human bean, because... that's life!
I want the 3D release in cinemas now! The purpose of my existence will be lost unless I see Wiseau's ass in 3D!!
It's the only bad movie that deserves to exist!
I just HAD to rate it, I'm sorry; it's a paradoxical rating. I'm giving this 5 stars and 1 star at the same time.

At first I thought it was a little weird but then I realized the beauty of this film. I realized that we can all learn from this movie and that we should totally have a football everywhere we go

reviews.review_title: The worst film ever made. DON'T MISS IT!!!
reviews.content: "The Room" makes the worst films you've seen before look like "Citizen Kane," the worst Saturday Night Live sketches look like Emmy winners. At some point you think, my god, this must be a put-on. NO ONE could have made a movie this bad on purpose! The actors appear never to have acted before the cameras started rolling. Performances are just terrible. The dialog such as it is beyond cheesy and cliché. The plot, if that's what you call it, makes no real sense. The main character Johnny (Tommy, also director/producer/auteur) looks and sounds like an alien from another planet, rejected by "Star Trek" as too weird.And yet, the whole thing is oddly mesmerizing, like a car wreck you can't help but stare at. Of course, half of the point of seeing it is to enjoy it with a crowd who has memorized the lines and knows how to participate in the action by now, to make fun of it.Beyond that, it's a very difficult film to describe. You MUST see for yourself!!

I decided to put the Chinese subtitles of the translation of the film on bilibili for everyone to be baptized together. This is really a movie that you will not believe until you have seen it. Nyway, how's your sex life?

Although this movie is a masterpiece of film and literary art, It has been recently tearing me apart. I can't stop thinking about the clenching of Tommy Wiseau's beautiful buttocks. It is a difficult life indeed, with this cursed image forever in my mind, but I do enjoy the movie nonetheless. My wife has become more distant since we viewed this film and I do worry that she has fallen prey to the eyes of our lord and savior Tommy himself. I pray every night for her safe return from his grasp, but to no avail. I have adopted a son as my own in hopes of becoming more like the blessed Wiseau, but my sweet son does not love me and has resigned himself to his Room. I worry he has found himself in a drug gang like Denny himself. Please PLEASE pray for me and my sweet family.
good movie, yes.

My friend convinced me to watch this "movie" by saying it is the holy grail of bad movies. He was 100% right. This movie makes you appreciate other movies solely because of how terrible it is. It is so bad, that their is actually a cult following over it. Tommy Wiseau really did see his big screen dream come true. Honestly, he might be the worst actor, writer, and directer ever. He wrote this film to be a true romantic tragedy. Johnny, Lisa, and Mark are all caught in a love triangle that could unravel any friendship. Johnny is madly in love with his fiancé Lisa, but she is having doubts on the marriage, and decides to seduce Johnny's best friend Mark. Not really an original thought. The story itself is fully of clichés that keep getting repeated. The characters are beyond terrible and the actors portraying them are historic in their awful portrayals. This truly is the worst movie you will ever see. If you want to take a break from all the great movies out there, this is a movie to watch. It truly is an instant ant "classic."
Personally i think this is the best worst film ever to be created

If I was rating on it's quality I would probably give less than 1 star , but The Room is not your average bad movie.....it's the baddest of them all.I have returned to this movie countless times since I first watched it. It's bizarre directional choices , camera angles , flimsy dialogues , exaggerated acting are all part of it's charm. It's probably the most quotable movie you will ever watch.I definitely recommend this movie to everyone. It must be experienced at least once in your life. You might even appreciate a lot of skills which we take for granted in any other movie.Don't watch this movie alone but get your friends together and prepare to have a great time.Truly the Citizen Kane of bad movies.

reviews.review_title: Needs to be seen to be believed
reviews.content: If I was rating on it's quality I would probably give less than 1 star , but The Room is not your average bad movie.....it's the baddest of them all.I have returned to this movie countless times since I first watched it. It's bizarre directional choices , camera angles , flimsy dialogues , exaggerated acting are all part of it's charm. It's probably the most quotable movie you will ever watch.I definitely recommend this movie to everyone. It must be experienced at least once in your life. You might even appreciate a lot of skills which we take for granted in any other movie.Don't watch this movie alone but get your friends together and prepare to have a great time.Truly the Citizen Kane of bad movies.

reviews.review_title: This Is Actually A Pretty Good Underrated Movie.
reviews.content: I never understood why this movie got so much hatred from the general audience. I personally thought it was a good movie and I mean, a really good movie. If anything, this was probably a fun romance flick to watch, when its' not Valentine's Day. But, I will say this...I hated the character of Lisa. She doesn't deserve to have either Mark or Johnny or anyone else. She's gonna get what's coming to her, someday.But, aside from a few questionable scenes that were going nowhere. I actually thought "The Room" is very underrated and it deserves a lot more attention than it did back in 2003.I'd give it an 8/10.

reviews.review_title: This is the classic. This is the masterpiece. This is THE ROOM.
reviews.content: Watching 'The Room', which, by the way, has an incredibly pointless title, has always been different every time. At first, I dismissed it saying that it was laughably bad (which it still is today). As I watched again and again, I slowly got more and more intrigued by its symbolism. Imagine : A weird, tall man with a creepy accent and girly, long, curly black hair. An incredibly and unabashedly unfaithful fiancée. A friend whose friendship is questionable due to his actions of betrayal. An innocent-looking kid who gets involved with things much darker for anyone's taste. The fiancée's ever-inquisitive yet moral mother. These are not just the complex characters of 'The Room', but a small part in everyone's mind.I read somewhere that Tommy Wiseau used to be a psychologist, and so it would seem only natural for him to make a film of this nature, with disturbingly complex characters, and the small, seemingly irrelevant but impactful situations they are put in. Johnny's weird accent, Denny's random perversions, Lisa's utter lack of shame, and Mark's true innocence, are not just the characteristics of the characters, but they are all part of one's MIND.After I watched 'The Room' many times, I realized why the characters always acted and reacted weirdly. I understood the seemingly pointless scenes and what they ACTUALLY meant. The film is a surreal account of one's inner MIND.Thank you, Tommy Wiseau, for this cruelly misunderstood masterpiece of a film.

reviews.review_title: The Room is a rollercoaster of emotions.
reviews.content:
100% unironically, this movie is on my top #5 favourite movies.
This movie is funny the whole way through, and while i think that is in good part thanks to the audience I've seen it with, the movie itself is an absolute joy.The dialogue is bizarre, the sex scenes drag on, the camera work is weird and directly unprofessional and the acting. It feels almost intentionally bad. The actors are so distant, and the fact that Tommy insisted on filming on a green screen stage, rather than a live location for many scenes, only helps make it better.This movie is fantastic and i genuinely love it.For that, i give it 10/10.

reviews.review_title: The multi-talented Wiseau shines in one of the most exciting debut films of the century
reviews.content: There are very few individuals who have the sheer range of skills to act, write, and direct a movie. Foremost among those rare talents is Tommy Wiseau, perhaps the finest actor of his generation. This film, his debut, is universally regarded as the finest film of the decade, and indeed, one of the greatest of all time. Much has been written about the complex symbolism worked into the set designs; and unravelling the exact meaning of the football scene has provided fuel for countless dissertations. Indeed, this is a film likely to live on for generations.

If you have never seen The Room you owe it to yourself to see it. It's the citizen Kane of bad movies. You could not make a movie this bad if you tried. It's awful and I love it.Story lines are dropped without a thought,people say/do things that no human being would ever do,half the things don't matter to the story,it is a mess. You could cut out half the scenes and it would not matter.
