The acting is atrocious.Here are some actual quotes from the movie: "Leave your stupid comments in your pocket"."You're tearing me apart,Lisa".

reviews.review_title: Brilliant For All The Wrong Reasons
reviews.content: "The Room" is probably the funniest movie ever made despite not being a comedy, nor having any jokes that are funny in the typical sense. Tommy Wiseau's acting and writing is absolutely hilarious because of how terrible it is. The ridiculous pacing, repeating scenes and awful characters are so collectively terrible that once again, it's hilarious.So you may be wondering why I've rated it a 10/10. Well, that's because of how funny the film is. The unintentional terribleness and comedic "drama" scenes are so glorious that they NEED to be seen to be believed. I beg of anyone who has not seen "The Room" to see it ASAP. You will not regret it.

The only reason this film is remotely palatable is because of Newgrounds and all the memes that came after it. This film is literally on meme life support. The fact it takes itself seriously, the fact the actors try to act seriously and the fact that it is as narcissistic as its director really makes you question what the intent was.That said at least it's not disaster movie.

reviews.review_title: The Room is Love The Room is Life
reviews.content: The Room is by far the best movie I have ever seen in my short life. After viewing this I felt happy, angry and sad all at the same time. A fusillade of emotions is what Mr Wiseau delivers you, all on a platter of 'Oh Hi' and that angels laugh that he so luckily possesses. I am honestly surprised that this film is not number 1 on IMDb, it should be an everyone should rate it 10 stars out of 10. It is a rare cinematic gem that is so enjoyable, no matter what you were expecting, no matter what you know about the plot it is the most enjoyable and heart-warming hour and forty minutes you will ever spend in your life. That's a promise.The Room is Love, The Room is Life. The Room is Love, The Room is Life.

reviews.review_title: This movie is going to tear me apart.
reviews.content: Tommy Wiseau unrivaled directorial debut, Room is masterpiece and one of most underappreciated films of modern era. Every line and scene has much care and effort put in that easily puts many far more ambitious films to shame. Its character writing is outstanding and every line feels genuine and carries emotional weight. The film feature excellent and devoted cast, including fantastic performance from Greg Sestero and Juliette Danielle, though every role brilliantly portrayed. The story is marvelous feat in story telling, with intricate, compelling narrative that will keep you enthralled, intensely suspenseful cliff hangers, and heart-stopping ending. Anyone who seen it know this only modicum of heartfelt genius that make Room easily greatest film of all time.

I hated this movie in the beginning. After i found out about Franko's disaster artist movie and that this "the room" movie has a fanbase which is more like a cult, i gave this movie a second try and i watched it from a comedy perspective. And now im giving this 10/10 - its just best worst movie ever made! And watching franko's movie before this one would help a lot but the best option would be opposite way i guess - first this one and then the franko's one.

reviews.review_title: So bad it's good? Nah, it's just bad...Oh hi, Mark!
reviews.content: There's bad, then there's bad that's so awful it hits you like running full speed into a wall. Ninja Turtle movies are bad. Anything by Uwe Boll is bad. This is next level terrible. Tommy Wiseau's vanity project, this Tennessee Williams-wannabe nonsense is so terrible that mere words aren't enough to describe it.The plot, if you want to call it that, is contrived nonsense that features more sex scenes in the first half hour than in some Skinemax flicks, and overlong dialogue in desperate need of editing. There are scenes that go nowhere, lots of conversation that is meaningless, and characters that are underdeveloped and whose appearances make no sense.If you like long shots of San Francisco, this is definitely the movie for that. Most films use one or two expository shots, adding more if the film is picking up from a specific spot in a city, but for a long time, this movie stays primarily in the apartment, and has its characters engage in repetitive, meaningless conversation, like a cancer diagnosis being blown right past with no reaction from either character in the scene.Watching the Rifftrax version of this film is the only way it is watchable. That is an easy 10/10, and even as an MST3K fan, I've not laughed that hard in a long time.On its own, this movie is a pointless slog that needed someone to seriously check Tommy Wiseau's ego. It's horribly unwatchable, nothing happens of consequence until the birthday party, so that's an hour of time you can easily bypass and miss nothing, and the only real highlight for me is when Johnny blows his own head off. That itself should say everything about The Room.That said, I feel like The Disaster Artist will be a great telling of the making of this movie, as it's clear there had to be a lot of wacky shenanigans going on behind the scenes, and I'm looking forward to seeing how they played out.But the movie itself? Ye gads. Horrible. But I'll re-watch the Rifftrax version over and over again, no doubt about that.

reviews.review_title: This movie is like the world's best inside joke
reviews.content:
I watched this movie 5 years ago and I still quote it. I still recommend that people watch it even though the ending was spoiled for me by critics on Youtube. There aren't very many movies that are so bad that they're good, as acting has evolved you usually don't find movies with acting as bad as this one in it. This movie, however, delivers. This is one of the funniest bad movies I have ever seen and I don't even drink alcohol. This movie is actually funnier than the Ed Wood movies that I have seen.
The acting is corny at best and bizarrely funny at worst. There are three sex scenes, one in which the music skips. One of my hobbies is reviewing bad movies, I specialize in panned comedy movies actually. I would not recommend very many of the movies that I watch to my friends but I would recommend this one, especially in a group setting.
The sheer ineptness of the plot, script, and especially the acting is staggering. As far as the actual content goes you will find so much weird stuff in this movie. In one scene it shows what three or four people ahead of Johnny (the lead character) orders in a coffee shop. Why? I have no idea and neither will you. There are numerous scenes where Johnny and Mark throw a football back in forth for fun and one has them all in tuxedos! Why? Again, I have no idea and neither will you. The movie can be a bit depressing at times I suppose but the unintentional humor will likely have you laughing so hard that this will matter very little.
This is a one of a kind cinematic experience. Is it a terrible movie? Yes. Should people watch it? Absolutely. Seriously, watch this thing and wonder how it was even made, filmed, and financed. If you watch this with your friends you will likely have a great time with a terrible movie.
This movie is horrible, never seen anything more stupid. But it gets funny to see how this movie is so poorly made. Watching this movie is actually entertaining, but the quality is extremely low.
As a drama, like it was intended, this is a dumpster fire. As a comedy, it's... Slightly better. Laughed pretty good at all the bad acting and dialogue. Wouldn't watch it again but, oh hi mark.
It's hard to know what Wiseau was thinking. Was he intending this to be the worst film in the world? Or a comedy? It's a weird insight into the mind of an enigmatic and unusual real life character.
Not a good movie at all, but a really fun watch - especially if you love bad movies.

''Oh Hi Johnny, I didn't know it was you''
Simply from this quote we know how elegant and careful Tommy was with the script. And I fell in love, with arguably the worst film made.

reviews.review_title: I have a great fan theory - what if the movie is Johnny's perception of his reality and in reality he's a terrible person
reviews.content:
Okay, if you look at this movie as a man's perception of himself not reality, it's actually a pretty great movie.
If it is from Johnny's perspective. He sees himself as a great guy who is loved by all, friends and girlfriend, is brilliant at his job and is a fantastic lover (the way the sex scenes are like a porn movie with him as the star) but in reality his friend and girlfriend cheats on him, she accuses him of hitting her which he denies, he doesn't get the job he thinks he deserves and his whole life falls apart despite him being, in his eyes, a lovely person.
Maybe the whole movie is his delusion.
If you look at it like that, it is brilliant.
Clearly a true masterpiece. This is the most emotional movie ive ever watched. The acting was magnificent. A true piece of art work. Amazing 10/10

If anything, a lot of the reviews here understate what woefully piss-poor trashola this film is. It is an abject and aggressive failure on every conceivable level: costumes, score, acting, script, editing. And yet you must see it! Tommy Wiseau, the director, is a finger-painter who thought he was creating the Mona Lisa and accidentally drew the world's funniest and most wildly popular picture of a willy.At the end of the day, you have to rate any creative endeavour based on how well it achieves its intended goals and that's why, with a very heavy heart, I must award The Room one solitary star. This star is awarded for the act of existing, and I present it out of sheer charity. If enjoyment could only be derived from an appraisal of technical skill, the only thing worse than this train crash of a film would be watching it on a crashing train.But if you were to rate the experience of this movie it would get ten stars. Easy. The Room is unintentionally one hundred of the most riotously fun minutes out there and will propel you full-force into a state of hilarious insanity.

reviews.review_title: A masterpiece that everybody should watch.
reviews.content: I am among those people who watched "The Room" to get ready for the "Disaster Artist", featuring James Franco. I was ready to be confronted with the so-called worst movie ever, but what I saw is completely different: this movie is a true work of art, for many reasons.1. The plot - to whoever says the plot is weak or unconvincing, this is a plot that has the simplicity and the mediocrity of the real life - characters who are just okay, a life that is just okay. Which is not bad, on the contrary : it perfectly portrays our mediocre, prosaic human life. 2. Cinematography - Though I agree the scenario could look better, the music score is perfect for the movie, I'd say David Lynchesque somehow, especially during the dramatic scenes. It sets a kitsch yet creepy tone that makes this movie so unique. 3. Symbology - Lisa always wears a black piece of clothing when she's cheating on Johnny. Also, the red color dress that he gives to her symbolizes sacrifice, he wants her to give all her love to him, and at the same time, the union with Johnny feels like a terrible sacrifice to her. The football scenes represent the bonding between the male characters. All good characters are dark-haired and all psychopathic characters are light-haired, which is a good twist that makes this movie different and refuses to follow the "blonde guys are good, dark-haired guys are bad" stereotype. 4. Edition - one particular thing that really drew my attention and puts this movie among one the most amazing of all times is the deliberate repetition of the sex scenes between Johnny and Lisa. A clever yet subtle way to demonstrate how repetitive and prosaic was their relationship. Also, there are no time indicators in this movie. One scene jumps right next to the other, without actually impacting the understanding of the plot. 5. Characters - we see in Lisa a psychopath in its true form. Also, her relationship with her mother is a brilliant detail of this movie because it shows exactly where Lisa's psychopathic tendencies came from - her mother, who believes Lisa should only stay engaged to Johnny because he gives her money. The two women are so psychopathic that even when the mother talks about her breast cancer, the daughter is completely blasé about it, while the mother is in completely denial as well. Mark, on the other hand, is an opportunistic man who wanted to keep friends with Johnny because of his money and influence, and yet wanted to keep having sex with Lisa. He victimizes himself the whole movie trying to pretend "he was seduced" by the "manipulative bitch", refusing to take responsibility for his acts. Johnny, on the other hand, is the quirky yet naive man who just wants to be love and share his feelings with the world. You can see he has some personality disorder by looking at his insecurity and his mannerisms. He's extremely attached to people, which unfortunately led to his suicide. 6. Ending - there could never be a more realistic and nihilistic ending than this. Not even Lars von Trier or David Lynch could reach this kind of brutal and nihilistic ending without looking pretentious or over-the-top. Johnny's death is a punch in the viewer's face, and a reality check. I truly and sincerely think this is one of the BEST MOVIES I have ever seen, so clever, unique and unpretentious in all forms. This deserves to be praised alongside with Amadeus, Taxi Driver, Scarface and many others unpretentious yet great masterpieces of cinema.

Oh my god. This is the single greatest movie I have ever seen in my entire life. I watched some "masterpieces" in my life like The Godfather and Citizen Kane. I thought those were great movies at first, but then I watched the Room and it completely blows both of those movies out of the water. The writing in this movie is absolutely fantastic and the performances are absolutely breathtaking. Dialogue like "You're tearing me apart, Lisa!" has so much emotion and depth to it. I was crying when I was watching this movie. That's how good it was. Tommy Wiseau, Greg Sestero, Juliette Danielle and everyone else in the movie give excellent performances and are WAY better actors than actors like Marlon Brando, Daniel Day-Lewis and Robert De Niro. Those 3 actors absolutely terrible at acting. Tommy Wiseau is a masterful actor, director, writer and producer. This movie was so good that I watched it 3 times in one day and watched it more the next day. This movie is absolutely phenomenal and if you have never seen this movie, you are really missing out on something and maybe you should just quit your day job to watch this masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: Tommy Wiseau is a LEGEND,so is The Room
reviews.content: i am no exception to the fans of this movie or wiseau,who will always be remembered for this movie,even if he makes a movie like pulp fiction in the future.This movie is like a slow poison,the more you watch it the more addicted you will get to it. I suggested my friend to watch this movie and there will be blood back to back,and the effect was amazing.You can see so much similarities bwn day-lewis and wiseau,both are such method actors. This is probably the best screenplay and camera-work ever,and the performances are such which cannot be described. the only flaw with this movie is you cannot watch it in the theatre,because u'll laugh so hard that you might miss the next godly scene. Watch it at all cost.hail wiseau PS.to all the lovers of this movie also watch an Indian movie called gunda,which even tops this movie

I love this movie due to the stupidity of it. The director, producer, writer etc seemed very passionate about this project however he failed. I applaud after watching this film everytime because it shows how hard it is to make a film. 10/10 easily!

This film is so bad and inept that it is just the best thing I've ever seen simply because it's so awful. None of it makes sense and my 7 year old cousin could probably write and produce something ten times the quality of this.
It's still very entertaining though.

If The Room were a comedy film it would be fantastic, however, the film was made to be a drama, and if you take it seriously, the performance of the film is horrible, the script is one of the worst ever written, the editing is terrible and the direction is horrible. However, the film has fun, and it has a lot of fun, and it is very funny, the only reason I have not evaluated this film better is the fact that it was made as drama and takes itself very seriously. I recommend everyone to see this classic Cult bad, the best of the worst, The Room.

Great movie. Some will get the humor for those who don't I feel sorry for you. Tommy Wiseau is frickin genius. By the way for all you boneheads out there this movie is a COMEDY. Some looking for something it was never meant to be. The movie is complete FU to baseless human interaction we see in our everyday lives and BS film and TV melodrama. You see it once and you'll never be the same again Highly recommend. Go rent it, watch it,bathe in it.

Greatest movie ever made, only 1 award that cant be right, also the biggest crime since WW2. Only criticism is that the sex scenes were too long and the main character was to pretty. Also what were they feeding the characters, Eddie halls strength is subpar compared to them.
Yet unintentionally and through the Disaster Artist ends up being very watchable and funny
A shockingly bad film but through the Disaster Artist I found quite unintentionally funny. Bad writing and acting

Gripping, staggering and quite frankly breathtaking throughout the course of this fantastic masterpiece I could only begin to assume that Tommy Winseua was a perfectionist at work from the dialogue to the cinematography and plot I can comfortably say that this is the single greatest movie to ever be produced.To get started on one of the many focus points, the acting, I cant begin to believe that I wasted 3 hours watching shaw shanks redemption when I could have simply been watching the room on repeat. With quotes such as 'hi Mark' being said in such an exquisite fashion I uncontrollably zone out of reality and fully entice myself within the untouchable complete perfect cinematic experience.On to the next point the cinematography, having to rewatch the same angle on almost every sex scene through a window is just one of the multiple brilliant ideas that Tommy Winseua has used to make this film compete along side other top tier movies, and if that wasn't enough well he also made sure to add lots of necessary green screens such as when they are on the roof to give that extra thrilling action to the overall eye sex of a film.To sum up my review on the film the only true word I can use to describe this is unwatchable.

reviews.review_title: Just when you've seen it all...
reviews.content: You stumble upon something like "The Room". When I was first introduced to this film I was told "Don't think about it, just go with it." At first I didn't know what my buddy was talking about until I saw the flower scene. I don't believe I laughed so hard in my entire life. The movie really is lacking on a plot simply because you don't know what anything is going to lead to which makes it that much more exciting.I recently saw a screening of "The Room" in Austin, TX. This is where I met Tommy who was surprisingly shorter than the film portrays. Not only did I like the movie but Tommy as a person is a pretty down to Earth kind of guy. If you ever get a chance to go see a screening of this film and meet the man who created it, I would highly recommend it. Even if you have watched this film 20 or so times. The screenings can be compared so something like Rocky Horrer screenings. The audience can interact with the movie which makes it a great time.

reviews.review_title: Can a film be so bad, it's good?
reviews.content: This film is something else, I don't care who you are or what kind of films you watch, you will never see another film like this in your entire life.First, let me talk about the one thing everyone who has seen this film will think about, Tommy Wiseau's acting. What can you say about it, it is without doubt the worst acting that has ever been put on screen. Not one word he says through out the entire film will make you believe a thing that is going on. Yet at the same time, it's just so damn entertaining, my favorite scene is when he is having his tantrum towards the end of the film.The dialog in this film is also so strange it makes you think, how could a self respecting actor/actress agree to do such obvious bulls**t. But, at the same time, that is what makes it so interesting, I want to keep watching, it's hilarious.This film actually gets points for how bad it is. God, it had me in stitches. Mr Wiseau, take a bow, you have created something so bad it was actually kind of enjoyable.

Tommy Wiseau's unrivaled directorial debut, Room is masterpiece and one of most underappreciated films of modern era. Every line and scene has much care and effort put in that easily puts many far more ambitious films to shame. Its character writing is outstanding and every line feels genuine and carries emotional weight. The film feature excellent and devoted cast, including fantastic performance from Greg Sestero and Juliette Danielle, though every role brilliantly portrayed. The story is marvelous feat in story telling, with intricate, compelling narrative that will keep you enthralled, intensely suspenseful cliff hangers, and heart-stopping ending. Anyone who seen it know this only modicum of heartfelt genius that make Room easily greatest film of all time.

reviews.review_title: Where did you come from, where did you go, where did you come from Tommy Wiseau?
reviews.content: There is very little need for introduction to this movie as it is by far the most popular cult film in recent times and maybe ever. Also if you are reading this you have either already seen it or are planning to give it a go anyway. And I would encourage you if you haven't already to experience this piece of bizarro genius at least once especially if you're a cinephile. It truly is unlike anything else you will ever see. It might not be possible to make a more uproariously funny unintentional comedy than 'The Room'. Tommy Wiseau, the financier, producer, director, writer and star of this movie poured heart, soul and all of his passion into this disaster-piece. From the atrocious acting to the laughable dialogue to the inexplicably abandoned subplots to the women stereotypes, virtually every scene elicits thunderous laughter from the audience. What might be even funnier is when you find out that Wiseau intended the film to be a Tennessee Williams level drama. And there are obvious allusions to the melodramas of the 1950's/60's with stolen lines like 'You are tearing me apart!' taken directly from Nicholas Ray's 'Rebel Without a Cause' but without any of the context and spun into hilarity.What is truly remarkable about 'The Room' is how it has sustained for this long and how it became a cult classic. There are tons of bad movies that get released every single year and fade into obscurity but not this one. No, not 'The Room'. It has even managed to make its ridiculously high budget of $6 Million back after countless midnight screenings worldwide since it first came out in 2003. You see what sets this particular awfully bad movie apart from other awfully bad movies is that it never feels like Tommy Wiseau is not trying to make something special. And make something special he did with what is now widely known as 'The Citizen Kane of bad movies'.If you want to find out more about 'The Room' and how it was made then check out the book 'The Disaster Artist' written by Greg Sestero, the actor who plays Mark in the movie and Tommy's real life best friend, and journalist Tom Bissell. Then go watch the adaptation of the book, which keeps the same name, directed by and starring James Franco as Tommy Wiseau. It also stars Franco's brother Dave as Greg Sestero and a plethora of other recognizable faces such as Seth Rogen, Alison Brie and Paul Scheer. The movie is garnering a lot of awards buzz and at this point in time has been nominated for two Golden Globes including Best Picture (Musical or Comedy) and Best Actor (Musical or Comedy) for James Franco. Its going to be truly surreal seeing Tommy Wiseau finally attending these awards shows in the coming months, something which he thought 'The Room' would allow him to do all those years ago. Instead he had to wait for a great movie to be made about his terrible movie.

Watching the room is something you need to go into with the correct mindset. If you are expecting a high quality movie with a fantastic storyline... this movie is not for you. However, if you are expecting entertainment and a movie theater full of cult followers throwing spoons, this is exactly what you are looking for. When I sat down to watch the room for the first time, with much anticipation, it was everything I was looking for-- A movie so bad that it was actually good. My favorite part of the movie is the blatant disregard for truth i.e. "Lisa is so beautiful" is repeated every other line when she clearly needs to cut back on the blue eyeshadow and lose a few lbs before she can be labeled "beautiful. " Despite the plot holes, bad acting, and bizarre sex scenes the film is so unintentionally hilarious that I can't imagine leaving the theater without a smile. I highly recommend watching it at a midnight showing sometime, highly worth it. 9 out of 10 stars, after watching the movie I will definitely return and become a "roommate."

This movie saved me from breast cancer. God bless this American hero. I bet if I ever meet this godly figure in person I would shed a tear. If Tommy Waiseau was a religious figure, I would worship him for as long as I lived. I am one more Tommy Wiseau movie away from getting a Tommy Wiseau chest piece tatto.
This movie is very horrible. The guy give a smile in everytime.

reviews.review_title: A Movie that indirectly teaches you how NOT to make a movie.
reviews.content: Tommmy Wiseau's The Room is one of the most important pieces of film-making ever created. This 2003 movie with a 6 Million Dollar Budget has been memed on to death, had a enticing documentary and book surrounding its creation; and with such a insanely chaotic and toxic production, its amazing that this film ever made it to the big screen, even if it only ranked in $1,916 initially.Being a passion project of the Writer, Director, Producer, and Lead Star Tommy Wiseau. The Room is so astonishingly terrible and the writing is so open-handed that it almost becomes a character study of him. You see how he views America, what he views as a normal 'american' friendship as they toss footballs in a alleyway over and over again, and you even get a sense of his past and his views on women with his portrayal of Lisa as a character. Despite being a R-Rated film, there's almost a child-like obliviousness to this film with how characters have unexplainable mood-swings and one-dimensional personality traits.While its attempting to be a tragic story, The Room is so abysmally bad at what its trying to convey it loops around to being the perfect comedy. The performances leave nothing to be desired because the pure insanity behind the script and their acting creates scenes that are truly unforgettable; and when the film manages to accomplish something good, whether it be the grande & epic score or the occasional good looking shot. You will be impressed with the little things it sometimes gets right admist the flames of a terrible movie.If you are studying film, watch this movie and watch / read The Disaster Artist. Everything falls apart so magically that it not only creates a unforgettable viewing experience, but one that emphasizes the importance of a strong and unified team. If you feel your production is anything like The Room, then run away as soon as you can.

I watched it after watching the Disaster Arist. I think it made this film more entertaining. In hindsight, had I watched this first, I would have been sorely disappointed. So watch them in that order!

So bad that the makers of this film could not have been serious. Not hilarious enough that they could've been trying to be funny.Same holds true for some of the reviews. Attempts to find symbolism in the football tossing, tuxedos, repetitious sex scenes, etc are so ridiculous that they seem like they must be meant as a joke. Unfortunately, I think some of these reviewers are serious and are reading deeper meaning into the parts of the movie that are so bad that their existence can only be explained by a level of thinking most people aren't capable of. Sadly, this isn't a higher level of thinking but rather some sub-level.However, some of the reviews are clearly meant to be tongue in cheek and are truly the only entertaining thing to come from this film.

reviews.review_title: The Room is a brilliant American black comedy.
reviews.content: The whole movie is about betrayal between friends and can make you think about your life and your relationships. The film is a great LESSON picture showing the tragedy of an unfaithful mate or relationship which everyone considering getting involved in such a relationship should see-- they'll think twice before doing so. The story is dramatized with artistic sensitivy and good taste but the message is clear. The Room is a brilliant American black comedy. This is a film for everybody.

reviews.review_title: Is wonderfully horrible the right word???
reviews.content: First of all, I have never written a review on IMDb before because I've had no interest because people rate this stuff all the time so there's no need to add "just another one"....BUTThis movie inspired me. It inspired me to get up everyday and be happy that I wasn't "that guy" who made the (possible) worst movie in recent history. And you know what? It's not even the worst movie ever, I recently watched Shutter Island and I couldn't even get through that but this movie made me curious on what funny line or bad acting would happen next. I was literally brought to tears of joy reading the reviews of this film after watching this movie. I gave this movie a 2 STAR rating. 1 for it's quality of...everything, and 1 for making my week!! I haven't laughed so hard recently. Yes, I realize that this isn't even exactly a full on review; it's more of how over joyed I'm feeling right now that I can make it in life. Simply said: This movie is so bad...it's good.Chip chip chip!!!!!

The movie is as bad and as cringe as anyone says it is. And that's what makes it such a beauty. Extremely bad script written by the man himself to which all the actors adhere to by the letter, people entering and exiting the set with no explanation and everything is just out of place and horrendous. It's a masterpiece because of all of these things. If you need something to cringe at and laugh about, please watch. This is a terrible, terrible joke, and by joke I mean in its literal sense. Laughing all the way through.Do yourself a favour and read the Trivia section of this movies page, it'll make it more fun.

Literally all I can say about this entire movie is that Lisa is the most pathetic, bitchy, unforgivable woman ever! Like she has absolutely NO heart to put someone through that kind of heartache. She didn't have one single savable characteristics throughout the entire movie. I felt really bad for Johnny! Then her at the end acting like she's upset that he's dead!? F**K that biznitch!

reviews.review_title: Didn't even have to watch the movie to enjoy it.
reviews.content: I haven't actually watched this movie let alone heard of it until one of my friends told me to check out the Nostalgia Critic's review about it on Youtube. Omg, I never laughed so hard in my life!! His running commentary about it was hilarious :D At some point I might watch it if I get the chance but it's definitely worth checking out if you want to have some laughs.The part I found the most amusing is the dialogue between Johnny and the woman behind the counter at the flower shop. Just the order of what was said between the two of them didn't make sense and seemed to be backwards. I noticed that even before the Nostalgia Critic mentioned it lol!!

Like many of my generation, I have been bit by the bad movie bug by MST3K. But so many bad movies are just bad: boring, uninteresting, not laugh out loud hilarious. It can be said that comedy cannot be comedy if it is forced, it must be spontaneous to be real comedy. There is no way this movie was originally intended to be bad like this, it took a work of mad genius to create this.And it is mad. Most of the "dialogue" is exposition. Characters are described by others and not shown who they are through what they do. Everything's incorrect about filming. I'm not a film student or anything but there's a certain feel about when it's correct in a place of dialogue to cut to the other person. There's a way people interact that's natural, even with bad lines. But these lines are not just delivered badly, they're insane! It's almost indescribable. After viewing this, I've struggled to find other bad movies that are so entertainingly hilarious but I seem to end up just finding boring-unengaging junk, such as battlefield earth. Foodfight! seems like another contender. Usually filmmakers are admonished for churning out bad movies but this movie deserves an applause. I was literally screaming and howling through this. So many "what just happened?!" moments. And that flower shop scene, wow. Possibly the pinnacle of film making. And why does this feel like a bad mid 90's made for TV movie? Everyone and everything seemed 90's. Go see this movie!
That's the only thing that really dissapointed me about this brilliant movie. The tragic lack of plastic spoons pretty much throughout. I'm planning a re-make.

reviews.review_title: This movie is like nothing else in the history of cinema
reviews.content: There are times in life, when you have to ask yourself, what is the meaning of life? For me at least this time in my life was when I experienced tommy wiseau's production of the room. this movie breaks the boundaries of the cinematic industry. Between Tommys mind blowing performance that rivals such greats as Clark Gabel in gone with the wind, Heath ledger as the joker, and Wilson the volleyball in castaway, and the fact that it was made with a budget of 2000 dollars, In my opinion it is the single greatest cinematic achievement of all time. Citizen Kane has nothing on this baby. Tears are falling on this keyboard thinking about all the passionate and groundbreaking scenes and lines such as YOU ARE TEARING ME APART LISA! and many other treasures. This movie breaks the laws of physics and even rivals Jesus Christ as one of the greatest things ever...nah im just kidding this movie sucks balls lol bro!!! XD

You have to see this movie with friends. The best lines to use with your friends. If you watch this alone then you didn't watch it right. Must see in the theater or else the experience is not the same. The audience will go nut in LA theaters. Too bad this type of audience reaction isn't anywhere else. When see movie is shown in your area, take the time to try to watch it. It is one funny movie that is only shown once a month. LA is waiting for the DVD. Can't wait for the DVD to come out. I wish there was The Room 2: Denny's revenge. The perfect sequel to The Room. I love the lines and action scenes with the music. I wouldn't want to mess with Chris R on the roof. You are tearing me apart Lisa is can only be best spoken By Tommy Wiseau.

reviews.review_title: The Room is a brilliant American black comedy.
reviews.content: The whole movie is about betrayal between friends and can make you think about your life and your relationships. Each character has his own characteristic approch to life. The Room is a brilliant American black comedy. This is a film for everybody.

Anyone who gave this thing a 10...really?? THIS is the best film you've ever seen? Look, there are terrible movies I enjoy that are otherwise awful in every sense, but you don't see me rating them with 10s, skewering the overall rating. If I could give this a negative number I would. There is nothing redeemable about this putrid piece of whatever it is. Sure, if you're really drunk or doped out of your head I can see it being a laugh riot. But a 10? Just stop it.

If an alien made a movie about Johnny, your typical american banker and his cheating good for nothing future wife Lisa, who is in the computer business and their life together in San Francisco.It might not have talent or reason but it has a soul and not many movies have that. Worth watching.

reviews.review_title: Tommy Wiseau's excellent directorial debut, The Room is a masterpiece and one of the most underappreciated films in the past decade.
reviews.content:
Every line and scene has so much care and effort put into it that it easily puts so many movies that have come out in the past decade at shame. The character writing is outstanding and every line feels so genuine and carries so much emotional weight. With and all star cast with fantastic actors like Greg Sestero and Juliette Danielle just to name a few. The story is marvelous feet in story telling, with a complex narrative which will keep you guessing, with cliff hangers and a surprising ending (Which is the most emotional ending in all of film) makes this easily the best movie of all time.
10/10 for sure

reviews.review_title: This could be the worst film you have ever seen but it is so bad, it is laughable.
reviews.content: The writing is so poor that whenever Mr. Wiseau cannot come up with something interesting or realistic (which is in every scene), a character says either "I don't want to talk about it," "Whatever" or "Don't worry about it." The leading man looks like Tiny Tim from LAUGH-IN and sounds like Borat trying to do some serious acting. His "sexy" girlfriend is overweight and sits around like a third-rate porn star. I can't really tell why the odd college boy is even here except to get in trouble for buying drugs and to have some sort of weird man-crush on Johnny. The "best friend" doesn't even know how Johnny met his girlfriend of 7 years, the same one he is having an affair with. Every time she slips out of her Walmart blouse, he exclaims with great surprise, "Hey! What's going on here?" There really is no reason for anything that happens in this movie to happen. Dialogue is trite, nobody seems to have a purpose for being where they are or saying what they say. Everyone acts like they barely know one another (e.g. lovers, best friends, mother and daughter all behave very awkwardly around each other). One friend, the psychologist just disappears. The mother announces she has breast cancer and no one really cares, including her. Grown men toss a football four feet from one another. No reason.Probably the very worst parts are the nude scenes with Tommy Wiseau. I mean, seriously, how nauseating does he have to make this already abysmal film. Fast forward through those tawdry scenes.

reviews.review_title: As irresistibly erratic as Trump's presidency, but a lot more fun
reviews.content: It's hard to imagine a released movie gone worse than this one. It's so spectacularly bad that you start to perfidly enjoy the infantile foolishness behind every scene and dialogue. Almost everything you are going to see is inexplicable and plain stupid. Once you've overcome disgust and second-hand embarrassment hard to swallow, you will take a wonderful trip through a hilarious failure, laughing all the time, shocked by the sheer power of surprise and waywardness of almost every scene you see. The director's foolishness is literally beyond belief.It's amazing.You wonder how some actors and staff could resist Wiseau's erratic directing, or how he himself must have been unaware of everything. Then, you think of Donald Trump's presidency and start to feel sorry for the staff around him.You will end up wanting to know more about the movie and Tommy Wiseau, and watching that disaster a third or fourth time to make sure you didn't miss some real gem of brilliant idiocy hidden in the background or between two lines.Best enjoyed with a couple of friends and a few light joints.

reviews.review_title: The worst movie ever made....yet somehow the most watchable!
reviews.content: I was going to give it a 10/10 out of ten for its watchability, but then I remembered I gave Breaking Bad a 10/10 - a real, deserved, perfect score. I realised I would be betraying the greatness of BB by putting it on par with The Room.Every minute of this film will make you smile. The acting is atrocious - the worst I've ever seen. The plot line's ridiculous and the characters are utter idiots. However, you could watch this over and over again without getting bored (and a lot of people do, trust me). If you're not in a good place, throw this on your TV, it'll cheer you up straight away!

reviews.review_title: Wow, Just-Just, Wow: A Complex and Detailed Retrospective on The Room
reviews.content: This movie is amazing! The acting is poor, the dialogue and writing are the worst I've ever seen, it fails miserably at telling a serious and complicated story. And yet, it manages to be the best thing ever!

When you get a person that is totally disconnected from reality, with an unimaginably distorted view of his abilities, and combine it with the worst writing and acting, and throw in 6 million dollars, you get a movie that is so shamelessly bad that you enjoy watching it. I couldn't look away the first time I saw it. One of the reasons we love comedy or horror is that we're not the ones being laughed at or chased by a killer. This film has both, comedy of absurd with the horror of the most extreme side of the scale of terribleness. This is a must watch best worst film of all time.

I liked "The Room" because it is a movie that does what it set out to do, tackle life's issues of "love, passion, betrayal, and lies". The cinematography and plot structure set the movie so as to not drift off subject and lose any momentum and energy that this movie so boldly is full of. The characters are people you can relate to, not like most mainstream production that depict grandeur.The Room tackles life's lessons with nearly all major characters and many minor characters. Connecting some part of myself with at lest one aspect of each character let me enjoy the movie in its entirety, instead of just picking favorites. If you are someone grappling with one or all of life's issues or have yet to realize the issues that you might have, The Room will leave you enlightened.

The Room is literally the Citizen Kane of bad movies. The acting is terrible and lots of subplots. But, before I watched this film, I heard somewhere on YouTube and saw the title "The Room" so I assumed it was just some crappy horror film and forgot about it. I had no idea who Tommy Wiseau was, until The Disaster Artist came out. So as you can guess, I got curious. And I watched the film. It was NOT what I thought it was. It was just so weird and odd. It's not just Tommy Wiseau who's odd, every actor in this film seems odd. The film is about a successful banker named Johnny (Tommy Wiseau) who live happily in San Francisco with his fiancée, or "future wife" Lisa (Julliete Dannielte). Until she gets board for no reason, and cheats on him with his best friend Mark (Greg Sestro). From there on, nothing will be the same.This is one of those films where it's so bad it's good. And I am a big fan of this movie and can't stop watching it. Tommy Wiseau himself has stated that this film was always meant to be a comedy, so I guess it was never actually meant to be taken seriously.Now, I've talked a lot about the bad stuff, but let's talk about the good stuff.I think the reason why people still watch this film is because it brings people together. All over the world there's midnight screenings of it and people love it and laugh together and throw footballs to each other. It's very funny and I highly recommend it.When I watch The Room today, and don't see a funny cult classic. I see a reflection of an odd but very talented man who had a very clear vision and wanted to share it with the world. I think one thing I love about Tommy Wiseau is, he dosen't care what other people think, and I really respect him for that. So I'll end this review with a quote by Tommy Wiseau."You can laugh, you can cry, but please don't hurt each other" - Tommy Wiseau

reviews.review_title: Like Watching A Spectacular Rainbow Of A Trainwreck.
reviews.content: Not since watching 'Plan Nine From Outer Space' and 'Blair Witch Two: The Book Of Shadows' have I seen such a vulgar display of cinematic bastardization. This movie is undeniably the worst movie I have ever and hopefully ever will have the misfortune of seeing. That being said, despite the terrible mutilation of entertainment, I have never laughed harder during a movie. Without a group of close friends to watch with this movie would be borderline impossible to watch. I mean that quite literally, the sheer stupidity is a true despicable display of humanity. Tom Wiseau should be sterilized, I mean that, another Wiseau in this world is the worst thing I can fathom. In conclusion, the movie is not only awful but is a laughable attempt at a cinematic punchline.

The script was awful but it was so awful that I could not stop laughing. Tommy wiseau was the writer producer director and main character. If you can find a way to see this movie for free watch it if you have to pay to see it don't bother it's not worth it. Get out of my house mother f*****. Black dynamite is another great movie10/11/10Similar movie : star trek . . . Elipsis . More.'s....Of mice and men

The first thing you need to know about the Room is that it is written by a foreigner pretending to be American. This movie is written in his same style of speaking. When you meet the man himself, you realize that this is just him in a movie. Truly this movie is Tommy Wiseau.Tommy Wiseau in real life is just as hilarious as this movie. The way he talks, what he says, how he walks and throws a football. The Room is like hanging out with Tommy Wiseau at any moment you feel like doing so. If Tommy Wiseau writes and directs any movie I think it will be the same as this movie.The hilarious one liners are endless, both from the man himself and in the movie. The bad acting, bad settings, bad just anything in the movie are just as funny.Now the experience of watching this movie by yourself is just not quite as fun with a few friends or even better yet at a theater with hundreds of people. But it is one of the few bad movies you can watch by yourself and be entertained.And that's what this movie is, pure comedic entertainment disguised to look like a drama with a message.So remember, you can laugh you can cry you can express yourself, but please don't hurt anyone.

This new film by Producer, actor Tommy Wiseau, demands that you have a sense of humor. This black comedy includes the best cinematography of San Francisco since Hitchcock's Vertigo. Wiseau, a new and mysterious presence on the Hollywood film making scene, produced and stars as the lead in this roller coaster ride of emotions which run the gamut from hysterical laughter to gut wrenching guilt. Wiseau spoof's the Hollywood love story. It's a campy version of a Tennessee Williams film with a little John Waters thrown in. He wants everyone to see themselves. The lead actress is every guy's nightmare with a sexual taste for your best friend. This is a story about a nymphomaniac with great breasts and the victim who is clueless about her scattered sexual outlook about men. Worth seeing. It's now 2011, eight years later and I would never have believed that this problematic film would have become a cult classic,"worst movie ever made" with 12 midnight monthly showings around the U.S., all these years. Edward Lozzi & Associates PR, first crticized for promoting this thing, has been vindicated for helping to turn this nightmare into a classic.
Ok this is very fun to watch we all know it, its an interactive masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: I don't care who you are...
reviews.content: I hate this movie. Granted, it's SUPER hilarious to watch, because everyone in it is an idiot, but there is no way, I repeat, no WAY that this was originally meant to be a comedy. It's intentions are FAR to serious, it's acting is too horrible to do on purpose, and it's plot is just, well, stupid. Those of you who will claim that the story "has heart" must be smoking some type of crack (or you must be related to Wiseau), because, if you haven't noticed, IT'S ABOUT A GUY WHO IS BEING CHEATED ON BY HIS FIANCÉE WHO'S MOTHER HAS BREAST CANCER (which is an unneeded plot development, as it is unimportant), A BOY WHO IS BEING ATTACKED BY DRUG DEALERS WHO APPARENTLY LIKES TO WATCH ADULTS MAKE LOVE (where are his parents??), AND AT THE END, HE KILLS HIMSELF! Now do you wanna go and try to tell me it was supposed to be a "heartfelt black comedy"? NO. Because, It's a Cinematic Abortion in all of its non-glory. It's terrible, and it made ME want to kill myself. He should go back to WHATEVER country he's from and leave America's Film Industry the Hell ALONE! If you think it's a comedy, watch it AGAIN and tell me otherwise.

Everything is wrong about this movie - every phrase, intonation, look, camera angle, movement, the plot, the synthetic occasional voiceovers. It's so wrong that you end up not being able to stop watching it. It's addictive.

For lack of a better term, this "film" is crap. I can't believe Adult Swim, which normally airs humorous subject matter, would waste air time with this tripe. It's not funny - unless you think REALLY bad, less-than-amateur, middle school film projects deserving a D- grade are funny. I give it a D- only because it's in color. It's not deep, introspective, or worthy of any sort of serious thought or reflection, unless you're a complete idiot. Actually, the fact that I sat through the whole thing thinking that there may be some redeeming quality to this waste of time makes me feel like an idiot. The best part about it, if anything, was the fact that that tool blew his brains out at the end. I only wish that could have happened in the first two minutes.In a film, people are supposed to act. I think the people in this film try to, but it doesn't work. Maybe the point of the whole thing was to show how not to make a film? Hmm...Tommy Wiseau, your 15 minutes were done and gone after you appeared on Tim and Eric Awesome Show Good Job! (people with talent). See, in T&E ASGJ, when people act poorly, it's funny because they don't make an attempt at seriousness. You did, and it was just pathetic. So try harder or better yet, just go away.And Adult Swim, you suck for airing that crap in the first place. Stick to what works. Like Family Guy.

*may contain spoilers*This movie is a prime example of a movie that is so bad that is funny. Get the movie, put it on and be prepared to laugh right away. i laughed when i saw the credits. One guy (Tommy Wiseau) had so many roles from Producer, Director, Writer and LEAD ACTOR!!! and for those who want to know who Tommy Wiseau is, well, just imagine a creepy looking paper white guy with long black hair. he looks like someone you would try to get away from on a Subway due to his creepy look. his acting though is just so awful that it's funny. if someone told me that English is his first language, i would laugh because the way he reads his lines is like watching a 5 year old reading a dictionary. he's got to be the worst lead actor in a movie and it's the reason it's funny is because you got to remember that he's badly acting and saying lines that HE WROTE!!!as for the movie itself, if you like sex scenes, sex talks with VERY little plot with the exception of a cheating woman and lots of footballs being thrown, then you'll like it.Get this movie just for the simple fact that Tommy's character is funny from his bad acting to even his mocking chicken line!! he can't even get a chicken noise right!!

There are few movies that can bring people together the way this movie has. I had not seen this until recently when the remake was released. I quickly learned that people held private and public screenings of this movie all over the country simply because they enjoy watching it together. When I finally watched the movie I felt like I was being ushered into a community. The experience was 10/10, why not rate the movie 10/10?
This is the greatest film that i ever seen. There is nothing that will compare to this.

reviews.review_title: It's not the classic that Troll 2 is.
reviews.content: I was hoping for a movie that was so bad it's good, and I felt a little let down by this. When starting the movie I was amused to see Tommy Wiseau's name appear twenty times in the opening credits. I knew I was in for a treat as soon as Wiseau said his first line, "Hi babe". Then we got a gratuitous sex scene that lasted way to long, then we saw Lisa talking to her mother about how she doesn't love him anymore, then she cheats on Johnny with his best friend, and soon I noticed a pattern happening in the plot. Gratuitous sex scene, Lisa talks to mother, Lisa cheats with Mark, rinse and repeat. Eventually the story does go somewhere, without flagging myself for spoilers, let's just say it has an unintentionally hilarious grand finale. Although Wiseau is the most hilariously awful actor, because of the repetition of plot, and the super cynical nature of this movie I didn't like it as well as other bad movies.

reviews.review_title: Not that bad, after what I've been told...
reviews.content: It's a low budget movie, alright. The scripting and acting are a little bit cheesy at times but overall is a decent movie within the genre.

The Room is an independent film that was written, produced, and directed by Tommy Wiseau, a wealthy, wannabe actor/director who starred himself in its leading role. While initially ridiculed by the viewing public, The Room later attained cult status for its consistently uninspired scripting and second-rate acting. The peculiar constancy of its grade-B qualities derives from Wiseau's East-European origins, origins which bestowed a subtle, but pervasive cultural dysfluency that bled over not only onto his screen play, but also onto his spoken lines. The flattened affect attendant on this dysfluency gives The Room an aura of incompetence and a soap-opera-like character. The Room ultimately inspired the 2017 movie, The Disaster Artist, which details the story behind Tommy Waseau and the making of The Room.

This is my favorite awful movie. I was introduced to this movie earlier this year and have probably seen it 7 times since. So bad it's good. If you want something terribly cheesy to laugh at, watch Tommy Wiseau's The Room. The memorable quotes have permanently entered my everyday lexicon, for better or worse.The Room has changed my life. You won't be sorry you gave this film a try. The whole time I was watching it, I felt like I was sitting on an atomic bomb waiting for it to go off. Keep an eye out for the spoons in the background. The best way to experience this movie is at a midnight showing, which I have yet to do. It is a similar experience to The Rocky Horror Picture show. A cult movie of (bad) caliber.

reviews.review_title: Everybody is laughing but the joke is on you Tommy Wiseau.
reviews.content: If an alien came to Earth and heard about movies but had never seen one and got very excited about the idea and decided to make a movie he could have made something like 'The Room'.Everything is wrong, there isn't a single line that isn't awkward and bizarre. The sex scenes look like they are not just ignorant of film-making but of human anatomy.It ends up being quite a funny movie. Its hard to give a number to, because its quite entertaining in a train-wreck kind of way. It would be brilliant if it was done on purpose.

reviews.review_title: its like an unintentional parody (which makes it 10x better)
reviews.content: the best way to describe the room is as a medium budget porno which as a side project attempts to build up a story. everything about it - setting, acting, score, props, screams porno. the many many gratuitous and overly long sex scenes (for which they reuse footage ha ha) mean its like a porn production crew decided to undertake a film (and the result is just as uncomfortable as it sounds)before watching it i was half expecting a sort of vaguely crap film, but i can assure you that it is flat out and 100% dire from the off + you will not be disappointed. even the opening music cant be described as anything but bizarrely inappropriate and it literally continues as it sets out for 100 minutes. i also v much enjoyed the amount of times Tommy Wiseau tells us in the opening credits that its his film and hes starring and he wrote it and he directed it and he was an executive producer. its like do you know you have the talent of a frozen turkey leg

Writer, director, actor, producer Tommy Wiseau had created a coming of age film The Room in modern day in San Francisco that is a masterpiece. You can easily see yourselves in this movie and make you laugh or cry.The Room is a black comedy about betrayal, love,friendships, and loyalty. Excellent! I want to see it again.

okay, i think that it is pretty safe to say this has become a cult classic. however this is not as a result of adapt cinematography but more the lack of it. you can see this just by looking at the format of the movie, it was shot in two different formats. this move is so bad that its so good the poor acting and appalling story line. make this movie simply fantastic to watch.you can be watching this move and think wow, I'm actually really bored and then BAM some random line comes from no where making everyone watching it burst out laughing. when watching this movie it re mined me of getting the giggles in an exam and know that your not suppose to be laughing and yet you cant stop this movie is so appallingly funny!the rating does not reflect the move just what they where trying to do/portray i like to think this is a read between the lines movie because all the best bits are unintended.

reviews.review_title: A MUST FOR ALL MEN IN AMERICA TO SEE!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.content: I have seen this movie twice, and it grows on you. The characters are endearing are you get caught up in their affection for one another and their togetherness. It is something that many men can identify  with from their past or have to look forward to in their future. Some men will keep this as their secret. It clearly shows the timeless triangle of the friendship between two men brought down and completely destroyed by a beautiful, remorseless and deceitful woman using sex and co-dependency as her lethal weapons.The character, Johnny, is so endearing in his complete  trust of his finance,the beautiful Lisa. Johnny is a very sweet and trusting man .The director really missed many  heart stopping moments  that were lost, because of rushing through the scenes that were very loaded with tension and should have been played out to the max. There should have been longer heart stopping pauses, but instead the moment was lost by rushing through the scenes that were exploding with  sexual tension. There were several of these such instances at Johnny's surprise birthday party when everyone was all around having a good time laughing and not knowing how volatile the situation in the room was. The movie really missed it by not exploiting this to the fullest. This was what the whole movie had been building up to. There was so much sexual tension between the unfaithful Lisa and Johnnie's cheating friend, Mark. The air was riveting and charged with the buildup from the start of  the whole movie. The directors should have really made a big deal of long, tension filled, up close eye contact, between Lisa and Mark. Mark was definitely not thinking with his brain. These looks and tensions could have been played out  and underscored so much more.I was disappointed this huge opportunity was barely tapped. This was my biggest disappointment about the entire movie. There should have been more exchange tension filled looks between Lisa and Mark, Mark and Johnnie, and others that knew, but mostly between Lisa and Mark, and the camera should have let time stand still with a close up of the emotion in Lisa and Mark's eyes. Everyone would squirm as the whole party of friends stood in the circle awaiting..... the bomb to explode.....how..... and with whom????? Let the tension exist and prolong it so we all get our money's worth for the.... climax.Lisa was completely  spontaneous, unpredictable and with no inhibitions to get what she wanted..... wherever she wanted it. Even Lisa's mother could not believe how remorseless her daughter was.This movie gets better each time you see it.  All the characters are so endearing you feel like you are actually there with them and they are your friends. Each character is special. There are heart stopping moments of suspense when you think Johnny will find out about his best friend, and will freak out, he is so in love with her. Johnny's best friend, Mark, is a sexy hunk who would make any woman melt. The impetuous, Lisa, is the woman every woman fears and every man secretly longs to be seduced by. Johnny is the man every woman wishes they had to  completely trust and adore them. Lisa starts to make everyone feel uncomfortable and uneasy  because she has no impulse control. She is out to lure and seduce every man that comes close to her. Some of the scenes showed Lisa, with her huge violet eyes and dark eyebrows, as being very innocent and sweet,  and you actually feel sorry for her. The only person that really seem to be able to touch Lisa, was the young boy that Johnny had adopted. Only with him, did she seem to think about someone besides herself.Look for Mark and Lisa to be Hollywood's next sweethearts. They look just sensational on the big screen together. I don't know where Tommy found a couple that looks so much alike. When they are on the big screen together, they are beautiful.The only problem is Lisa is evil, and Mark is good. But Mark like the other men, is unable to resist Lisa.  The music goes perfectly with the movie. Get the soundtrack. This movie deals with something that is between us and all around us everyday and always will be. This movie was filmed in San Francisco. Something about the movie haunts you  and you end up hungering for more. The movie was very lighthearted, different and entertaining because it took your mind  inside other's lives and their unique friendships. A film we can all relate to.... and fear or.. anticipate.... depending on if you are male or female....and which role you are playing!      Thank you, Tommy-

Lisa and Johnny are about to get married. Lisa gets tired of him and cheats on him with his best friend, Mark. Johnny finds out. Johnny kills himself. That's it. This is the plot of "The Room". Yet it's over an hour and a half long. Wow.Tommy Wiseau's tour de force is considered by many one of the worst, if not THE worst movie ever made. I agree. Totally. There's just so much wrong on every front. The acting is atrocious. Nobody is even remotely close to be considered an actual actor; Wiseau's line delivery is painful to watch. It's as if he was bored or annoyed by the lines he himself wrote. Speaking of lines, the script. Most of the time it doesn't make sense. The same dialogues are repeated various times during the movie. For example, Lisa and her mother always have the same conversation, with a few minor changes. To say it gets tedious is an understatement. New characters come into the story with no actual purpose and without being properly introduced. It gets confusing, to say the least. Too many love making scenes that are too long and weird, even. In the first 26 minutes, I counted three sex montages. THREE! The music is dull and repetitive. Technically speaking, I honestly can save nothing. So yeah, it's terrible. But because of that, it's hilarious!This movie has become a cult. I've always heard about it and now I can see why. It's so funny that it makes you wonder whether Tommy Wiseau is the biggest troll of all time or this was his serious effort to make a movie. His acting is the worst among one of the worst actor ensemble I've ever seen in a movie. Honestly, he is the main reason for the "success" of the picture. There are so many memorable lines, made famous by his delivery and his emotionless face. "You're tearing me apart, Lisa!" is one of them. It's just so funny, man! There's so many more elements that make this movie such a cult loved by many. However, I don't want to say too much. I advise you to watch, if you haven't already. Yes, it's awful, one of the worst things I've seen in my life. But it is an experience you will never forget. And I'm still not sure whether that's a good or a bad thing. Oh, by the way, how's your sex life?
It's funny without trying to be. I get why there was a film made about this film.

reviews.review_title: It's so bad! But great at the same time
reviews.content: Went to Charles cinema to see this movie. Tommy was doing live Q&A.The movie has a cult fallowing. It's so badly made that it's so entertaining to watch. This movie is perfect for a Friday night, few drinks and friends. Super funny.

I believe this movie obtained it's huge fan-base because of Mr. Wiseau's incessant plugging. I fell in love with this movie almost immediately and have seen it many times since the first viewing. Part of the initial reaction is due to another IMDb review in which the author goes into great depth on how repulsive the love scenes and the story as a whole are. I brought this movie to a friend's to show her and she accused me of trying to watch a soft-core porn with her. It was awkward to watch even on my lonesome. I would have to say my favourite scene is the flower shop scene (the transaction between Tommy and the florist is immaculate). To sum it up, this movie is comparable in quality to Birdemic. Watch this movie as soon as you can.

The Room is one of the most hilarious movies ever made. In my opinion it's one of the most enjoyable movies out there. What makes The Room so amazing is everything; The hilariously bad acting, the hilarious script and dialog, just everything! Tommy Wiseau is a genius, whether he likes it or not. He made the horrible masterpiece that is in some sort of way a masterpiece. What i mean by that is that everything about The Room is perfect in a terrible way, which means everything with the movie is wrong which makes it perfect. The Room is something you don't want to miss. I Highly recommend it to everyone!

Let me start this out by saying this movie is bad, and if you haven't seen it, then prepare yourself for an amazing ride.The story in this movie is simple, Johnny (Tommy Wiseau) is a man who we assume is quite well off, he is in love with a "beautiful" girl, Lisa (Juliette Danielle)who he plans on marrying. However, one day she decides Johnny just isn't doing it well enough for her, so she decides to go seek a new romance, Mark (Greg Sestero) Johnny's best friend. Throughout the movie new subplots are introduced but then immediately dropped and never mentioned again.The acting in this movie is what really makes this movie a classic. Tommy Wiseau is a master at cranking out hilarious one-liners that will keep me laughing for a long time. The other actors have there moments and laughs but none are as funny as Wiseau.Usually with movies like this, the movie starts out funny then dies down to a point where you turn it off to find a more stimulating activity. This does NOT happen with the room, it keeps you engaged with it from start to end. It should be noted that the love scenes are frequent in this movie and do tend to drag out a lot longer then they need to be.On a critical level this movie it terrible and should be excruciating to watch, but it does the opposite. It shows the true meaning of a movie, to entertain.10/10 Highly Recommended to people with a good sense of humour.

reviews.review_title: This movie deserves 10 out of 10 for originality, nothing else like it.
reviews.content: No other movie has left me with the feeling of life will never be the same since viewing it. From the tender love making scenes to the tenacious fight scene with the drug dealer, this film has it all in spades. Some say that it meanders and has no plot but don't let that spoil a good film! Sure some scenes have absolutely no meaning or relevance but that didn't stop them appearing! As the saying goes- build it and they shall come, or something like that. Like the film I try not to dwell on fact or meaning here. Prepare yourself to be amazed by such dialogue as "I definitely have breast cancer""I used to know a girl got beat up so bad....hahaha what a story Mark"And who can forget the dramatic fight scene"You're just a chicken chip, chip, chip, cheep, cheeeep"Then there is the seamless change of direction"It's bullshit I did not hit her, I DID NAWWT! Oh hi Mark"All in all I am holding out for The Room 2, maybe just maybe it was all a dream and Johnny gets to live another day..
Please please watch the nostalgia critics review of it on YouTube. Saves sitting through every minute and you get the whole movie. So funny.Then the disaster artist. Great 👍🏼

reviews.review_title: Yeah I gave it a 10. What of it?
reviews.content: This movie must be seen to be believed. And for that reason, I gave it a 10. It's a failure. It's the 10 car pile-up on the freeway that you can't help but stare at, and it's more addictive than Spice Melange. Anybody who wishes to make a movie should watch it thoroughly, so that they can know what to avoid...forever.There is 1 redeeming quality to this movie and that is the quality of the camera work. Let's face it, most independent films possess qualities just slightly better than a VHS set-up, and the cinematography of the Room is top notch. The camera work is smooth, and the audio pick-up is crisp and clean. There are bigger budget movies (Cough * TRANSFORMERS * Cough) that could learn a lesson or 2 about making certain that people can see what's happening on-screen (like any movie that has useless Shaky-Cam).The story is atrocious. The protagonist is creepy (the woman who played his fiancée looked to be about 20 years old as well as being 20 years younger than him, and the were supposed to have been dating for 7 years or so). The soundtrack is cheesy. There are about 4 gratuitous sex scenes in the first 30 minutes, so that it feels like you should be watching this in an adult theater* (while angrily demanding a refund of your money). And to top it off, there's a man-child who likes to play football, all the time, especially when he's in a tux.In short, it's better than Citizen Kane.*Are those places even still around? One could understand their existence in the 80s or 90s when one could not satisfy all of their pornographic desires at home, but we live in a high-speed world where a person can easily download information at 2 megabytes per second. Why go out to be a pervert?

reviews.review_title: BEAUTIFUL AND GOOD FEELING IN SPITE OF THE END
reviews.content: The actors in this movie were believable, fun and entertaining. And I and others laughed and laughed. Some guy had written to Tommy Wiseau that the audience was laughing at him not with him. Well obviously that writer was not one that liked the movie...so why was he there??? I and others on each side of me who were so enjoying this movie and found it delightful. That critic who described other people laughing at Tommy Wiseau, described themselves right in that sentence. What do we say in America of those who "laugh at somebody"....case in point, enough said...but just shame on you.Those that laugh AT others show their own character and how "small" they are. There are many little kids who experience this same meanness as a small child. It shows how inmature and what a low self concept this person has of self.There was something about this movie that appeals to a great many people. Many of the movies I see now days are so the same old movie type, with the same faces....very boring and trite. It is really fun and refreshing to find something out there that is delightfully different with some different actors. Each of these actors were very different and really had their own personalities.This movie was alive with energy and fun spirit. There was something about "THE ROOM" that made you feel as if these actors were really your own friends and you felt part of the movie. Some critic had pointed out that some of the movie had been filmed to show this movie took place in San Francisco. So what is new....? That makes it interesting. And to the makers of this movie I say to you....ignore the critics..they are there because otherwise no one would notice them and it is obvious that some of these guy for some reason appears to be very jealous or for some reason is trying to make fun of Tommy Wiseau. Shame on them....it just shows a persons character.The movie was very colorful in the color displayed throughout the film and the characters were colorful in their personalities. The acting was great and alive with new energy. I am not in the movie business....I am just a movie goer that was delighted to find something different from the usual trite movies fed to us by the same group of Hollywood, that wants everyone to think and see things only one way...their way. This movie was funny, entertaining, kept your attention and you loved all the characters... I can understand the cult following completely. Remember Mr.Wiseau, the people who are making the negative comments are the ones in the business who don't like you personally for whatever reason. People like me, are the ones who are not in the business, but actually go to the movie for fun and pure enjoyment. And we.........lots of us loved the movie and would like to see more. Thank you for making it. It was beautiful.

This is easily the worst 'thing' that I've ever sat through. Me and 7 of my friends were having a movie night yesterday and my friend Stephen brought this with him, claiming "I don't know what this is and apparently no one on the planet does so we should watch it." There was me, Stephan, Mason and Shane who are all male and Anna, Katie, Zoe and Gina who are female (I'm saying this just so I can establish and go into more detail about one of our reactions later) and all of us had different reactions to what we were seeing. Me, Mason Anna and Katie were looking on in confusion throughout the whole thing, Stephen and Shane were laughing uncontrollably, Gina was offended and Zoe fell asleep.There was just so much stuff wrong in this thing that I repeatedly asked the question "why was this made? What possessed Tommy Wiseau to make this? Did he intentionally make this bad? Did he make this to settle debt? Did he actually think he could become a memorable film director?" I can only answer one of those questions, he became a memorable film director/producer/writer/actor but for the wrong reasons.Where do I start? The acting is some of the worst caught on camera. I was in an amateur theatre production by Queen's hall arts called Minor's Strike and I would like to emphasise, it was an amateur production and all of our acting was praised in the performance and I was 13 at the time. These actors, who are around their 30s/40s are acting worse than we did and we were amateurs and hadn't taken acting school at the time. Tommy Wiseau is easily the worst though. He is the worst actor and this film and what goes well with a bad actor you might ask? Badly written dialogue for this bad actor to spout out."We have a new client at the bank we make a lot of money, anyway how is your sex life" This is an actual piece of dialogue that was delivered by Tommy Wiseau, imagine that an 8 year old French boy is saying this line and you will get Tommy Wiseau's whole performance.There are also these really uncomfortable sex scene moments which is what Gina was offended by. I know that we're in an age where the ESRB raters are awfully sceptical about letting certain age demographics watch certain movies and usually controversy is applauded by audience and that's why Harvester and Hatred got as much attention as they did but this thing in The Room, these sex scenes which is applauded by possibly the horn word (not allowed to say it because of IMDb's rules) teenage boy demographic, these sort of scenes are just plain awkward for people to sit through. Also, there is about 5 of these uncomfortable sex scenes in this film, each lasting about 5 mins. Which means the total amount of time we spent watching some porno was just under 1/3 of the film.There are also these really weird scenes that don't go anywhere. They happen and then that's it.I wish there was a way that I could unsee this film and none of you get this film, even if you're curious, don' get it. I wish to never see Tommy Wiseau in anything again, if he even is in anything else and if he is, there's something wrong with this world.

reviews.review_title: The Room: When An Alien In Human Skin Makes A Movie
reviews.content: The Room is the greatest mess in cinematic history. It is the Citizen Kane of bad movies. It is the answer to the question of what would happen if something went so far below a zero that it somehow became a 10.This movie is unwatchably watchable. If you were to sit down and try to watch take this seriously, it would feel like you're being stabbed in the head. But sitting down to watch this as a delusional vanity project gone awry and it becomes one of the best 90 minutes you'll get out of a film.The Room is what the result would be if an alien species studied late 90's soap opera TV, had a computer program amalgamate a script and then was performed by the aliens in human skin like the first Men In Black movie.There's a sad truth in film though. While its a mess, its clearly written from some place of truth or experience in Tommy Wiseau's heart. There's something of a biopic going on here, where nice guy Johnny gets manipulated, lied to and taken advantage of by the people close to him. A lot of the dialogue sounds like something from a bitter ex-lover.

reviews.review_title: Don't try to sell this as an ironic piece.
reviews.content: Tommy Wiseau - what a guy. He is a complete fruit cake, and this film is complete and utter garbage. I know that people will say "it's supposed to be ironic and funny, blah, blah, blah" - stop kidding yourselves, it's just bad. I knew this film was bad before I watched it, but I had to (I didn't want to, I had to) know just how bad it was. Oh wow, does this blow. I would be prepared to take this as an ironic stab at Hollywood if it wasn't for the following points:1. Tommy Wiseau takes himself seriously. (Seriously, he does? Wow.) 2. Nobody (but NOBODY) spends between $7m - $9m of their own money to take the proverbial out of Hollywood. (Pointless tilting at that particular windmill). 3. It's just SO BAD it makes Sharknado look like an Oscar Nominated Classic. 4. It's worse than Knight Rider 2010 - yep, it's that bad.Oh wait, is the irony that Tommy Wiseau doesn't get irony?
