Ah, I might have missed that.Anyway, it's rubbish, but go ahead and watch it. The worst that can happen is that you will be a little more forgiving of other movies.

reviews.review_title: Horrible, Funny And Let's Face It: Not Much Better Than Most Would Do Either!
reviews.content: Tommy Wiseau is an accidentally on purpose genius. What I mean is, his movie is an accidental hit but his intentions were truer than true! He lives in his own world, with his own standards and there, in this world, Tommy Wiseau is king! Not just any king either: He is a good king; he is an admired king. His people worship him and why not? He is good to his people. He treats them respectfully. He gives them all the encouragement and friendship they require. In Wiseau Land, he has been the elected king 687,327,921 and a half times now! And while, yes, his movie is VERY indulgent and self centered, it's charming and oblivious. He really does see himself as this all-American, perfect without fault Johnny character. He wants us to perceive him this way, and I say, we should. Why the heck not? He's not hurting anyone and I think we owe him for all the quotes, memes and laughs he is providing us. Now I will admit that the movie is not for everyone. Heck, it's literally just for Mr. Wiseau---but it's noteworthy, to me, if just for the fact that someone said, "Ah dun care wha any bahdy say! Ah will make dream movie! People, they use me; they lie to me and I dun care any more---oh, hai Greg!". Tommy made his dream come true; put his stupid heart on the line and succeeded in his failure! He made a negative, a positive and that's pretty hard to do sometimes! So while it is not a great movie, it's a great example of what someone can do if they really put effort into their selves...

I'm one of those people who normally agrees with the "its so bad, it's good" line (being an avid fan of B-class movies and Rocky Horror). I attended this movie laughing off all the comments that it was the "worst movie in the world" as screenings sold out virtually every month. It wasn't until I was there, fatefully making the mistake to attend sober, that I realized the only way you could sit through more than 5 minutes was to be drunk/stoned/both. I can see how, viewed in a theater at midnight after a few drinks, this might conjure up its own hilariously demented cult following complete will call back lines and spoons but for anyone expecting a movie worth crowds this size, don't go. The writer/producer/director/leading man Tommy Wiseau lacks talent in both his character acting (if you could even call it that) and writing skills. The self-financed "The Room"s shortcomings go way beyond the standard array of glaring continuity errors, dodgy sets and stagnant editing...it's hard to describe how bad the acting in the film actually is. I left the cinema not only wanting my money back but wondering why 15 minutes of the movie was spent throwing a football around on a badly constructed rooftop.
I watched this movie and it's so bad!!! Maybe the worst movie I've ever seen. I rated it 5 because it's worth watching. I assure anyone who watches it that you'll laugh so much!!!

And Greg and Juliette and the flower shop doggie and even the old lady. If I wrote this after my first watch, I'd of given it a 1 but Greg's wonderful book enlightened me. I'm a Roomie now. I watch it at least once a month. Each time I find something new. So much fun.
A masterclass in film making. This is far and away the greatest film ever made. Emotionally and cinematically breathtaking.

The Room really is like nothing else. I can't imagine what it must have been like for the initial lucky few that saw it when it was originally released, having gone in expecting a romantic drama, they got this. Nowadays though watching the Room in a Cinema is a completely different experience, a sea of people all in on the joke, it's just mesmerising. Believe me if you ever get the chance to go to a screening I highly recommend it, you won't regret it. Right from the moment Tommy first appears on the screen the film is utterly shambolic, so many weird moments, so many pointless establishing shots, dialogue that no human being has said or ever will. If this was aimed as a comedy it would be a complete dud, the unintentional laughter that comes from what was supposed to be a serious film just makes it. Wonderful.

I tried to watch this thing for about 20 minutes but it just kept getting worse and worse, so I ended up fast forwarding the whole thing. The acting is horrible, the dialog is awful, the sets are bad...etc... so why watch it at all? I am so sorry I wasted those 20 minutes of my life. I will never get them back. I hope no one else makes the mistake of ever seeing this. What was the director thinking? I honestly do not know. There are bad movies out there, that are so bad that they become good. This is not one of them. This movie is just bad. It cannot even be called a movie. I tried to see the value of this film, but I just cannot understand what the director was thinking. It seemed like an interesting plot, but the development of the story fails miserably.
JUST SIMPLY THE GREATEST MOVIE EVER IN THE HISTORY OF CINEMA. THAT'S IT. UNTOPPABLE.

As a movie, I can't give this more than 0 stars as this isn't a movie, this is a feature-length compliation of random, bizarre memes. As a collection of memes, I give this 10,000 stars. Seriously, I know this wasn't meant to be a complete comedy but this is really entertaining to watch. I recommend this to anyone who needs cheering up.
Tommy is a brilliant comedian and he doesn't even know it yet .. And the title doesn't make sense is so comedic , can some reboot this movie again and again !!

I saw this at a midnight showing with my (adult) son and we had a blast. If you love bad movies then this is the BEST BAD MOVIE EVER!!!! Take a football, some spoons, and go see this movie in a theater any chance you get!!! The audience makes it even better!!!!Note: If you have never seen The Room, before you go see it, I highly recommend you watch the Nostalgia Critic's review first.

reviews.review_title: Film Born From The Neurotic, Misogynistic Thoughts Of A Cuckolded Man?
reviews.content: I just watched 'The Room' (2003) so I can now watch 'The Disaster Artist' (2017) and then maybe 'Room Full Of Spoons' (2016, documentary). This film is so bad it's become cult viewing, yet the overall plot will be familiar to most people despite it being a subject rarely covered by mainstream movies. It's like they've filmed the looping neurotic daydream thoughts of a cuckolded man, hence several lines and ideas are repeated and much of it is illogical or doesn't really fit. The script sounds like it was written by an 8 year old - an 8 year old monkey. Tommy Wiseau's acting is as though he is heavily sedated with anti-psychotic drugs, or alternatively, like an android that's failed the Turing Test. The other actors weren't quite as bad, but with their lines and Wiseau's direction it's hard to be sure if they're actual professionals or not. Terrible film with many illogical moments, but somehow still feels more real and relevant than most films. The video and audio quality is mostly ok, and the music actually wasn't too bad, plus there's a few softcore sex scenes - if you think that's a redeeming feature. 3/10.
This movie is 100% nonsense - you have to watch to know how not to make movies and how you can waste million of dollars. Like seriously - why?

reviews.review_title: Black comedy, well you will have a good time!
reviews.content: Well,  I like The Room very much and you have to see it this quirky new black comedy!  It's good and you will see something from your life. Good work Mr. Tommy Wiseau.  Great picture, good action and much more for anyone to related to. I want to see it again and I'm recommending it to anyone.

reviews.review_title: A Very Different Kind of Awful
reviews.content: Most good movies are credited as having a coherent plot, a skillful display of editing, and well-developed characters that the audience can easily relate to. In such films we would feel our pulses racing as the lead character finds himself in a dangerous circumstance, we would cheer as the villain is brought to justice, and we would cry during the death of the very characters that we have grown to love as the movie has progressed. If you were to watch Tommy Wiseau's "The Room", you would find that this is most definitely not the case. The writing, directing, editing and acting in this movie is so hilariously unbelievable, is of no depth nor substance, and is about as close to "real life" (as Wiseau claims) as a toaster is to passing off as a squirrel. It's just not possible.But herein lies the irony of The Room. If it is so incredibly unbelievable, then why is it loved by audiences everywhere? What separates The Room from other "bad" movies such as "Garbage Pail Kids", "Howard the Duck" or "Kazaam"? Why do we (or I, at least) love "The Room" so much and not every other awful movie in existence? It is, like the title of this review suggests, a very different kind of awful, and the reason for it, I believe, is the Producer/Director/Writer/Lead Actor himself, Tommy Wiseau.Anything about The Room that is of note should be credited to Wiseau. He did, after all, write, direct, produce and star in the movie. To summarize, the film is about a banker named Johnny and his fiancé Lisa, the latter of which is having an affair with Johnny's best friend, Mark, and... well that's about it. The large majority of the film is made up of scenes that either present the same ideas as earlier scenes or serve absolutely no purpose to the plot whatsoever."Yes, yes, that's all good, Rumpelkombo, but why do you like the movie so much?" Well, curious reader, like I mentioned before, I credit all of the brilliantly pathetic qualities of The Room to Wiseau. The reason why The Room is so unique as a bad movie, in my opinion, is because Wiseau himself is so unique. Until "The Room" came along, he was completely unknown, and even today not much is known about his past. He claims that he was born and raised in the US, despite having a mysterious European accent, he has not fully disclosed the methods by which he raised the $6 million budget for the movie, but most importantly, he sees The Room like a mother sees her own child; a product of his own self that he believes to be a beautiful and perfect representation of his thoughts and ideas - a tragedy that captures the betrayal and downward spiral of the "normal" human being. Imagine the shock he received when audiences burst out into laughter at the film's premiere. While George Lucas chose to sever the ties between himself and "Howard the Duck", Wiseau has remained more proud of "The Room" than anything else. Wiseau takes himself so seriously that you can't help but laugh, and if I were to point out every single hilariously awful aspect of this movie I'd be here for weeks.I should probably note that, as such, I don't believe the actors or the crew are at all responsible for "The Room". The crew only did what they were commanded to do by His Royal Highness and the actors, to their credit, were given very little opportunity to improvise, or to even become familiar with their characters. An article by Robyn Paris, who played "Michelle", describes Wiseau's hilariously unprofessional method of casting actors ("You just won the lottery. Go!"), how she was given twenty minutes to learn her lines and how the actors weren't even allowed copies of the script because... wait for it... Wiseau was afraid the actors would steal it. No, I'm not joking, search "How 'The Room' Turned Me Into a Cult Movie 'Star'" and click the first link. I'll give you a moment to read it if you'd like. I'm not going anywhere.The reasons I didn't give it a 10/10 are trivial, but nonetheless I saw as having a negative impact on the movie's brilliance. Firstly, I had to see Tommy Wiseau's hideously wrinkly rear end. One word: UNNECESSARY! I strongly recommend keeping your hands free for the first ten minutes of the movie in anticipation for this moment. It happens just after Johnny and Lisa have sex. You're welcome. Secondly, *SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER* Johnny dies, meaning that there is little hope for a sequel... unless it involves Johnny's ghost haunting Lisa after she decides to get back together with Mark in which case this movie is, wrinkly buttocks aside, immediately brought up to a 10/10. "You are tearing me apart Lisaaah! Ooooh!" In short, Tommy Wiseau is the reason I love "The Room". There are so many interesting mysteries surrounding him and so many things wrong with his idea of a "good movie" that it is near impossible to not see the ironic brilliance of "The Room".

reviews.review_title: Absolutely brilliant, film for everyone, it really is a masterpiece
reviews.content: This movie is really really great, it brings emotion to all that see it, I don't believe in the 'so bad it's good' this is wrong it really is amazing, maybe not for the reason the great Wieseu wanted, but the movie is great and everyone needs to see it, black comedy? Drama? Parody? Serious? New? innovative? Or just strange? whatever you think of 'The Room', I know you will love it no matter what, buy the bluray and support 'The Room' and Mr. Wieseu.Thank you and watch the brilliant experience. 10/10

I don't know why everybody is hating on this movie. I thought it was a great film. Visually thrilling, executed with pin-point accuracy, and pleasing to every sense imaginable. Tommy's camera work and acting put everybody in a trance that is only broken when that friendly clarinet theme leads us into the ending credits. This movie needs less hate and more love. I believe that Tommy Wiseau is on a whole other wave-length than the general public. People just don't "get" what he is all about. One day we will all see and understand, and we'll all be see how blind we were before. I mean, just look at his latest works to know that Tommy has got it and hasn't lost it. "The Neighbors" hasn't got half the attention that it deserves. I love you Tommy. Keep doing what you are doing and continue blocking out all of the criticism and hate, because you are a unique human being who still has much to offer to the cinematic world.

Anyone who says this is a "bad" film does not understand true art. Vincent Van Gogh sold but a single painting in his lifetime, and yet we revere that man as an artistic genius. Why then when genius such as Tommy Wiseau's (which is so great that it makes the "supposed genius" of Van Gogh look like a mentally deficient man's crayon scribbles) approaches us as the heavens open wide and let us peak at the acme of film direction known as Tommy Wiseau, do we just scoff at it like aristocratic elites looking down on the poor peasants. "The Room" IS the next "Citizen Cane", it DOES deserve more than one measly film festival award and its director NEEDS to be respected for the genius he is. Dostoevsky? Mozart? Tommy Wiseau trumps them all times infinity plus ONE HUNDRED BAJILLION!

reviews.review_title: The Website Told Me To Review, So....
reviews.content: I've never heard of this movie until I tried watching Adult Swim on April Fools Day, and this movie was showing as a joke. I only watched it for a few minutes but what I saw was the "sex in the belly button scene" and I thought I suddenly had late night Cinemax and the channels flipped on me. I never knew what it was until the Nostalgia Critic reviewed it and I was too curious for my own good so I Netflixed it. Yup. It's pretty bad... but it's one of the funniest movies I've ever seen! Seriously, watch it! But not by yourself. Get some of your buddies together, drink a few beers and laugh your @$$ off! I have to give Tommy Wiseau credit. Granted, he made one of the worst movies ever made and he's mentally unstable, but he sure knows how to get it seen!

Tommy Wiseau's The Room somehow manages to be one of my favorite films in the most disastrous way possible. With an intent to be a heavy hitting romantic drama and cautionary tale, this film has an effect drastically different as a finished product. Tommy Wiseau created a film so terrible that it has become a laugh-out-loud comedic hit within a large cult following. The production of Wiseau's passion project is widely known as being extremely chaotic and itself a hilarious story, as displayed in James Franco's film The Disaster Artist. Horrible camera quality caused by use of mixing digital and film, terrible use of lighting, atrocious screenplay and performances, and countless horrid sex scenes make this film a Marvel unlike any other. One of the most entertaining comedies I could ever personally name, this disaster is a hilarious viewing experience to unlike any other.

reviews.review_title: Hilarious and magnificent in its own way
reviews.content: Quite crazy how much fun you can have watching a movie as bad as this one. No wonder it has such a huge fan base, me included.

reviews.review_title: What is the right star rating?
reviews.content: The Room is magnificent. It is atrocious. It breaks every rule in the filmmaker's guidebook, and the off-camera rumours and stories are just as delightfully horrifying as what ended up on screen.Everyone needs to see this film, it's the most bizarre experience of all time, and could not be more perfectly terrible. It never bores you, it never fails to be fascinating on so many levels, and Tommy Wiseau is just about the strangest cat ever to hit the big screen in film history. Good on him and his poor, hard-done-by crew and cast, for their work on this tragic, joyous experience.Honestly, it deserves 1 star, it deserves 10 stars. I've given it ten, because that is ultimately more positive, and despite the flaws literally erupting in every shot, every scene, every bit of dialogue, it's still one of my favourite movies ever. So there, take your ten stars Tommy.SEE IT. SEE JT. SEE IT.

Oh Hi Mark. You appear to be the expert. Johnny is a successful banker who lives in a San Francisco townhouse with his fiancée, Lisa. They share an intense relationship characterised by constant, passionate lovemaking. Despite this idyllic existence, Lisa has inexplicably become dissatisfied with her life, and one afternoon confides to her best friend Michelle and her mother Claudette that she finds Johnny boring. Although Michelle advises her to be grateful for what she has, and her mother counsels her that financial stability is more important than happiness, Lisa decides to seduce Johnny's best friend, Mark. Although he is initially reluctant, Mark gives in to Lisa's advances. Their affair continues through the remainder of the film, even though Mark appears reluctant at the outset of each sexual encounter and repeatedly tries to break off the relationship. Lisa, meanwhile, having come to the realisation that she "wants it all", decides to stay with Johnny for financial support and the material goods he can provide her. As the wedding date approaches and Johnny's clout at his bank slips, Lisa alternates between glorifying and vilifying Johnny to her family and friends, both making false accusations of domestic abuse and defending Johnny against criticisms. Meanwhile, Johnny, having overheard Lisa confess her infidelity to her mother, attachés a tape recorder to their phone in an attempt to identify her lover. Against the backdrop of Lisa and Mark's affair, numerous subplots involving secondary characters begin to develop: Denny, a neighbouring college student whom Johnny financially supports and "loves like a son", has a mysterious run-in with a drug dealer named Chris-R, whom Johnny and Mark overpower and take to the police. Denny also lusts after Lisa, ultimately confessing to Johnny his attraction; once Johnny tells Denny that Lisa loves him as her friend, Denny resolves to propose to his own girlfriend. Johnny takes on a mysterious client at his bank whose identity he is sworn to protect. Claudette experiences real estate problems, bemoans failed relationships, and informs Lisa that she has breast cancer. Michelle and her boyfriend, Mike (Mike Holmes), sneak into Johnny and Lisa's home to have sex. Peter (Kyle Vogt), a psychologist friend of Johnny's and Mark's, alternates between defending Lisa and assessing her as a sociopath, which results in Mark briefly trying to murder him. Each of these subplots receives little exposition, and none is ever resolved. At a surprise birthday party for Johnny to which all of his friends were invited, Steven, a previously unseen friend of Lisa's and Johnny's, catches Lisa kissing Mark while the rest of the guests are outside and confronts her about the affair. Lisa expresses no remorse, while Mark angrily urges Steven not to tell anyone. Johnny announces to the guests that Lisa is pregnant, only for Lisa to tell Steven and Michelle that she lied about it in order to "make it interesting". At the end of the evening, Lisa flaunts her affair in front of Johnny, who physically attacks Mark. After the party, Johnny locks himself in the bathroom, prompting Lisa to make plans to leave him for Mark. Johnny finally comes out of the bathroom and retrieves the cassette recorder he attached to the phone, and listens to an intimate call between Lisa and Mark. Claiming that all of his friends have betrayed him, Johnny destroys his apartment and then kills himself with a pistol. Denny, Mark and Lisa discover Johnny's body sometime later. Mark and Denny blame Lisa for Johnny's death, with Mark declaring he does not love Lisa and never wants to see her again. Denny asks Lisa and Mark to leave, but they stay and comfort one another as the sound of sirens grows louder. I fed up of this world! Hi doggy,what do you need money for? I did not hit her, this is rubbish, I did not hit her, I did nooot. This movie is good, and if you don't agree, then you just very bad, you not good, you, you just a chicken; Cheep cheep cheep cheep cheeeep. You're tearing me apart, Lisa! Do you want to stay alive? This ends now. So how is your s*x life?

The Room is a movie with cringe-inducingly stupid dialogue, Unlikable undeveloped characters, abysmal acting, low production values, a repetitive as all heck and predictable story, unnecessarily long and awkward sex scenes, badly paced and facepalm-inducingly dumb scenes, low production values and is all around an objectively terrible movie! But you know what? I absolutely love this movie! If ONE movie is the definition of "So bad it's good", it's The Room! It's not easy to make a movie that's so bad it's good. I mean, other bad movies are well, just, bad! But this Movie managed to move my emotions in all the right ways. It made me happy, sad, and laugh. Oh man did this movie make me laugh! Every aspect of this movie is mixed together in perfect harmony to make what I consider to be the best worst movie of all time! I highly recommend this movie to anyone wanting a good laugh.

reviews.review_title: It CAN be one of the funniest movies
reviews.content: If you go into the movie understanding that it's quite possibly the worst drama ever made, you will likely laugh until you reach tears. If you go into the movie ready to be moved, you will not reach the end of it because it is quite simply not a good movie.Most "bad" movies become extremely repetitive at some point and cause the watcher to turn it off because it stops being funny. However The Room is a masterpiece in that it manages to become increasingly ridiculous as the movie goes on, so you (or at least I and the people I was watching it with) do not get bored. This movie is definitely a classic, just possibly not for the reason it was created for.

reviews.review_title: The Best Worst Thing I've Ever Seen
reviews.content: I love The Room. But wait a second, if I loved it then did I only give it 1 star? That's because it's a terrible movie. So why did I love it if it's a terrible movie? Allow me to explain.The Room is a horribly acted, shoddily directed, abysmally written mess of a movie, but that doesn't mean I didn't love every second of it. This is undoubtedly one of the funniest movies I've ever seen. It truly is hilariously bad. Almost every scene had me and my friend rolling on the ground howling with laughter. "Oh hi Mark" is a three word sentence of comedic gold. If Tommy Wiseau ever makes another movie, expect to see me in the theater.Simply put, is The Room a good movie? No, absolutely not, it's an insult to film making. However, everybody with a single shred of a sense of humor absolutely needs to watch it.The End

reviews.review_title: You're going to love it or hate it

I would love to read anything else you have ever written- grocery lists, whatever. Just read andreasarslan's review of the room, it sums it up better than I could ever dream of...

This is the second worst movie I have ever seen. It's so bad that it competes with "Troll 2".But unlike "Troll 2" ... "The Room" is so bad it's excellent! The scenes where Tommy Wiseau appeared always made me laugh, and the lousy performances just delighted me. "The Room" is one of the worst movies I've ever seen in my life, but once I saw it, it fascinated me. Once you see this movie, you will never forget the day and year you saw "The Room."
The Room is a masterpiece of cinema. It has some of the strongest performances I've ever seen and it baffles me how Tommy Wiseau didn't win the Oscar

reviews.review_title: Addicting movie that you can have fun with.
reviews.content: I have seen this movie twice, and it grows on you. The characters are endearing are you get caught up in their affection for one another and their togetherness. It is something that many men can identify  with from their past or have to look forward to in their future. Some men will keep this as their secret. It clearly shows the timeless triangle of the friendship between two men brought down and completely destroyed by a beautiful, remorseless and deceitful woman using sex and co-dependency as her lethal weapons. The character, Johnny, is so endearing in his complete  trust of his finance,the beautiful Lisa. Johnny is a very sweet and trusting man .The director really missed many  heart stopping moments  that were lost, because of rushing through the scenes that were very loaded with tension and should have been played out to the max. There should have been longer heart stopping pauses, but instead the moment was lost by rushing through the scenes that were exploding with  sexual tension. There were several of these such instances at Johnny's surprise birthday party when everyone was all around having a good time laughing and not knowing how volatile the situation in the room was. The movie really missed it by not exploiting this to the fullest. This was what the whole movie had been building up to. There was so much sexual tension between the unfaithful Lisa and Johnnie's cheating friend, Mark. The air was riveting and charged with the buildup from the start of  the whole movie. The directors should have really made a big deal of long, tension filled, up close eye contact, between Lisa and Mark. Mark was definitely not thinking with his brain. These looks and tensions could have been played out  and underscored so much more.I was disappointed this huge opportunity was barely tapped. This was my biggest disappointment about the entire movie. There should have been more exchange tension filled looks between Lisa and Mark, Mark and Johnnie, and others that knew, but mostly between Lisa and Mark, and the camera should have let time stand still with a close up of the emotion in Lisa and Mark's eyes. Everyone would squirm as the whole party of friends stood in the circle awaiting..... the bomb to explode.....how..... and with whom????? Let the tension exist and prolong it so we all get our money's worth for the.... climax. Lisa was completely  spontaneous, unpredictable and with no inhibitions to get what she wanted..... wherever she wanted it. Even Lisa's mother could not believe how remorseless her daughter was. This movie gets better each time you see it.  All the characters are so endearing you feel like you are actually there with them and they are your friends. Each character is special. There are heart stopping moments of suspense when you think Johnny will find out about his best friend, and will freak out, he is so in love with her. Johnny's best friend, Mark, is a sexy hunk who would make any woman melt. The impetuous, Lisa, is the woman every woman fears and every man secretly longs to be seduced by. Johnny is the man every woman wishes they had to  completely trust and adore them. Lisa starts to make everyone feel uncomfortable and uneasy  because she has no impulse control. She is out to lure and seduce every man that comes close to her. Some of the scenes showed Lisa, with her huge violet eyes and dark eyebrows, as being very innocent and sweet,  and you actually feel sorry for her. The only person that really seem to be able to touch Lisa, was Denny,  the young boy that Johnny had adopted. Only with him, did she seem to think about someone besides herself. Look for Mark and Lisa to be Hollywood's next sweethearts. They look just sensational on the big screen together. I don't know where Tommy found a couple that looks so much alike. When they are on the big screen together, they are beautiful.The only problem is Lisa is evil, and Mark is good. But Mark like the other men, is unable to resist Lisa.  The music goes perfectly with the movie. Get the soundtrack. This movie deals with something that is between us and all around us everyday and always will be. This movie was filmed in San Francisco. Something about the movie haunts you  and you end up hungering for more. The movie was very lighthearted, different and entertaining because it took your mind  inside other's lives and their unique friendships. A film we can all relate to.... and fear or.. anticipate.... depending on if you are male or female....thank you Tommy.-Alice Techner

reviews.review_title: (Probably) not the worst movie ever made, but close enough.
reviews.content: I wasn't privy to the existence of this so called "cult classic" until the proliferation of YouTube reaction videos and James Franco's biography movie about it. After dozing off multiple times during its 90-minute run time, I powered through this chore with no aftertastes whatsoever. The Metacritic score pretty much sums it all up: 9 out of 100, which establishes The Room as one of the lowest scored movies ever, and I have to agree with critics this time around. Is this movie any fun? A few chuckles admittedly, primarily from the leading actor/director/writer Tommy Wiseau's monotone acting/delivery, plus that gif-worthy line "You're tearing me apart Lisa!" Nevertheless, these moments are too inadequate to make up for long sequences of mind-numbing dialogues and confounding interactions galore in this movie. If you're bent on watching this out of curiosity, or merely to better understand James Franco's The Disaster Artist, I suggest you fast forward through it within 5 minutes so as to save your precious time.

It's Bull****, he did not hit anyone he did not!..... oh hi Reader!If you don't have anything nice to say, leave your comments in your pocket.Overall this movie is great and I'm glad this exists! I think its unfortunate that so many people misunderstand this movie. The American Public is so brainwashed by Hollywood that they are afraid when a movie as daring and original as "The Room" comes along.Audiences are so used to being spoonfed romantic comedies and cliché love stories that they cannot handle Tommy Wiseau telling it like it is.I'm sure a lot of us have had a "Lisa" in our lives. A woman that is both evil and seductive. I recently came from a relationship where I was betrayed much like "Johnny" in the film and I can say the anguish and pain is captured perfectly in "The Room" People who make fun of the"Lisa you are tearing me a part" line have obviously never had a love lost. I remember I cried the same way as "Johnny" when it happened to me. And to all you macho guys who think that its unmanly when a guy (like Johnny or me) cries because of heartbreak you are full of it. I was captain of my Highschool Football Team and have been with many girls.Speaking of Highschool, I used to date this girl a few times in 10th grade. When I went to college i found out my best friend was seeing her so I know what the relationship between "Johnny" and "Mark" is like. The strange thing is her name was "Elizabeth" and sometimes people called her Lisa when they first met her.The Last thing I want to say is about the symbolism in the movie. It makes me laugh when people get caught up in why "Johnny" wears a tuxedo while playing football. Again people have been dumbed down by seeing too many Hollywood Films.People don't understand symbolism anymore. Do you really think "Johnny" is wearing a tuxedo because its comfortable? Its a metaphor for the way he feels. The suit represents his approaching marriage and how he lets his friends know that he will not let the confines of that institution prevent him from being just one of the guys. I will let you come up with your own conclusions why it is the psychiatrist that "falls".The suit is just one of the many examples of rich symbolism in the movie. The Red Dress symbolizes passion and desire for example.The only reason I'm not giving the movie a perfect 10 is because of the Chris R Scene where Denny is confronted on the roof top about his drug problem. For me it was too intense to be added to the film and i had to leave the theatre for a minute after watching it. It brought up too many painful memories that i wont bring up here.In closing, see the room with an open mind. Let your guard down and abandon what other films have told you your whole life.And remember we all feel trapped and betrayed in our lives but "There is a door that leads out of every Room" John N Crawford

So I watched this movie based on the hype around it.Its a semi-sensical plot executed in a very odd way. The actors are weird. The lead character Johnny is, in my eyes, a true introvert trying out acting. He obviously acts out his lines while wishing to crawl back in the cave he would prefer.The love scenes are awful and embarrassing. And there are a lot of them.Moving the plot along happens while our non-sensical and under explained characters interact in the most awkward way.I was prepared for a bad movie but at least expected it to be funny. Its was chuckle-worth in the onset while we get introduced to the weird dialogue. But after a while it gets dull.I give it 2 stars because the production is decent and the music is wonderfully inappropriate.

Perplexed, unresolved plot holes, coupled with exceedingly desolate acting, to the tedious tune of a mundane, out of place score, The Room is quite possibly the worst film ever made. However it could also be the most prodigious fabrication ever to grace celluloid. Is Tommy Wisseau, the star, producer, director and egocentric narcissist behind this creation, an idiot savant trolling us all, or merely a halfwit dunce who can't distinguish the difference between creating a film, and the malodorous odour that vacates his anus? Technically-speaking, this 'film' is brimming with ignominious blemishes, from nonsensical editing to a complete absence of any sort of character development. The generic plot involving a woman cheating on her partner with another man is just yet another stain on this technically-dreadful piece of film making. Yet what draws the countless numbers of cult followers, the numerous screenings worldwide and extravagant publicity surrounding The Room? Is it the captivating and perplexing appeal of the outlandish and elusive Tommy Wisseau, whose origins lay unknown to this very day? Are the fans simply entertained by how implicitly bad the film is? The reason The Room may quite possibly be the worst best film ever created, is because every single aspect of the film, subtle or not, is characterised by the poorest of film-making standards, from the movements of the characters to the situation and setting of the scenes. Mr Wisseau could not have deliberately created a film this mind numbingly awful, as that would have been near impossible. Go see this, you won't regret it.

reviews.review_title: 1 cannot describe the pain i feel
reviews.content: This movie, is simply awful. The self-indulgent Tommy Wiseau has made one movie and one movie only. Thank goodness this is so, for this is the WORST MOVIE I have watched in my entire life. I have an extreme appreciation for movies and their cinematographies; however, this movies acting, set, directing, producing, over-the-top screen writing just gets me a serious lock every time i see it. The sexual scenes are unnecessary to the say the least, and NOBODY wants to see TOMMY WISEAU'S BARE REAR END! Words cannot describe the terrible acting in this movie. The blandness and clear lack of motivation the writers instilled in this movie is horrifying.I could continue for HOURS ON END of why THIS MOVIE IS THE WORST. However, i will say this. If you want to have perhaps the greatest laugh of your life, please do yourself a favor and watch this movie as a comedy. It is nothing more, and it certainly cannot be anything less, for this is THE LOWEST PIECE OF WORK EVER.NEVER WATCH THIS MOVIETommy Wiseau's buttocks still gives me nightmares to this day; you will end up like Johnny after this movie ends: one bullet in your head with your ex-wife trying to get it on with your best friend- make that two bullets...TWO BULLETS YOU WOULD NEED to come close to washing the horrid insipid memories of this trash away. NEVER WATCH THIS UNLESS YOU WANT TO LAUGH BEYOND ORTHODOX REASON.Don't YOU DARE REST IN PEACE TOMMY WISEAU; he milked this movie for the money and the promotion to his.....uhmmm......body?Don't WATCH ITDon't WATCH ITI cannot stress enough how SCARRING this movie is and how much it made me hate having a job in reviewing movies.--Sincerely, A*B*C* over/// G

reviews.review_title: Worst Movie Ever describes it well.
reviews.content: "The Worst Movie Ever" describes it quiet well. It seems as though Tommy Wiseau was writing a love letter to himself when he made this movie. Within the first few minutes he has two nude scenes that are beyond creepy.The story is like an episode of the worst soap opera that you can imagine. The acting is worse than an episode of the old crime show "Silk Stockings" on USA Network. Juliette Danielle's crying scene on the rooftop is some of the worst acting ever captured on film.What's so funny is that it's trying to be a serious drama.

reviews.review_title: A fantastic story of life, loss, and love.
reviews.content: This is truly one of the greatest works of art ever put on film. Really, if Orson Welles were alive today, he would wholeheartedly agree that the Room is infinitely better than Citizen Kane. Tommy Wiseau's acting brings back fond memories of the likes of Marlon Brando, Robert De Niro, and Al Pacino. Every motion and word is said with such realism and emotional power that it is occasionally hard to take it all in. The wonderful supporting cast also lend sparks of brilliance. The writing is phenomenal, and brings to mind such classics at the Coen Brothers' masterpiece Fargo and Charlie Kaufman's Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind. There are a number of fascinating subplots in this movie, but they are all woven together with a narrative depth similar to PT Anderson's Magnolia. And finally, there is the cinematography. As evidenced in the frequent shots of San Francisco that appear throughout the film like chocolate chips in a cookie, the camera-work of The Room is something to be marveled at. Really, what more can you ask for in a film? The Room is an emotionally charged, evocative film. Thanks Tommy Wiseau for this wonderful gift to humanity.
