reviews.review_title: You shouldn't watch this movie? SHAME ON YOU
reviews.content: This masterpiece, or whatever you may call it, is hilarious and you should definitely see this for the first time in theatres with other people. The dialogue is absurd and will make you laugh.
This movie need to get 420/10 stars because this that great

reviews.review_title: The best worst movie of all time.
reviews.content:
No words can explain the insanity in this movie.
The only thing that I can say that can truly describe this movie it to watch it with your friends.

This is simply the best movie ever made. The performances, just flawless. You can't even tell if this is real life of a movie. Wiseau's acting is just over the top. I mean, the way he pronounces "You are tearing me apart Lisa!". Such emotion, such feeling, no actor can compare to his greatness.Well..to be honest. The movie has its flaws. It is too short, only 1:30 hours long. You are left wanting more. The crave..The Room crave.In all seriousness, the movie is horrible, but it is awesomely horrible. Please, watch it with a friend or two. You are bound to shed tears laughing at their quotes.

reviews.review_title: Take a terrible film idea... and go with it!
reviews.content: The thing I like most about this movie is not that it is so terrible that it is funny. It is not that, it is so bad, that you have to gather around groups of your friends just to get all the different senses of how awful this movie is from each individual observer. And, it is not because this movie makes you want to see it over and over again just to really let it sink in, that you just may have seen the worst movie ever made.This movie is worse than the worse movie ever made. It is worse than that. Which is why it is so astonishing that it actually was made. This movie should not have happened. It should have fallen apart on the first or second day filming, when every actor should have realized that this movie will be a train-wreck. And that's the fascinating thing! They either didn't realize it (scary) or did realize it and just kept right on going (insanely comical).The beauty of this Tommy Wiseau masterpiece is that it lacks every quality of a masterpiece. There are so many clichés that the term cliché loses all meaning. Wiseau has done away with them. The acting is so terrible that it arguably breaks the forth wall, the actors come out into the audience, and attempt to continue acting anyway. Remarkable! There are no redeeming qualities of this film except one: the fact that it was made--that virtually everyone went through with it. That it made it to the big screen. It is a work of human triumph...not in the story, but in the making. This piece is a result of the triumph of Wiseau and all of his characters working together to put forth something they could call their own.It's like a human-porcupine baby that still suckled from his mother's teat, was cared for, was carried through thick and thin. And you just look at it, all grown up, and think, Damn, how did they not kill that baby--accidentally or otherwise? "ANYBODY CAN DO IT--YOU JUST HAVE TO PUT YOUR MIND TO IT."People always used to tell me that. I always thought, those people were different. Well, Tommy Wiseau is certainly different, but that saying has become a whole lot more inspiring to me.Well done, Mr. Wiseau. Well done on a job horribly, horribly done.(I gave it a 10/10, but not for the movie. If the movie existed in a vacuum, I guess you could still call it a movie and allow it to be rated...a .000001 perhaps. But for the sheer dedication that was put forth to see that this movie, did indeed, succeed in being made.)

reviews.review_title: You are Tearing Me Apart, Lisa!
reviews.content: this is a masterpiece of love and betrayal i was so torn between the two characters love johnny but love mark lisa was a great character but the way she tore him apart made me sad this movie had a great story and the actors make it even better with their fantastic portrayal this movie is so goood i give it a you are tearing me apart/10!!!!
10 stars. why? because it makes me laugh. don't watch if you dont have a sense of humor though.

This is not a movie one chooses to watch for the love of a good quality cinematic experience, but it certainly delivers much much more then I expected. It's formula for success is (to me) mystery, but I would definitely recommend to watch it and form your own opinion about how entertaining a movie can be without any sort of special effects, good acting, or a good story. This is the most successful archetype of all b movies ever made.

reviews.review_title: Doomed by Innexperience, Marked by Reputation
reviews.content: What is to be expected from a movie so bad it's good? In my opinion, not this.The Room is a very subtextual movie about it's themes and arcs. Unintentionally that is, but still. I can see the machination behind what Tommy wanted the story and characters to be but failed miserably thanks to his own innexperience. Even with that, I can see a very honest attempt here. Since it was written with very little exposition and the development itself of the characters is done through actual "showing not telling"... for the most part. It was not done right, but it was attempted nonetheless.This movie is about Johnny, a good man with a bright future. His growing frustration with the turning of events in his life and loved ones whom are unnapreciative of Johnny and abuse or waste his goodwill for their own detriment. Lisa, his future wife cheating on him with his best friend, making false claims of his behaviour and taking advantage of his resources. Mark, his best friend lying to him, sleeping with his Lisa, not being capable of controling his impulses and hipocritically smiling to Johnny on his worst moment. Denny, his almost adopted son falling into drugs and debt even though he counts on the inconditional and selfless help of Johnny.These are some of the events that weight into the frustration carried by Johnny through and to the bitter end.All this development we get only in glimpses since it is not really well executed or performed on any level by anyone. Were this movie any better at any aspect of filmaking, would it be remembered today?The reputation this movie has gotten for itself is legendary. Special screenings of it are held and packed full of people willing to overact their reactions to the point of being ape-like. Acting as if every take, every line, every transition, every frame was the most hilarious moment ever put on screen. A movie with A-tier actors was made to glorify an aspect of the movie that is not really there. Completely mis-understanding the movie and making mindless fun of mis-represented events. This, I now perceive, as an almost act of humilliation directed towards a crew that at least attempted to get a movie made and succeded. Not in the intended way though. This reputation has led it's crew and Tommy himself to act as if the innexperienced nature of it's making was not only intentional, but calculated and planned. Smiling along.I can say that, yes, this is a bad movie. But not really funny or nearly as bad as THE WORST or SO BAD IT'S GOOD movie I have seen.

Having seen this film a few weeks ago with some of my friends I can say with complete and utter certainty that this is one of, if not THE most revolutionary film of our age. I had heard stories before of this film, but I had to see it myself to be sure. Watching it, I realised it was true. Never before had I seen such a film with so many extraordinary one-liners that my friends and I can still remember with accuracy to this day. The plot was definitely intriguing, and one that I struggled to figure out right until the very end.Moving onto the plot, which is complex yet enjoyable, it involves the struggles of Johnny, the lovable rogue who attempts to enchant his would-be lover Lisa with his charm and wit. However, this fails, as Lisa falls for a young man by the name of Mark, who has troubles overcoming his drug addiction which constantly pains him. Meanwhile, a young boy by the name of Denny tries to cope with the city environment in which he lives, eventually getting into trouble with a drug dealer. Johnny saves him, however, and the two appear to become the best of friends. Eventually, Lisa hints to Johnny that she is in love with Mark, and does not love Johnny any more, but our protagonist fails to take the hint, and everything slowly disintegrates from there on out in the film. Once even consulting the psychiatrist fails, everyone slowly seems to descend into madness struggling to cope with the pressure of everyday life. Eventually, Johnny shoots himself due to the stress and anguish he faces, and is mourned by Denny.The film's greatness is ensured by the amount of skill Tommy Wiseau has as an actor, portraying Johnny. His delivery of one particular line where he shouts in despair at Lisa, who is apparently "tearing him apart", can be considered (and is considered by many) one of the greatest moments in film in recent years. All in all, I am giving this film a 3. You may be wondering why, due to the apparent positivity in this review, and the fact that I gave it an 8. It happens that all of the positivity was non-existent, you were just interpreting it incorrectly.As a film, The Room is honestly terrible, but as a way to waste an hour and forty minutes, it's one of the best I can imagine.-chimaru98

I consider myself a bit of a bad movie enthusiast, so I'd like to indulge the masses with my take on this popular cult movie. You have likely heard that this film is the worst ever made, it's so bad it's good, or some over dramatized rant about how awful it is to sit through. I'm going to tell you right now the God's honest truth about this movie: It sucks.But it's a very complicated kind of suck, the kind only a vacuum could speak of. It is horribly inept in technical execution, it's dialogue sounds like it came out of a melting calculator , and the actors, Wiseau in particular, act with the grace of card board cut outs of actors in a middle school production of "Macbeth". Its score is horrendous to listen to and the cinematography is hardly enviable.And despite all of it, I love this movie. Wiseau is in many ways like a young child trying to impress his parents, trying to do everything a good movie entails but failing miserably at it every step of the way. It's like watching a forest fire. It's just hard not to be enticed by the flames of this disaster, to keep your eyes fixed as you watch the hapless Johnny drift from scene to scene with his array of accents and obscure lines. It's not that it's so bad it's good, it's just so bad you reach the bliss of realizing that you are bearing witness to something truly spectacular, the worst honest attempt at cinema ever concocted. Lucifer himself could not create a movie so terrible, let alone as funny. Its charm, much like that of the aforementioned child is simply too much to ignore, you can't help but feel sympathy for Wiseau and his effort to become a star of cinema.This is not a movie one should watch alone. Have a few friends with a good sense of humor join you as I did, and have fun tearing apart every little detail in this train wreck. By the end of the two hours your gut will be sore from laughter, your head awash with jokes, and pretty soon you'll start every greeting with "Oh hi Mark!" This film will change your life for the better, it's hopeless existence giving meaning to yours. I cannot recommend it enough.

The Room takes the concept of natural selection and throws it in your face; the world is brutal, cold and unyielding, and that you're going to have a hard time surviving in it. The story is nothing more than an excuse to go out and kill stuff, and the cinematic quality is just as unforgiving as humanity's struggle for survival in a world where other races and species are vying for dominance. The Room tries to challenge even the most elite tactical movie-goers, but it ends up being infuriatingly unfair - filling its 99 minute campaign with rage-inducing battles between Tommy Wiseau's character and his internal struggles.I rate it 10/10 would see.

reviews.review_title: The Room: A cult film by mistake
reviews.content: The Room is a 99 minute "drama" film entirely created by bizarre director Tommy Wiseau, an American, French accented, person who fails completely at making any valid point whatsoever on his interviews, comments, dialogs, or the movie itself. Asumming that he is in fact American, you can pretty much judge from first appearances that Wiseau is one of the worst English speakers ever. He doesn't understand the basic concepts of spelling and syntaxes, making him appear like a retarded grown man, or a confused teenager trapped in Ozzy Osbourne's body.Apart from that, reviewing this movie is almost unnecessarily, because there's nothing to debate, there's nothing in this film to be criticized or explained. Anyone with 1% of movie culture can predict from the first 2 minutes that this is one of the poorest intentions of making a decent film. The cast, the crew, the editing, the music, the direction, the landscaping... it's just ridiculous. It doesn't make any sense at all, and that's why it's a funny and distracting film. Because every character or line on the film borders stupidity and non-sense. The hole concept of dramatic relationships and social problems becomes an artificial plot that fails epically at displaying any kind of emotion. Veredict: 30% - WATCH ONLINE The Room serves as a perfect Clase-B comedy for weekends. Watch it with your friends, or your couple. You'll laugh your a** off many times.

It's rare that I consider a movie "one of my movies" from the bottom of my heart. I can with this one. I might've caught a glimpse of my heart's bottom a few times when I nearly killed myself with laughter while watching this film with one of my best friends. That's an experience that cannot be replaced. It's not quite possible to fully articulate my feelings towards this film, aside from "hilarity." But that doesn't do it justice. I probably have never laughed as hard at any piece of media as I did at The Room, by an enormous margin. Laughter is an amazing thing, so do yourself a favor and watch this brilliant drama.

The room is one of the best bad movies out there. Wiseau's acting is so bad, so overdone and so stupid it's amazing. The plot makes no sense and takes itself way to serious. The pacing varies from decent to atrocious yet it has a weird charm to it that keeps you engaged for the majority of the movie. I say majority because the only flaw that this movie has is it's length. It's too long, waaaaaay to long. The last 30 to 40 minutes are a drag to sit trough and you just want it to end. They could've easily done that too since there are a lot of scenes that repeat themselves or are completely pointless.Overall i'd say it's worth checking out if you're in for some dumb entertainment that you can watch either alone or share this wonderful experience with a friend or two.

I love a good movie and I love a good bad movie. "The Room" isn't either of those. It's just BAD. A couple of the actors do their best with what they have to work with but it's very little. It's really hard to say what Wiseau's greatest weakness is: his acting, his writing or his directing. They're all awful. This movie must have gotten its 9 Metacritic score purely out of sympathy. I am, however, looking forward to watching "The Disaster Artist," if only to enjoy how it's possible to make a good movie about making a bad one.

Where to start?! I can't see where any of the money has gone in this film, maybe on ma boi Tommy Wiseau's hair products. So many plot holes but of course there is. The script is, what I like to call, Sainsburys basic and the acting, jesus, it's not good. This film was evidently written for the pure purpose of Tommy being able to get his end away with a young adult. Nobody wants to see his wrinkly chest. Lisa's mother is a joke, she seems to forget who she is and shows no emotions despite being written to have cancer. If you want a laf with your ghee(s) then watch this film and enjoy the final scene, it's somewhat satisfying.

Although this is not best movie's, but also it's not worst movie. A good idea that could be much better. It could be a masterpiece if the director and actors were another ones and script was edited by a good writer. However I like this film.

reviews.review_title: It's so awful it's fantastic and I don't know why.
reviews.content: This movie is a -10/10. It's so awful it's just plain enjoyable. Yeah sure there are plenty of bad movies like the emoji movie but those are just so devoid of creativity or effort they're just eyebleach. There's nothing enjoyable about them. And then some movies are awful, but have a couple of really out there unintentionally hilarious moments, but the rest is boring. And then, very rarely is a movie so bad, so fundamentally broken on every conceivable level, so out of touch with reality, that is is perfect for all the wrong reasons. I'm sorry but this is way more enjoyable than half the predictable garbage Hollywood puts out. It has such a special charm to it, but at the same time it sucks, and I love every second of it.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely terrible in a good way
reviews.content: I have to rate this 1/10 because its an absolute piece of cr@p, but god its good entertainment.I 100% recommend watching The Disaster Artist BEFORE watching this to really appreciate it. You won't be disappointed.
No one can put this movie into words that truly give it justice, it's just so, so, so bad. It is also the best film ever made. 1/10 and a 10/10 simultaneously. Thank you Tommy Wiseau.

reviews.review_title: Its Bad & Good At The Same Time
reviews.content: The Room, is worshiped as one of the best bad movies of all time. From the mind of actor, director, writer and producer Tommy Wiseau, it follows Johnny, a successful bank executive who lives with his fiancée, Lisa who little did he know had been seducing his friend, Mark. What makes this film awfully charming is the dialogue. The acting is awful the camerawork sucks and the direction is terrible. Lines like : "Oh hi Mark" and "You're tearing me apart Lisa" are some of the most memorable things about this so bad its good movie from 2003. If you haven't seen it yet, i recommend this movie for a bad movie night.

This $100 movie that cost $6,000,000 has become an instant cult classic! Is it a good movie? Well that's relative, but one thing is for sure. It's entertaining. From the dead pan way Tommy delivers his lines, to plot holes you could fly a 747 through l, this movie is a barrel of laughs when with friends and some help from MR. Jack Daniel's.

reviews.review_title: It's so bad, it's good. I don't think so.
reviews.content: If people said it's a masterpiece, I would be 100% disagree. This is not a deliberate attempt to make this film so confusing and awkward. The appalling quality of the film was a result of poor acting and terrible direction. Probably going to watch it again for a good laugh.
It's as if Irwin Allen made a love story! Let's all go outside for some fresh air! Not one natural emotion, not one.

this movie is a masterpiece, everything about it is wonderful. such beautiful cinematography i have ever seen. wonderful acting. greatness incarnate. tommy is a movie genius this movie should've won at least a half dozen Oscars here is the description A benevolent, friendly, selfless man who greets everyone with a disarming "Hi" discovers that you can't trust anyone after getting engaged to a manipulative, self-serving siren who seduces his best friend and destroys his life in The Room. Johnny (writer/director Tommy Wiseau) has everything a man could ever want: great friends, a good job, and a gorgeous fiancée named Lisa (Juliette Danielle). But Lisa's innocent act masks the fact that she's looking to bring Johnny down, and her manipulations are tearing Johnny apart. As Lisa informs her cancer- ridden mother, Claudette (Carolyn Minnott), that Johnny hit her (he did not hit her, that is bull$&*t, he did not), Johnny's best friend, Mark (Greg Sestero), finds his resistance to Lisa's seductive charms weakening. Meanwhile, local orphan Denny (Philip Haldiman) looks up to Johnny, and needs the older man's help after the teen rips off a drug dealer. What kind of drugs? It doesn't matter. Then guys play football in tuxedos, because you can play football anywhere. Upon release in Los Angeles, The Room began attracting a small crowd of devoted cult followers who hailed it as the next Rocky Horror Picture Show, talking back to the screen and acting out scenes as the softcore, melodramatic train wreck of a film derails up on the big screen. In time, word of The Room's hopelessly incompetent, unintentionally hilarious charms began to spread, and screenings started to to crop up from coast to coast. ~ Jason Buchanan, Rovi
Watch this as a comedy not a serious romance! If you keep this in mind you will have great laughs!

So, we bought this movie to make fun of it after watching "The Disaster Artist", and it actually sparked a pretty good conversation about art and using particular style choices to make a point. I think Tommy Wiseau is a persona put on to create mystery and intrigue, not unlike Sasha Baron Cohen's "Borat" or Steve Martin's/Dan Ackroyd's "Wild and Crazy Guys". This does have an adult film mixed with bad high school play feel, but in the end, there is a good, heartfelt message behind this movie. I get how it became a cult classic, and it isn't what you'd think.

A cinematic masterpiece? A tour-de-force? No -- a religious experience. That's it. That's what it is. I'm not even going to try to write a review because I cannot accurately express the level of depth, unawareness, insight, and obliviousness that this film captures.If I ever meet you Tommy Wiseau, on a warm sunny day in June, I will say, "It's really starting to feel like autumn. Nice, isn't it?" And he will understand.......*Slow clap*

reviews.review_title: Absolute turd of a film, and not even in a 'so bad it's good' way
reviews.content:
Inept rubbish, abominable acting, bizarre timing, awful music, awkward sex scenes, and a horde of hipster losers who think that this is worth recommending to anyone.
The director gets the last laugh, especially considering the obvious fact that he's a massive narcissist, and most likely a homosexual alien, parading as a straight human being.If I want good-crap cinema, I'll watch something with Ben Stiler in it, or the Rock. This is utterly without any point whatsoever.Even the film that James Franco and Seth Rogan (normally reliable for cheesy crap) made about the actual making of the Room is pointless (The Disaster Artist).Everything relating to this car-crash is a disaster. Do not waste your time. Don't be a sad hipster.

reviews.review_title: Oh hai greatest film ever made
reviews.content: The Room is a masterpiece by the celluloid connoisseur Mr. Tommy Wiseau. Every second of this film is a masterclass in great filmmaking. Kubrick, Coppola and Nolan are wimps compared to the ultimate writer/director. The characters are interesting and the dialogue is something else. I feel so bad for the character Johnny and cannot believe Lisa would ever be unfaithful to him. Mark is almost as attractive but still. There is never a dull or boring moment. It's a must watch.

Yeah... Title says it allI googled "The worst movie ever made" and then this came up as a movie so bad that it developed a cult status and following.After watching it I am not surprised why......And I was not disappointed eitherI am rating it as 1 star (Awful) because this is by no means a good movie, but it really is so bad that it makes it good.So bad in fact that it's own title "The room" makes no sense for the plot at all.Plot itself doesn't really make too much sense either, but what really makes this movie "So bad, it's good!" is both the acting and voice over by Johnny (Tommy Wiseau)...seriously every single scene with him...Well I am not even going to spoil it too much....just watch this movie...seriously

reviews.review_title: this film is the greatesting in this generation of man
reviews.content:
The rom is a fantatsic film in which it portrays the struggles of a man named johnny as he goes as bankerman who gets bvetrayed by everyone he knows including a women named lisa nad johnny s best friend who is cute haha but i'm not habnoring feelings for man, you feel me? anyways i think that this film is quite the masterpiece as it tries and succeeds in portraying johnnys character arc and the problems he facessolid 10/10
cheers, :)
I laughed out loud all the way through it. Read the trivia as you watch it and that makes it better.

reviews.review_title: Confusingly Touching but far too Long
reviews.content: After being out for more than fifteen years, and having its utterly crazy production process immortalised by The Disaster Artist book and film it's safe to say that this movie has earned its place in cinema infamy. And for good reason; there is not a single redeeming element to this film, yet I still find the film strangely endearing.As you watch the film you'll find yourself sympathizing with the actors as opposed to the characters, even if you haven't seen or read The Disaster Artist. After seeing the performances you'll obviously start speculating about what happened, and personally I think the realization that this was made by a fellow human as a passion project is a gut punch on its own considering the reception it got.I've seen many people rate this movie as a 10 or a 9/10 but I don't see it. The first half hour is pretty funny but after that the movie just drags on for what seems like forever. I think a lot of the reviewers have forgotten that as most of us experienced it through YouTube clips and reviews, we didn't have a full viewing, which blurred the judgement of many.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I've ever seen.
reviews.content: Some say it's the funniest worst movie. I say it's a terrible and unfunny movie.

reviews.review_title: The Most Fun I have had at the Movies in Years
reviews.content: If you choose to believe that The Room is purposely made to look like it does and be what it is then Tommy Wiseau is a comedic genius on the level of Andy Kaufmann. This film, like Kaufmann's famous "Mighty Mouse" skit on SNL, comes from nowhere and pushes so many buttons of social awkwardness and artistic convention that the viewer often looks at everything differently. I know, that sounds a bit overblown and if you choose not to believe that the film was made to be what it is by design...well, it really doesn't matter. See The Room, see it with a group of people, bring a Nerf football, and, for the love of all that is right in the world, don't expect to see a movie in the traditional sense. Engineers have the phrase "design only reveals itself when it fails" and The Room is an incredible study in all the things that we don't usually think about that goes into a normal movie. Sure we think about directors, actors, scripts and cinematographers, but when was the last time you thought seriously about props-masters and costume designers? As all of the myriad elements of normal film making break down funny stuff happens. If your secret dream in life is to be reincarnated as one of the robots on MST3K then this is the film for you!

If you are into movies like "Faithful Findings" and "Troll 2". Then get your popcorn ready since you are in for a blast!One of the best movies you will ever see in your entire life!I've seen the movie countless times and it gets better every time.Remember to look for the spoons!The chemistry between Johnny (Wiseau), Mark (Sestero) and Lisa (Danielle) is undoubtedly Oscar worthy!The final scene is so hilarious, that it will leave you in tears. One of the funniest scenes ever in filmmaking history.Tommy Wiseau is truly a filmmaking genius!Remember to watch "The Disaster Artist" after watching "The room".

reviews.review_title: Yes its bad, but damn everyone still watched it!
reviews.content: IMO, a bad film is one that you just do not watch, like you watch a few minutes and don't even bother with the rest...But, damn, everyone I know says they watched this film, or at least most of it... why?I'm not sure, but my gut instincts tell me that Wiseau was on the cusp of a new genre of film, so it does not fit any standards but we still watch it.I get the 1 stars, I mean someone that hate sushi will still 1 star even the best Sushi place!There's something here, and we have all witnessed the edge of a new genre.

reviews.review_title: 8 stars for the best "so bad it is amazing" movie
reviews.content:
I went into this one knowing it was going to be bad and boy was it! It has everything you want in a terrible filmOver the top or completely deadpan acting ✅
Poorly written dialogue/continuity errors resulting in repeated conversations ✅
Tossing a football around having never thrown a football in your life ✅
Cringeworthy "gratuitous" sex scenes ✅
Emotional outbursts with emphasis on the wrong words ✅
Unintroduced/unexplained characters showing up out of nowhere and then disappearing into the shadows from whence they came ✅I highly recommend it. Grab the tissues first though because you will be crying from laughter.

reviews.review_title: From LasVegas July27 2004 screening at Palms Hotel Casino
reviews.content: The Room was an entertaining and purposely disturbing trek into a black comedy fantasy world that causes audience laughter. Just when I wouldn't be one to do the laughing others did, it was all over the place... and laughter did erupt in the audience. The performers were fit for the parts and as this movies world turned, they turned along with it. The flaws and strengths of these main characters were played out drastically, stretching the reality of this dark comedy into absurd levels of all too common real life happenings. Good work Tommy Wiseau!
The room is truly a masterpiece of entertainment, despite being accidentally so in its misguided attempt to capture the elusiveness of high art.I love it, and can't stop watching or recommending it.

Geez, some people said some pretty mean things about Ms. Juliette. Please be nice! She's pretty. She doesn't need to be Cindy Crawford to be attractive. If we all needed Cindy, we wouldn't be up to our eyeballs in people like we are, so more average looking girls must be pretty awesome! I suspect you will feel the same once you age and mellow (and maybe have a real chance to interact with a few...) 
Ok, flame on... ;)

Things I love about this movie:
-Tommy Wiseau resembles an uglier more disfigured version of Frankenstein's Monster
-All the sets are made out of popsicle sticks
-Every actor is a washed up former porn actor...Including the 75 year old grandma
-The 5 lead male characters are unable to throw a football more than two feet
-The 12 year old boy from The Brady Bunch is a hardcore heroin dealer
-Everyone at all times "has to go" in the middle of important conversation or just seconds after they entered scene.
-The "seductress" who is "so beautiful" is actually a hippopotamus with fake tits in a blonde wig 
-The grandma is the biggest gold digger in the game (BEWARE!)
-Somehow an absolute imbecile numbskull rètárdé like Johnny went from being a hotel bus boy to a high powered extremely wealthy banker in the matter of 5 years
-All the horrendous clothes Johnny wears are 8 sizes too big, wrinkled, and ill fittingIt's hard to take the film seriously when the main character is a disfigured Frankenstein with lopsided shoulders, a melted-wax-sculpture face, and speaks like a molasses monster. How can this man go the entire movie without moving one muscle in his face besides his mouth. On top of his physical attributes, Johnny may be the worst dressed human being in the universe. The film is as if an alien read "American Culture for Dummies," wrote a script overnight, translated the script from Native Alien Language to English, and then neglected to have anyone look over and proofread the script. Every line in the film is a mixture of a cliche and nonsense. "I would like a large pizza half canadian bacon, half pineapple pesto, light on the cheese" WTF kind of pizza is that. "Honey would you like pizza?" "Ehh not really, whatever" "Great, cus I ordered Pizza :)" WhyTF you smiling when he said he didn't care for the pizza???.... *Pizza mysteriously shows up on table within 1 minute and its a SMALL CHEESE ONLY PIZZA no toppings in sight.How to write this script:
1. Buy a book full of cliches
2. Cut out every cliche in the book and put all the pieces of paper in a hat
3. Blindly pick the cliches out of the hat one by one, and put them all in a row
4. Go through every cliche and switch 2 random words in that cliche to words that don't make sense
5. Congratulations you just wrote The RoomBTW WhyTF is this move called "the room" that has absolutely NO significance AT ALL. My guess is that the entire film was shot in one room that's how bad the sets are...

I saw "The Room" for the second time in San Francisco and I was amazed how the audience reacted. They were clapping, laughing, and cheering."The Room" is related to relationship and friendship. Perhaps the audience saw thier lives in the actors' performances. The scenery of San Francisco gives us a beautiful ambience which flows together with the music. The words spoken by Johnny, "You are tearing me apart, Lisa!" will go down in history. Lisa's mother Claudette gives us a sence fo bad parenting; however quite realistic. Mark, Johnny's best friend gives us a James Dean style. The entire movie is well made and I would recommend that you see it.
This, ladies and gents, is the best worst movie I've ever saw. I love it!

When first seeing this movie, I didn't really know what to expect. Of course, I took everyone's word when they said it was terrible. But then I watched it, and I didn't think it would be on this level. It's awful, but it's a certain kind of awful, the kind of awful that almost makes it appear like an art. In fact, that's it. This movie is an art, and it is certainly beautiful in how bad it is. I recommend viewing this movie and know that, yes it is bad, but there's more to it than it being bad. And you'll certainly find enjoyment out of it being bad. It's one of a kind, if not the only one of its kind, and that's part of what makes it special.

reviews.review_title: The funniest non intentional comedy ever created .
reviews.content: Never have I in my life experienced a funnier movie . If some of the other reviews make you think that this is the worst movie ever made then think again . There are a ton of unwatchable shitty movies but this one is not just watchable its infinitely rewatcheble . Its infinitely quotable . The plot holes are infinite . The characters stupidity is infinite . The more I think about it this movie seems to be more about infinity than love or betrayal . If you haven't seen this movie then do it . Trust me it wont be your last viewing . Or better yet gather your friends and watch it together and you will be quoting it and making inside jokes about it forever . This movie is simply hilarious . But beware you will be obsessed with it from your first viewing . You have been warned .

I remember spending my halloween watching this movie with a friend and words cannot say how much I both regretted it and felt like it was the best decision I had ever made in my life. The Room is by far the worst movie I have ever seen in my life, but something within me saying that makes me love this movie. It's simply so bad that it becomes good. My friend and I had a good laugh watching this, we cringed so much that it became hilarious. The horrific acting and simply ewful plot became somewhat of an inside joke that we still occasionally bring up today. Nevertheless, although it's so badly made, I think you definitely should watch this film, because if you meet someone who has seen The Room, I can almost guarantee you that you two would be able spend hours talking about it with each other.

OK, so I stumbled on this film masterpiece by total accident. While I was searching for new apps. on my cell phone I came upon the ugly mug of Tommy Wiseau and his deep intense stare....similar to that of man who's been hit over the head with a frying pan. From there I had to download the sound board and instantly I was hooked. I had to get this movie no matter what the cost...and like the speed of Wiseau's painful laugh I had the movie in my hands a week later. This epic adventure takes place in San Francisco, I believe, with a background soundtrack that spins the hits from those classic 90's cine max after dark flicks. Wiseau's screen presence is similar to that of Patrick on SpongeBob SquarePants, comical and ridiculous. I'm not sure where to begin because I'm not sure if this is meant to be a serious script or one of utter illusion and embarrassment. It's random scenes and even more ridiculous classic "lines" are so out there that you can't turn it off nor do you want to recommend it to anyone because you're afraid people will think you ate crayons as a child.....a lot of crayons. I think it can be summed up like this, The Room is a movie that you will watch to laugh, watch to cry, and watch to completely make yourself feel better that you were born on earth and you don't get fed crazy pills everyday.

reviews.review_title: The best movie in movie history!
reviews.content: This movie is generally the best movie in the world! It is definitely a fun rollercoaster with laughs and drama. This movie will always be a classic masterpiece for multiple generations!

reviews.review_title: One of the best times you can have on a Saturday night.
reviews.content: Going to see "The Room" on a Saturday night is simply one of the best times you can have in the Los Angeles area. From the moment Tommy Wisseau comes out to interact with the audience and lasts late into the night, long after the movie is finished when you and your friends talk about what a great time you had and plan on how you will get other friends to come see it with you next time.I have actually seen this movie several times and I can honestly say that there is much more to this film than one can absorb in only one or two screenings. It takes at least three screenings before you even begin to see past the carnival atmosphere of the audience and the comedic dialogue (both in the movie and in the audience).Behind this seemingly absurd presentation is actually a powerful message. It is a tale that all of us have either experienced ourselves or will most likely experience some time in our life. It is a story of love, lies, friendship and betrayal. Within this story lies not only great words of wisdom, but also a grim warning of which road not to take.I would also like to take a moment to address some comments I have heard about Tommy Wisseau himself. First, I would like to point out that personal attacks on him have nothing to do with reviewing his movie. Second I would like to note that all of these attacks (he is pompous, arrogant, etc.) are patently false.I think many people see Tommy during his interaction with the audience and can not understand the feelings they have. Rather than examine these feelings they simply decide that he is "pompous" or "arrogant" because they feel he is unapproachable. It makes sense. Here is a man who has everything many would dream of in Hollywood. He has made a popular movie with a huge following and has legions of adoring fans who come to see his movie again and again. His film continues to pack the theater long after it's inital release and has outlived "the next big thing" time and again. Blockbuster after blockbuster has come and gone, but The Room stays... I challenge you to find a theater where you can see "Batman Begins".. once you have failed in that, come and see The Room.In light of all this I think people feel inferior to Tommy. He has everything they cannot. I urge you all to get past this and see that he is not at all superior. Nor does he think he is better than any of you... that is all in your imagination. Like his character "Johnny", Tommy is just like all of us. He is actually very approachable and a wonderful guy.If he seems irritated or short tempered, remember that he has a life just like you. He exists outside of that theater on Saturday nights. He has trials and tribulations like us all. Screening The Room for us all to enjoy is hard work. He's just tired and had a hard day, but he loves you all.I hope I will see you at the movie. (I'm the big guy with the green bi-hawks in the front row, say hai! <3! Mike!)

Johnny is the greatest character since do I say it (Rhett butler) Is "frankly Scarlett I don't give a dame" Rank with "You are tearing me apart Lisa!! I have seen this film 5 times (Thank You Cartoon network)And only 1 word come to mind BRAVO TOMMY WISENEAu WTF happened to the drug guy (IT DOESN'T MATTER) and the random character who all the sudden became the catalyst for the the affair I need 10 lines so I say OH HI MARK I HAVE BREAST CANCER HI DOGGIE Lisa doesn't love me I'm boring PATS RULE YANKEES SUCK RED SOX What is the deal with the stair case is there glue on it.Why is tuxedo football allowed by Men"s Warehose

I love this movie. It's all about fun, and it's all about friendships and relationships. When the movie started there were people in the front next to the screen acting alongside. People in the audience were yelling back in unison to the actors dialogue on the screen. The people with me were laughing as hard as I was through all the stuff going on. I love it. This movie is cool. I NEED The Room right now!

reviews.review_title: My favourite movie of all time
reviews.content: I am not lying when I say that I love no single movie more than this one. IT IS SO BAD, there is really not a single thing good about this movie, the acting of god awful, the story goes freaking nowhere and the dialogue is as awkward as it gets. And that is exactly why this movie is so freaking great.

Idk how to rate this movie. It's obviously a terrible film, but so unintentionally goddamn funny that it'd feel wrong to give it anything less than a 5. I laugh every time I see the flower shop scene. "You're my favorite customer."

reviews.review_title: Great for all the wrong reasons
reviews.content: This movie is amazing. Now it's a terrible movie. But f you ever have the joy of watching it, you will find yourself laughing pretty often and regularly. This is one of the best bad-good movies. If you rated this ten stars or any high rating for that matter unironically, as is you truly do think that this is acceptable as a piece of cinema... you are very wrong. It is such a glorious failure that you'll laugh out loud. My only complaint is that it is FAR too long. Anyway, if you watch it and then want to know how in the name of god this movie got made, please treat yourself to "The Disaster Artist", a movie that explains Tommy's journey to make this movie. This is god awful. And that's why I love it.

reviews.review_title: It's pretty good, not as good as Monster House, but it's alright
reviews.content: I thought it was alright, the acting was good and the plot was really well written and engaging, just felt The Room could've also had more of the whole house, and maybe the addition of monsters would've been great. Also the lighting could've been a bit brighter, otherwise, pretty good film.
This guy is a artistic mastermind. Best film I ever watched, with a very intense storyline and crazy dramatic scenes. Keep up the good work!

IMDb you have two sets of rating systems, especially for movies like this.If you were to rate this movie as an objective, unbiased (or even seasoned and jaded) viewer, and you were to compare it against any other movie (literally any other movie ever made), no matter if you're a professional movie critic and work for a major metropolitan newspaper or a random adolescent who stumbled upon this, you would most likely have the same opinion: this is the worst movie ever made. You would most likely rate this movie is three out of 10 (and it automatically gets two stars just because of the fact that it actually is a real existing movie, almost like the SATs, where you get 500 points just for writing your name correctly).But the brilliance about this movie is that it even fails on that level. At a critical point in the movie, one of the characters dramatically The protagonist by his actual real name and not by his character name. I'm sure this is commonplace in many low-budget bad movies, but after reading about the production of the film, and how they had to do 50 takes for the Simplest dialogue driven scenes (oh hai mark), this piece of information is absolutely hilarious and mind-boggling, and is a true testament to the amazingly awesome awfulness that is this film, and the seeing this film is the only way to fully appreciate and understand what I mean. Another testament to how bad and at the same time amazing this film is is the sheer fact that I am , a casual moviegoer who rarely posts on IMDb, is taking all of this time to articulate my thoughts on it as if it was a college literature paper. You can tell just by watching it that Johnny wisseau really Poured his heart and soul this movie, and, more disturbingly, his true to life emotional and personal problems. I never thought I would say this but this brings a different level of poignancy to the film. Since it has been released, "the room" has become a massive cult classic (deservedly so ) to the point where James Franco is making a movie about the making of it. Many, including myself, feel that this cheapens the amazing one-of-a-kind spectacle that the movie is; but at the same time it really drives home and gives legitimacy to this unintentional modern cult classic and how far-reaching this movie is. This is one of those films where you make your friends watch 10 minutes of it. At first they are confused and angry and want to watch something else. But after 10 minutes they can't keep their eyes off of it and are captivated by all it's glory. Johnny Wisseau's acting and directing are what it look like if an alien came from Mars, took over a humans body, and tried their awkward and damned hardest to act and fit in like a normal human being.There is not enough to be said about this film and if you've taken the time to read this diatribe that you are obviously already intrigued. In closing, "the room" may be rated a three on IMDb, but in the Echleon of horrible movies that are so that are so bad that they're amazing, it is "the Godfather part two".

I love this movie!!!!! It was so much fun!! My friends and I saw it and we laughed and laughed. It was different in that I felt like I was part of their group and I was feeling what they were feeling. I was actively laughing with them. It was just plain fun and pure enjoyment of relaxation to forget the whole world and our troubles. It really took us away from our reality.The characters were are so alive and real and likable. I not sure if the blond, Lisa, was likable but she certainly held everyone's interest and kept my attention. i would like to smack Lisa, but she was just too funny and I really wanted more.I wish we could see this on TV once a week. All these friend in.............THE ROOM........a place we would all meet once a week???????????I just want more. Thanks, Mr. Wiseau for bringing us something we enjoy and don't have to work at. The sound track was beautiful.
Have watched this movie an estimated 100 times and I don't regret it.

Haha
This Film is a meme.The only Reason to watch this is the laught of Jonny and the start of the conversations.

After I watched this film I felt the urge to rivet a large fan to my mother's priceless heirloom coffee table and use it as a vehicle with no wheels, so I could transport myself to the city centre, making heads turn as pedestrians witness the table legs scraping against the tarmac, in order for me to get a tattoo of Tommy Wiseau's chamois-like face on my hip. That is a small analogy of what this film made me want to do: I wanted to be incoherent like it. I was inspired by the inept acting, the gorgeous utilisation of continuity errors, and the reflection of the ceiling fan in Johnny's buttocks. They looked like a pair of trophies, passionately polished with a buffing machine. The cast wanted me to smear Vaseline on the television as a token of my gratitude towards the un-clumsy variety of age differences, defeating the awkwardness of social interaction between the characters. I would never have thought an 18 rated film could have felt as if I was watching a Universal - suitable for all ages. Oh Tommy, this could have never happened without you.On a serious note don't watch expecting some soppy romance. Expect a train-wreck of bromance, sex accompanied with blatant porn music and overly-hyperbolic grunting and American football in tuxedos. And really, really bad acting. This film has no form of quality control behind the scenes, Wiseau just went "that'll do" to everything.

reviews.review_title: An Uncompromising American Classic. A Nearly Flawless Film!
reviews.content: Redford and Newman. Gibson and Glover. Martin and Lewis. It's Time to add another name to the list of timeless classic cinematic pairs: Wiseau and Sestero. Wiseau and Sestero are as juicy a pairing as any on that list. Wiseau has the screen presence and charisma of a young Brando, and is perfectly matched by a subtle, carefully nuanced performance from Sestero.Although the strong, screen-commanding performances may be the main draw here, you simply cannot forget about the high quality of the writing, something that is so rare these days. This film features some of the sharpest, most elegant dialogue ever put on celluloid. Speaking any given line from this masterpiece is like having jewels in your mouth.The film also features several red-hot love scenes, so natural and sensual that you may find yourself swooning. Juliette Danielle and Tommy Wiseau burn a hole in the screen. In short, The Room will restore your faith in movies. If your soul has been crushed, and your mind numbed, from all of the remakes, reboots and soulless superhero CGI-fests as of late, I strongly recommend that you treat yourself to a visit to "The Room". Let it tear you apart.

However, compared to other bad movies, 'The Room' still looks like something special. Honestly: after watching it, I realized that all our unsuccessful paintings are mostly just weak and mediocre, but not so crazy. Someone thinks that 'Our films and TV series are no better than 'The Room', but I do not share their opinion. Most of the recent comedies are simply stuffed with unfunny and sometimes miserable jokes mixed with advertising, and the series are extremely drawn out and predictable, which makes them lose their meaning. And the actors' acting is just hacky, unlike the 'Room', where Tommy Wiseau gives out simply GORGEOUS quotes that have gone down in history, while maintaining the same absent expression on his face (Bella Swan never dreamed of it!).

reviews.review_title: A fine example of how you can polish a turd and make it gold.
reviews.content: First off, you'd be doing yourself a disservice watching this movie by yourself; this is the type of film you grab a few buddies to watch and revel in its glory. Despite being marketed as a black comedy, you can tell the actors of this movie were trying their hardest. This movie is unintentionally funny due to the over-the-top performance of lead and director/producer/writer Tommy Wiseau as well as...there are too many flaws and errors to list. The plot is basically soap-opera cheese brought to a new low with random sub-plots that are discarded the next minute, characters who appear out of nowhere and deliver laughable dialogue, and stock footage that composes nearly every scene transition. This movie has had such an impact on me that everywhere I go, I am driven by a compulsive need to show others this movie. 10 stars because, frankly, this film was very entertaining and will have you spewing movie lines for the rest of your life with its hundreds of memorable quotes. If you're a fan of terrible low-budget cinema, this movie is an experience that should not be missed! Hats off to Mr. Wiseau for making this gem.

Having achieved infamy as being one of, if not the, worst film of all time it was about time I settled down to watch this and see for myself.The answer? It most certainly is up there.The dialogue is perhaps the most ridiculous, nonsensical ever committed to film. In some places it just doesn't even match with what is happening on screen leaving you completely bewildered but in a state of amusement for sure. The infamous "I did not" scene will have you both roaring with laughter and shaking your head at the ludicrous nature of it all.This film is full of bizarre & random scenes such as playing football (American) in a tuxedo, excruciating long and unrealistic sex scenes, absurd conversations with friends, nonchalantly discussing illness and that hideous out of place laugh that made me fell nervous and uncomfortable every time it sounded.The acting is in the premiership of dreadfulness. I cannot believe that these people were paid for doing such an awful job – there is certainly hope for us all yet. Nothing is said with any passion or commitment to the project. Everything is said matter-of-factly straight from the script pages.So is this film "so bad it's good" or "so bad it's hated"? Truth be told it's neither and is that rarity of just being plain bad. It is however definitely worth seeing to delight in its absurdity.I'm not an expert in film or cinematic techniques (as you can undoubtedly tell from this review) but just a guy who watches a lot of films. Whilst it is true that this is an awful film in its acting, writing, production and direction, it is incredibly difficult to be too harsh for one reason; Tommy Wiseau. Here we have a man, who despite not being the most talented has achieved something most of us never will – by making this film he has followed his dream and there is something heart achingly beautiful in that most illusive of human endeavours.

Two stars is the rating I reserve for movies that are so bad, they're good. One star is for movies I loathe. I do not loathe The Room. I kind of love it. It is 'the' bad movie. Like Troll 2 and Birdemic, this film is consistently inept. And it's all thanks to one man. The incomparable Tommy Wiseau. And he is incomparable. A true auteur, Tommy funded this, his dream project, and kept it in theaters for years until the world finally relented and acknowledged its 'greatness'. The story, the writing, the direction, the acting, the set design, the 'special effects', all combine to form a perfect storm of suck. Watch it with friends, then check out some interviews with Wiseau. Also recommended: The Disaster Artist, a book about the making of the film by Greg Sestero, one of the leads.

Nothing about this film makes sense, Tommy Wiseau's acting choices are beautifully hilarious, the plot is bewildering at the best of times, and the dialogue. Wow. The dialogue. This is why this film is brilliant - there is nothing else like it. It is one guy's bizarre but genuine view of the world built from a clichéd idea of relationships and society, all centred around one puzzling, but earnest, Gary-Stu. This guy made his own dream come true of making a feature film and thank god he did, because it's THE BEST. It's an experience. It's awesomely bad but because the film is so sincere, that makes it so unintentionally brilliant.

Give me THE ROOM!!! I love this film. It has everything: comedy, sex, violence, and catchy tunes. The acting is perfect, the plot is bizarre, the script is hilarious, and unique style is what made it a classic cult film. I recommend this to everybody, because I think any personality can be hook on The Room.  Give me THE ROOM!!!
Hilarious attempt at a movie. Absolute classic to be watched with friends probably with some drinks

reviews.review_title: Now now, it's not that bad
reviews.content: when you're watching the movie with ...... The 'Bots!! Well, not really the 'Bots of the Satellite of Love, but with the guys of MST3K. That's right, folks!! The wonderful crew of Deep 13 are back again to show their love for this movie as they have in the past with such hits as Manos: The Hands of Fate, The Creeping Eye and other great horrible movies. The voices of Crow, Tom Servo and Mike are back again. So don't despair,watch the movie with your favey space pirates. http://www.rifftrax.com/the-room Enjoy and please remember, Just repeat to yourself it's just a show, so you really should just relax. And one more thing, Hit the button, Frank!!!
1 star for the effort, 1 star for the cast and crew, another star for the pure cult awesomeness of the movie!

Just something about this movie, I hits home so well on the interaction of human life. Those actors who starred in it, they were so natural together, like as if THEY were really going through that situation. I hope a sequel is in the works, I'm sure it will make well over twice as much as the this one did. You know what, I actually give this film a Spoon out of 10. A work of art if I may say so. I can't wait for this Director to die so they can make a documentary about his life work. If I was a film maker, because I'm not, but if I was, I would follow this man's life exactly how he does, day to day to learn his creative nature. I watch this movie every morning and every night, there's always something new to learn from it. Much like a famous painting.

reviews.review_title: I really had a horrible time...
reviews.content: ...but thats what i was going for, so overall great experience.At least after some weeks processing time.Still better movie than some StarWars Sequels.

If you are reading my review now, chances are you already know about how bad of a movie "The Room" is, based on reviews alone and how many people beat it senselessly. That, or you read the recent book "The Disaster Artist" and want to see Tommy Wiseau's train wreck in action. I have seen the movie several times before and I have seen reviews of the film as well and the best way to watch this movie is as a comedy. Heat up some popcorn, invite some friends over, buy the DVD, then watch it on your TV and have some laughs. To put it loosely, this film is a comedy of errors. The plot is bland, the characters are worse, and it is also very easy to tell that it was dubbed over. So what? It's a funny movie. It's fun watching all of the mistakes unfold into the train accident entitled "The Room". There are a lot of problems to be seen and they are very big problems and holes in the movie, but you can't help but watch and laugh. It's a fun watch and I would recommend this film to anyone with some friends over in need of something stupidly funny to watch.

reviews.review_title: Omg! This movie is so much yes!
reviews.content: When I heard about this movie I was shocked to hear it get so many bad reviews. But this movie is the BEST MOVIE EVER!It's filled with the sad tale of a man losing everything he had, his fiancé stolen by his best friend.Never have seen anything like it. This movie not only is good but the acting is so amazing. It's like I'm right there in the movie. It puts a twist of real life into the movie scene. Definitely two thumbs up.All I can say is the people who believe this movie will go up in flames are wrong. This movie puts the best to shame, it makes people wonder what real acting is.

The script is poor at best. Its storyline is lackluster. The acting is dull. It is not possible to connect with the characters since their acting skills coupled with poorly written dialogue, spells disinterest for the viewer forced to watch this mess. Sorry for the review. It's best to warn innocent, unsuspecting viewers--consider it a public service.

reviews.review_title: Funniest movie ever. A must-watch with friends
reviews.content: You must call your friends to watch this masterpiece

The best movie you will never see! When i was first shown this magnificent piece of art i didn't know what to think. I am not usually a big fan of romance dramas, but this movie tackles every issue that the average person can understand; infidelity, drug problems, the lack of power a conversation can have unless you are tossing around a football... The sex scenes were very well done and each one had a brilliantly composed soundtrack, although i will warn you there is a few of them so please keep children out of "the room". Tommy Wiseaus acting is misunderstood by many but if anyone can remember the acting troupes that used to show up to your elementary school to perform small skits about the dangers of doing drugs or smoking cigarettes; than you can understand the true merit of acting classes at universities such as Laney Community College in Oakland. This movie is a winner hands down, and to not see it would be like missing out on an essential right of passage. I urge you to take a step into "The Room", you will not be disappointed.

This movie is a very unique experience, to say the least. This movie should be terrible with the prolonged sex scenes, the lack luster acting, and such a ill-conceived plot. Yet somehow, it isn't. It becomes a masterpiece of cinema and its because of the man behind it- Tommy Wiseau. Tommy's bizarre manner of speech, his erratic acting, and his Frankenstein-esque, hobo-esque appearance is so dumbfounding. By no means should he have made a film, but he did. He freaking did because he wanted to. The passion Tommy has is so strong it must have blinded himself of the movie horribleness, thus creating a blindfold of us in the movie. I loved the movie because it was a fantastic laugh and do not be surprised this movie is hilarious. But I believe the real reason its so funny is because Tommy put in his heart and soul into a movie he had no idea how to make so tried so hard to make something so good on an artistic, dramatic level but his incompetence made the movie into what it is, what its better being- a literal comedy of errors.
This movie is legendary but not because it's so great. Rather because it's so bad, that it's absolutely hilarious.

Just because you have a lot of symbolism, doesn't mean that it is a good production... it just means that it can be looked into - if you can manage rewatching. The production value was just terrible. The script introduced characters abruptly and was so repetitive that the audience was throwing fits. It was not realistic, and was not committed to being absurd or surreal either. The acting was some of the worst I have seen in my life. The sex scenes were unnecessary and even comedic, drawn out, and my God, reusing footage (some called that symbolism for the love being repetitive, but I just call it lazy filmmaking. There were other ways to show that). Random 'plot points' are brought up, and never mentioned again (like 'We're expecting!'), and the sets were so amature (a dude fell at one point and the walls shook mad, there were green outlines on actors from the green screens... just make it stop). Overall, the film was a joke. It was an art house flop. Only watch it if you are at a midnight cinema, and can throw spoons and footballs at the screen. My local theatre plays it once a month so people can get drunk and yell lines at the screen. It is hilarious because it is so terrible.

reviews.review_title: A must see, simply for being awful.
reviews.content: The Room is the greatest thing I have ever seen in my life. With Genuinely fantastic acting rivaling that of Jack Nicholson and Robert De Niro, and a soundtrack better than Pulp Fiction, this is a must see. Wait, You believed my Bullshit? Maybe you also believe that Kubrick directed Titanic, imbecile. This is actually one of the worst things I have ever seen, yet it is so awful that you can't help but find it endearing. Although Tommy is most likely a virgin, based on the first sex scene. This movie makes me tired of Roses, spoons, and romance. Actually, I want a dozen red roses. "Oh hi doggy" I have seen it 65 times and counting, and you should too. Watch out for the 5 sex scenes in the first 30 minutes though.

Do not be fooled by the haters. This is one of the greatest movies of the modern age and will no doubt be remembered long after the likes of Star Wars are left in the dustbin of history.The story is complex in it's simplicity in the way it deals with the drama of an everyday man named Johnny whom is in a struggle with his old friend Mark. Meanwhile he is being emotionally torn apart by his lover Lisa who has become dissatisfied with their love life.I refrain from spoiling the rest of this timeless gem. You will just have to trust me and give it a go yourself. Believe me, as you will not be disappointed.10/10 Worth Purchasing on Blu-Ray.

reviews.review_title: This movie is an absolute masterpiece.
reviews.content: This movie is the greatest thing in existence, I would rather watch this movie than be sentient. This movie is simply that great I would kill 6 million jews just to watch it again. Welp looks like millions of jews are going to be dead. Tommy wiseau is the greatest human being in existence I would really like to insert my 18 inch model truck inside of him.
Movies are supposed to make us fan. Undoubtedly, the room succeeds to do just that

Some movies require more than one watch to appreciate them. Much like this film. Hey, when Star Wars first started out, nobody knew what it was and didn't want to follow it. Mark Hamil, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher, George Lucas, and several other cast members could tell you that Star Wars was a dud in the first two films. It wasn't until more word got out, and better portions were made, that it was memorable. This film has a cult following. It is very memorable, very quotable, and not as bad as critics seem to suggest. Critics have one job - to criticize a film. Seriously, you should check it out. Give this one a chance, watch it at least once, very quotable and memorable for various reasons.

reviews.review_title: BEST FILM I HAVE EVER SEEN
reviews.content:
SUCH A GOOD FILM I LOVE IT
THIS IS THE BEST FILM EVER
TOMMY WISEAU IS SUCH A GREAT DIRECTOR

reviews.review_title: Can be described as nothing other than "The Room"
reviews.content: What is there to say about this movie, that hasn't been said already? It's common knowledge by now that this film is bad. That being said, when you quiz the average person as to why it's bad, they don't know. See, this movie's hate cult is similar to the likes of the Transformers franchise, in that it's essentially a bunch of mindless sheep, whom of which half of the time have never even seen the movie. Sure it's terrible, but at the same time it's almost a masterpiece with just how much it got wrong in regards to the most basic of film-making rules. The characters are terrible, the cinematography is terrible, the acting is terrible, the directing is terrible, even the soundtrack is monumentally abysmal in every sense of the word. So with all that considered, why would I rate this seemingly awful film, a 4/10 rather than perhaps a 1 or 2? Well, honestly it's simply charming and it really shows that director, Tommy Wiseau, truly cared about what he was making, which is more than can be said for most films now a days. This film, despite it's plethora of long, awkward sex scenes and terribly written dialogue, was his baby and it really shows. Would I recommend this movie to anyone looking for a good movie? No. Would I recommend this movie to aspiring film-makers looking to see exactly what not to do? Yep. And would I recommend this movie to a group of friends that want to sit back, relax and have a good time? Absolutely!

reviews.review_title: This brings new definition to the word "bad".
reviews.content: If I could give it a 0/10, I would. Believe me when I say this movie is so bad that the word "bad" can not accurately describe this travesty of a film. Tommy Wiseau is by far the most uncomfortable thing to watch on a TV. I say thing because I don't know what Tommy Wiseau is. His facial features are so oddly prominent. His voice sounds similar to dragging your finger nails down a chalk board. He's a polish American; only he was born in America. So I'm not exactly sure why he has such poor English speaking skills. Tommy wrote, directed, produced, and acted in this movie. His acting is so terribly atrocious. He and his cast of characters acted out their parts in such a mundane, uninspired, and cringe worthy manner. The plot is so simple. Tommy's fiancé Lisa cheats on him with his best friend mark. She then lies by saying Tommy hit her in a drunken rage. Tommy then proves his innocence but ends up committing suicide by the end of the film because he believed he was that hated and disliked. Sounds like a pretty simple plot right? WRONG! He some how turned a simple concept into a complex, horrible mess of brainless character development, awful dialogue, and a plot that literally goes in circles for about an hour and a half. This isn't a movie that is so bad that its good. This is just bad. A lot of people say that this movie was intended to be funny. Well that's a bunch of crap. This movie was intended to be a serious romantic drama about a guy who tried to fix the marriage that never was. The most serious moments end up falling flat and they eventually become hilarious for all the wrong reasons. Tommy says "Oh Hi!" about 100 times through out the whole movie. Its so f***ing annoying. The first line of the movie after the title screen ends is Tommy saying "Oh Hi babe!". That is literally how the movie starts. The characters talk in circles. And don't even get me started about the sex scenes. There's like 7 or 8 sex scenes. The actress that played Lisa was so uncomfortable during the first sex scene that they had to take unused scenes from the first sex scene and put it into the second scene. She was literally that uncomfortable that they had to re-use parts from the first sex scene, because she didn't want to film another sex scene. The rooftop scenes are undoubtedly the best in the movie. The green screen of the city background was done so terribly. Its obvious that there's a green screen in the back ground. Tommy Wiseau even had the audacity to nominate The Room for an Oscar! He thought it was that good! This movie absolutely blows my mind. The only way you can enjoy this film is if you are high, drunk as f*ck, or slightly mental. This movie is atrocious in a variety of ways. Watch at your own risk. If you receive brain damage as a result of watching this, don't blame me because I warned you. This movie changed my life and not in a good way. Honestly this is a terrible movie period. I wish Tommy Wiseau would have gotten the hint and stopped making movies then and there. But this isn't his only travesty of a film, but that's another review for another time.
I have nothing else to say. I don't want to say anything else. Oh hi Mark
This film is the definition of flawless. No flaws whatsoever. Perfect. Riveting, gripping, intriguing, exciting, happy, sad, somber, joyous. THE BEST FILM EVER MADE! Tommy Wiseau is a god among man.

The Room tells the story of Johnny, a man, who has a bad life. He feels like he is being betrayed by everyone. The acting in the movie is so great, I feel like every actor was trained by Alfred Hitchcock. The scene in which Johnny kills himself is so well acted, you, the viewer feel like you are stuck in his situation. The set design is so greatly put together I think they should've gotten an award. Every part of this movie is interesting. Tommy Wiseau should be marked as one of the best directors in our history. This deserves a strong 9.
The only problem I had with the review is that it was a lie.

reviews.review_title: A score I truly believe it deserves
reviews.content: I have just recently started rating movies left and right on my IMDb account. I was actually surprised considering I'm not the hugest of film buffs (even though I'd like to be) at how many films I actually remember watching. In order to mark each film I'd give a rating, some films I remember vividly, some not, I'd just give some thought of how much an impression a film made on me and I'd give it the related score. Sooner or later I made it to "The Room". Yes I know, objectively, this movie has miraculously missed the mark in possibly every subcategory you could rate a film by. I'd say that the camera-work Isn't that bad in comparison to other horrible movies, but considering the budget this film had they could probably have afforded a decent crew. Besides that though, the script, the acting, the sets, the soundtrack...all these things are so bad in the most unique of ways. You ask yourself how is this even possible?If your a fan of the Room you know the back story, you've read the book, you've watched the interviews, and most of you are simply fascinated, just like me. The Room is Actor/Director/Producer Tommy Wiseau's brain child. Tommy is well... an eccentric man with a mysterious past. This film heavily bares his stamp of approval at each and every stage of production. When you delve just a little beneath the superficial layer you realize you are actually viewing one of the most deeply personal movies ever made. You notice that all these other actors, they are just forcing themselves to deliver these ridiculous lines that Tommy wrote and it just seems strange. Every character is actually Tommy interacting with Tommy.More skilled writers and directors are able to be empathetic and create dynamic characters that are believably distant from their own ideals and personality. Tommy is not one of those men. He cannot speak in metaphors, he cannot be subtle. He poured out his heart in this movie... the script and he's tried to disguise it as best he could.It's kind of tragic considering the whole world is laughing at him now. Personally I believe a good movie is one that leaves a lasting impression. This movie definitely has, probably more than any other other film I've watched. You are left fascinated by this persona and his unique personality. Watching this movie for the first time will be hard to comprehend, it's a fascinating achievement. Bad is something we can all reproduce, we can all fail miserably at doing a myriad of tasks. This is a movie no-one in this world besides Tommy could have made, an obviously damaged individual with a strange perception of everything and anything human. This is a movie best enjoyed by those willing to be empathetic, those who will genuinely try to understand who was behind the lens and what he was trying to achieve.I give it my full recommendation.

I have seen this film just to see how bad it is. I know about it after watching "The Disaster Artist", which made me curious. This film is worth seeing as a joke. If you want to make fun of a film with someone you know, this movie is perfect. The acting is bad and the plot is trite.
I wouldn't call it the worst movie to be made but it's good for a laugh.

It seems that movie goers and critics alike are torn on what to think of this movie; however for the most part the reviews are negative. to be honest i would probably hate this movie all the same if i hadn't seen it in film class and been told why the movie's so bad. This film spits in the face of what we have come to expect from movies nowadays, because it is so bad it makes you appreciate the salient techniques used in feature films that are often overlooked. "The Room" actually becomes really comical once you accept it for what it is. Its not meant to be a Hollywood blockbuster, but simply a satirical drama to make people appreciate the hard work that goes in to making a good film and how terrible and corny a film can become if its not carefully rendered to fit the public's expectations.
As the 500th review, I have to say the movie is so bad that it's good. There. Move along.
Everything from the script, to the acting, to the cinematography is perfect. It's the most perfect works of art I have ever seen. Thank you Tommy Wiseau

People clearly have no knowledge of Brecht or of film's abilility to deconstruct within itself when they pan this movie. It's about work and film and the way we create false images of ourselves over and over in the interests of furthering romantic relationships, though we lie it's not that. In a real world where almost every conversation starts with 'Oh, hi {{name}}' this film dares to be honest and was destroyed by people so used to the artifice they hate honesty. This is real art, up there with Citizen Kane and 2001. In the words of Radiohead: "Well I'm ok, how are you, thanks for asking, thanks for asking". This is the necessary reply to 'Oh, hi Mark, how are you?".
Loved this movie! It was very very good. Oh hi Mark!

reviews.review_title: The Room: A Cult Classic That Will Make You Laugh, Cry, and Love Every Minute
reviews.content: I recently had the pleasure of watching the incredible movie 'The Room' by Tommy Wiseau. I was absolutely blown away by this remarkable cinematic masterpiece. The Room is a unique and unprecedented piece of art that truly stands out in the world of cinema.The acting in the movie is superb. Tommy Wiseau portrays the lead character Johnny with such a captivating and powerful presence that you can't help but be drawn into his story. His performance alone is worth the price of admission. The supporting cast is equally impressive, each actor delivering a performance that is both powerful and captivating.The Room has a captivating and unique story that will keep you on the edge of your seat. The twists and turns are unexpected and the characters are incredibly engaging. The movie deals with complex themes of love, betrayal and friendship in a way that is both profound and engaging.The cinematography in The Room is nothing short of stunning. The camera work is masterful and the visuals are incredibly beautiful. Every scene is crafted with precision and care, further adding to the emotional power of the movie.The Room is an absolute must see for any film lover. It is an unforgettable cinematic experience that will stay with you for a long time. Tommy Wiseau has created a truly remarkable movie that will go down in history as one of the greatest films ever made. I highly recommend it!
